Author: M. Mainor
Title: Good product
Body: Mixes well. Crushes ice well. Don't like the top. You can't add ice unless you take the entire top off. Can get messy.

Author: Sue Meyer
Title: It broke on the second use
Body: The first one we got was already opened and had been used. (Even though we bought it new). Then, the second one broke on the second use. This is the worst blender ever. All I made trying to make was a smoothie then it started smoking then just stopped working. The second use! Not worth the money.

Author: MoodybluStar
Title: Not powerful enough
Body: It took like 15 min to make a smoothie,maybe because the fruit was frozen?,but still it kept getting clogged,I had to keep stopping it to unclog it, annoying! Not powerfull enough

Author: Kim W
Title: Just like any other blender
Body: It's worth the purchase for a basic blender but lacks in my expectation for ice-crushing, or making smoothies with frozen fruit. The lid is cheap and annoying for me because I have to take the lid off every few seconds to move the fruit around, replace the lid, blend, and remove the lid again to stir the frozen fruit. My hubby uses lots of water in his drinks so he thinks it's a great blender. My smoothies are thicker and take several more minutes. The idea to _self-clean works great. The noise level is high. It's just ok for me. I'd give 3.5 stars, but he gives 4-5.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: RUN
Body: Horrible! Please do not waste your money. Does not even blend chopped watermelons!!!

Body: This blender is fine and I'll use it. Seems to have good power for blending. However, the lid is very difficult to remove to put ingredients in. Requires a lot of strength and patience.

I ended up returning that one too! It was junk! For the money I was spending on those blenders, I expected them to be better than this Hamilton Beach. I was wrong! I saved me some $ and just purchased this Hamilton Beach that I had already owned in the past and am a Happy person!The only thing I use my blender for is smoothies with frozen fruit.

Author: Jessica Martin
Title: If your up for a challenge
Body: After carefully considering options and reading reviews I picked this blender. Things to know:It’s loud! So loud I don’t use it in the kitchen. I shut it in a side room when operating because it hurts everyone’s ears.I have only used it for smoothies. But it’s a challenge. No matter the order I add ingredients it struggles to break down the fresh celery, or frozen strawberries. Making it run much longer than my last blender.The lid is very difficult to remove. I saw this in other reviews and worried; they were right be prepared to put some elbow into it.Positives:it works, just be patient and maybe add more liquid than your used to.It’s price is low.Easy to clean.In all I would not buy it again as I’m a heavy blender user and find it annoying to listen to and to operate. I’m not sure it will last due to the struggle it has daily. My last blender I had for 20 years. It was disappointed when the motor gave. I’m shopping for another blender now with the hope to find something useful.

Author: Elizabeth Binder
Title: The worst blender ever :(
Body: I bought this blender because my boyfriend has a basic Hamilton Beach blender he bought on Amazon a couple of years ago that works great. This one cost slightly more than that one did, so I figured they would be on par as far as quality goes. Boy was I wrong. It's so noisy, it literally hurts my ears and I have to leave the kitchen while it blends. The lid is so difficult to remove, you have to wrestle it off, and its not easy to clean the crevices. It also blends poorly, it couldn't handle cauliflower, banana, or lettuce. I had to cycle through the buttons to get the food moving, even with ample liquid. Just a bad blender all around. Regretfully my return window passed before I decided it was intolerable, so I'm on here to buy a another blender and will throw this one in the trash.

Author: MsSol
Title: Whip it good!
Body: It's a nice size, nice color but Oh My - the noise! Sounds like an airplane. I have vestibular disorders and can't handle loud noises but I needed a blender for my smoothies. I can't always have solid food so a protein smoothie is about all I can tolerate sometimes.Also, the lid suctions on for life! You need to be extra careful if you're going to put that sucker on because if you try to pry it off, it may slip off the counter and crash to the floor. I would suggest putting it in the sink or in the dish rack and taking a towel to get a good grip and try both lips (one at a time to get it off). Otherwise, just put it on loosely (don't squash it down) and put your hand on it so the liquid doesn't go splattering all over the place.I also have neuropathy (weakness, numbness and pain) so I can't lift heavy items - this is a nice little compact blender that I can actually put on a second shelf easily.It blends/purees frozen fruit, milk, fresh fruit and powder protein to every consistency I like. Thick or thin.Pros: Compact, price, color, blends perfectly, easy to clean.Cons: Loud, top lid is a pain to take off!

Author: F. Parker
Title: Ok blender
Body: Let me start off by saying that I will never buy anything from Hamilton Beach anymore!!!! Why? Because they offer no instructions manual in their products anymore. I contacted them in reference to this and they told me that they only offer downloadable instructions that you could print off. I told them that I was disabled and I don't have the means to do that. They sent me to someone else within the company and I explained my circumstances and I said not all people have highly efficient printers who can print off 39 plus pages of instructions and I asked for a booklet. I didn't even get a response from these folks who were supposed to be at a higher level than the people I was speaking with the first time. I got nothing. I do have an old printer that will print about 2 pages before it jams but no way could this printer I have print 39 pages off. It is not that modern of a printer and I live on Social Security Disability making only 19k a year so I don't have the money to invest in modern technology of the day when I barely have enough money to buy food. I bought a blender so I could mix up protein drinks to live off of. Do I recommend anything from Hamilton Beach, absolutely not 🚫. I can't lie and say that the blender doesn't work because it does. After I spilled everything all over my kitchen because I had no instructions on how to work it, I finally figured it out. It works okay. I did try to crush some ice and it didn't crush all of it and again I don't know if was my error or the blender because I have no instructions. All I can say is that it is an okay blender and I wish I had some instructions so I could follow some troubleshooting steps. If you got the high technology in your house and can do these things, then it might be worth it to buy a Hamilton Beach product but not for me anymore, 😠

Title: Not very strong
Body: The blender has trouble blending up my food items. The motor slowly gets slower almost like the blender is about to die on me. Cleaning is a little hard around the blades. I try to use a cleaning brush for that area. I’d purchase a different blender if i had to buy another. You get what you pay for with this blender is all I can say.

Title: Ehh it’s okay
Body: Very loud, doesn’t blend great and it takes too long

Author: Kirk

The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   This item is horrible. It started smoking during the first time I used it (see video). It also did not blend my smoothie well at all. It was very chunky. Waste of money.

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: If you are purchasing as a gift just a heads up, there is no vender box for it. It arrives in a shipping box and it will look like a bear got a hold of it. I purchased it as a birthday gift for my niece's new place and was embarrassed. the blender itself was ok and not damaged.

Body: I replaced my William Sonoma blender for this one. Which is supposed to be high brand, great quality, blah blah blah. But, it quickly fell apart on me. This is far more sturdy and not bad looking. Definitely don’t regret this purchase.

Author: Teresa Rossi
Title: WORSE BLENDER EVER!!
Body: My clothes got soaked everytime I held the handle and removed the canister from the base!All the entire contence poured out all over! I tried it several times as well as my husband - FAULTY DESIGN!ALSO, the liquid comes out of the top when your running it. The top latches do not hold tightly shut!

Author: OUCH@Just1Charlotta
Title: Only used it once so far. Just got it yesterday. So far, Do GOOD!
Body: For My SMOOTHIES on My Weight lost Journey beginning TODAY

Author: Rene'
Title: Beware This Hasn't Been returned Before
Body: I went to make a milk shake and when I turned it on, the milk started pouring out of the bottom. I noticed when I was unpacking it, that it had a lot of tape like it'd been returned before. Also, this comes with the worst instructions I've ever seen.

Author: jennie
Title: Received a use blender
Body: I received the blender without the original box. This item was returned and repackage 🙄

Author: Autism Mom
Title: Mason jar compatible
Body: It fits a regular mouth mason jar. I haven’t seen an overwhelming difference in this blender and others that are similar. Maybe because I only use it for smoothies. But to me the most important are things… cost , ability to crush ice and mason jar compatibility . It’s a winner in all areas .

Author: Patricia Wilson
Title: Blender
Body: I use it alot and noise doesn't bother me because I'm deaf. Smile

Author: Hedyeh Erfani
Title: Doesn't work!
Body: It leaks out of the bottom

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Weak motor, makes too much noiss
Body: This blender is too weak to process frozen berries which could easily be crushed with bare teeth. Almost caught a chunk of unchopped fruit as I drank a smoothie, the settings achieve little more than a modest dicing for anything that requires, you know, an automated system for chopping.

Author: Abbie Moyer
Title: Overall a wonderful blender
Body: This was a Christmas present and I was very excited to use it. It is very large compared to my last one and very easy to clean. I just throw the pieces in the dishwasher and away you go.Two complaints the lid is very hard to get off. I struggle every time and sometimes make a mess.Also sometimes it struggles with frozen fruit. I have found that it gets clogged up easily and I find I have to stop and mix it. The frozen fruits clumps up and the blades don’t spin. Maybe I just need to change my method but it is quite frustrating at times.I am still pleased with it and it gets used in a weekly basis.

Author: Tina-Marie
Title: Love it
Body: I purchased this, mainly for my daughters, and I to make our fruit smoothies. It shops the ice well and cleans very easily. I’m very satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it to others. Can’t beat the price for a good quality kitchen appliance.

Author: Great product
Title: Muy buena compra
Body: Por el momento todo bien y me ha dejado feliz con los batidos de proteína y puré de manzana.

Author: Nichadichy
Title: Broke Vs a nutri bullet 400 w that does fine
Body: Think broke off of 6 oz ice 5 oz almond milk. My spare 400 w blender does that easy and the thing is no bigger then a blunt

Author: shareese
Title: Blending Power Sucks
Body: I dislike the blending power. I brought it to make my own baby food. However I tried to puree carrots and no matter the mode it would not cut them down. And I boiled them until soft before blending. I ended up us my cheap olster blender with 1 speed and it worked just fine.

Author: David V
Title: it is not a product i will ever purchase again..
Body: I came with the handle cracked. The Motor burned out after an hour usage. It's not at all what I would expect from Hamilton Beach. They need to make improvements.

Body: Blender to chop up foods, THIS IS NOT.....only for smoothies. Wish I had used before return date.

Body: I use it every day to make my protein shakes. It is so easy to use. Being glass makes it is so easy to clean. The shakes are very smooth.

Author: Vicki
Title: Great

Author: Mehdi(Mehrdad) Rafat
Title: Small blade
Body: It’s blade is too small and if you pour more than one third of jar from food, it doesn’t mix them good. I bought it for mixing some vegetables and make shakes but that was not a good stuff for this purpose at all. This product maybe is suitable only for liquids.

Author: James Yankovich
Title: Substandard Motor
Body: Immediately disappointed in the the base. The motor had no heft to it, so I KNOW it won't hold up to a lot of use. Pretty substandard choice of motors.

Author: Ayça Gezgin

Body: It's very difficult to shred. Even the softest foods have a hard time breaking up. And it takes my minutes, I go over and over and I press the button

Body: I bought this to make smoothies. Defrosted fruit, milk, yogurt, honey, spinach leaves… not heavy lifting by any stretch of the imagination. Not for this blender! The blades spin, but the ingredients don’t go anywhere. I also tried making milkshakes (ice cream and milk). I had to keep opening it up and pushing the ice cream down to the blades.Also, the cover is nearly impossible to get off. I’ve hurt my fingers and the tab on the cover feels like it’s going to break soon because I have to fight so hard with it.Don’t waste your money!

Author: kenneth ray
Title: Power
Body: This blender has plenty of power and I love the glass container. You can also use a mason jar with it as the threads fit on it

Author: Danielle

Author: Miriam Oliva

Body: Returned item. Did not matter which settings you used, lid would pop up. Had to use with my hand holding lid. Shocked and surprised from such a well known company. Maybe I got a defect, I don't know, regardless sent back to Amazon.

Author: dan alcock
Title: not as advertised, no wave action
Body: when communicating with HB, they took way to long to respond to a simple question, and told me . not to through it away. I returned it to amazon where I bought it and they took good care of me. I will buy no more HB products for my home.

Body: Simple. Glass pitcher. Works great

Body: Mine was in a unmarked box and the bottom was on loosely.There was some dried food or something in the bottom. Looks like a return or refurb, but not marked as such.

Body: Perfect. I usually stick with ninja but didn't have the extra money to get one this time around and I'm not disappointed at all. Blends smoothly!

Title: Excellent Blender
Body: I use it for making Protein Shakes, I am certain that it would perform well for shakes or smoothies as well.

I tried each setting and it still leaves chunks. I wish I went with a different blender but I’ll be stuck with this one for a while.Again such a bulky blender!!!

Author: Amazon Customer

Title: Stopped working after one year
Body: This hunk of junk stopped working after one year. Product support is garbage. They don’t have humans answering the phone and the website throws up an error when you try and contact them. Will never buy Hamilton beach again if this is how they treat their customers.

Body: It’s like a pitcher, I could put it in fridge !I can easily make popsicle for kids!

Author: DCMik
Title: Weakest blender I've ever used
Body: This must be the weakest blender I've ever used. I've owned a nice Kitchenaid blender that worked very well and a $20 Oster blender from a big box retailer and both worked much better than this blender. I've had and have other Hamilton Beach appliances that work fine, but I will never buy another blender from them.Pros:- Glass jarCons:- Seriously lacking power or the blades are not angled properly- Can't blend ice- Can't blend frozen fruit for smoothies- Can't blend homemade salsa- Lid has two holes for pouring in while blending and one does not snap shut - so you have to cover it with your hand

Author: Shala G
Title: Smoothie Fun
Body: We make smoothies daily and this has been the most reasonably priced blender. We have had zero issues and I would recommend it.

Author: Kurt V.

Body: The biggest problem is that it often jams when you try to blend a cup of frozen strawberries. pretty weak for all the noise it makes, but at least it was cheap.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Sucks
Body: This blender sucks, doesn’t chop well!

Author: nat
Title: Don’t even waste your time, you will return it!!

I cut it into little pieces and added water. Imagine trying to blend frozen fruit, Imposible!! The blades are very small with no sharp edges, and the motor is sooo loud!! Don’t waste your time. I never write reviews but I felt I needed to do it this time around.

However, a major drawback is that it does not do as good a job blending berries for smoothies or crushing ice. There will be chunks of berries and ice in the smoothies. Also, the plastic spout for pouring broke off (after being washed many times in the dishwasher.)

Author: Flo
Title: Great blender
Body: Love it works great

Body: I thought after reading reviews that there wouldn’t be an issue. I got for mom for Christmas. But the tops doesn’t secure properly. She has to hold so that nothing escapes. Bummer

Body: The base/motor is nice. The glass pitcher is excellent. Though the lid is horrible! The lid does not fit easily on the glass and the worse part is that the lid has a snap to close hatch door for adding food that does not and will not stay closed so, your food leaks out of the top and makes a mess. Had I not used it, I would definitely send it back.

Title: It works great
Body: It’s Great!

The media could not be loaded.

Author: Karen
Title: Lid Too Tight
Body: Great blender, but once you put the lid on, it’s almost impossible to get it off. So, I have to hold the lid on top while the blender is going but can’t completely seal it.

Author: Aaron Riggs
Title: Buy something else
Body: This product is not worth the aggravation of the mess it causes.In 4 out of 7 uses before returning it, the blender jar leaked out of the bottom. There is some mysterious level of tightness it requires to seal and if you get it wrong, expect a mess.

Title: The worst
Body: I’ve tried over and over with this blender and let’s just say everything comes out lumpy. The first use everything taste burnt and now it just doesn’t blend I’ve had it for a couple months now don’t waste your money

Title: Licudora

Title: Bien
Body: No es lo que esperaba antes eran mejor rendimiento

Author: Baybk
Title: Almost caught fire
Body: Item came used. There was hair in it and food remnants. It had a bad odor to it due to the food remnants. The glass was all smeared up with whatever was last used in it.I washed the item after delivery and then a few hours later used it for the first time. Within 2 minutes, the blender started smoking and smelling like burning plastic. It then quit working. I unplugged it and it continued to smoke for a while after. Ended up messaging for a refund and threw the blender right into the trash after it was done smoking.

Author: Southern Muscle
Title: Smelled like it had been used
Body: When I opened it, it smelled like old milk inside. Almost like it had been returned and resold. Maybe they made a smoothie with milk? Disappointed.

Body: I tried to use this for the first time tonight and the base leaks like a sieve.It is going back

Author: Gorgeous Keera

Body: I love how smooth my blender makes my smoothies. I had a cheaper one last me three years I hope this one last longer than that . Really does a better than my old one . The best blender!!!!

Title: Horrible
Body: Don’t waste your money. Doesn’t work well at all on any foods, frozen or not.

Author: victoria
Title: Poor design
Body: The covers too snug, making it hard to put on and almost impossible to take off. There's also a very narrow channel surrounding the blade, and when food gets into the channel it's impossible to clean without a long narrow object, like a chopstick. The blade is small and so not very powerful. It's very disappointing overall.

Author: Todd Henrigillis
Title: Works as Intended
Body: Works well and grinds ice and other frozen products to make smoothies. Would purchase product again.

Author: Faith Duruaku

Body: I like the quality of it. Blends well specially for smoothies and shakes

Author: Tylisa Callis
Title: Just Go with a Ninja
Body: Broke on the second day I used it.

Author: Harry W. Raser III
Title: Died after 3 uses
Body: Piece of junk. Died after 3 uses making hummus (it wasn't like it was chopping ice or anything).Save your money. Buy something else.

Author: Chelly
Title: Blades seized up after 6 months
Body: I love the power of this blender. The first time I used it though, I found out the hard way how powerful it is. If you don't have the cover on completely tight, it is so powerful that the cover blows off and the contents spray out. My mistake. The reason for my 3 stars is that after having this blender for 6 months and probably using it 5-6 times in total, the blades seized up. I contacted Hamilton Beach and they were responsive and after confirming that I was using it correctly, they sent me a new part since it was still under warranty. Shipping, they told me is NOT covered, but they 'graciously' covered the cost anyhow.

Author: Jennifer Johnson
Title: Great value for the price!
Body: I wanted a blender primarily to make smoothies in the morning. This was an inexpensive model that provides everything that we need including easy clean up and minimal noise. It replaced a 10-year-old model and is a far better option for both speed and easy cleanup. If you are looking for a blender to make drinks, this is a better option than a Nutribullet for a very reasonable price. I do not use ice cubes in my drinks, mainly just frozen fruit so keep that in mind, I am not suggesting this is the best for iced drinks, just blended ones.

Author: Christine Michelle Ouellet
Title: It works great
Body: I love thus item.

Author: @keira02
Title: Great buy!
Body: This was an amazing find and functions well. Used it already and everyday has become a smoothie day!

Author: Karen Nitchie
Title: Sturdy and dependable
Body: Have used this almost every day since received. Makes great smoothies and protein puddings. Love!

Author: Caitlyn

Body: I was looking for a cheap high quality blender and I found it! I love the glass blender. I have made many smoothies and it blends the ice with no issues, blades not dull yet. Very easy to clean.

Author: Glennis
Title: Good quality
Body: Good brand

Body: Pros: It blends decently well and easy to clean.Cons: The top is incredibly difficult to get off (to the point it is painful trying to remove / spilling it trying to remove it). Some veggies/fruits are left chunky like kale/citrus.

Body: Use this to make smoothies and cocktails- takes forever to chop up a simple banana because the blades are too short! Why!?! Plus the lid is a pain to get off. Do not buy this blender.

Author: Ryan
Title: Good Blender
Body: My recipe books recommend a Vitamix but I don’t want to pay over $150 just for a blender. This one does everything I need. Been using it everyday for a couple weeks to make frozen smoothies and works great. The glass pitcher is nice and solid and the tornado technology action works well. Easy to clean. Like others have said the lid is hard to get off

Author: Charlee
Title: amazing
Body: it is so easy to clean and it is perfect for frozen drinks

Author: Marco
Title: Best bang for your buck
Body: If you looking for a cheap blender look no further this gets the done done blend everything just fine not bad for 700watts crushs ice easy with no problem and it no loud at all easy clean best bang for you buck if you're looking for a decent blender without spending to much money I got this for my mom as a gift she love it

Author: Washington Towouh
Title: Doesn't work. It smokes.
Body: It too loud, smokes. It doesn't perform any of the tasks listed.

Author: Eli W
Title: Great value for the price
Body: I got the most for my money with this blender. The thick glass jar will be ideal for blended hot soups, and it does a 4/5 job of crushing ice and frozen fruit without melting the frozen items completely. Easy to clean: just blend soapy water after use and it cleans right up later. All around, I’m pleased with my purchase.I use this blender mostly for sauces and soups, and smoothies and milkshakes.Only reasons I’m giving 4 stars instead of 5: it does crush ice but takes a long time; it’s kind of loud; the plastic lid doesn’t fit very well and the vent in the top of the lid always gaps open, so I have to put a towel over the lid and hold it in place while using it to prevent splatters on the ceiling.

Author: Resident
Title: Blades not sharp
Body: I bought this as a smoothie maker. It doesn’t blend frozen fruit at all. The blades aren’t sharp. When you put ice cubes in they just spin around, they don’t actually crush the ice at all. I guess you get what you pay for! Returning for a better blender.

Author: Chalf
Title: Solid purchase for the money
Body: I do smoothies and you can see the technology has come a long way since my older blender. It really does pull frozen items to the bottom and blends a nice smoothie. Simple, nothing crazy. Solid value

Author: T 3's Mom
Title: Well made blender
Body: I bought this during prime days and it was practically a steal. Its very well made and the glass is thick. I like how easy it is too clean.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Boss likes it
Body: For wife. Says works just fine

Body: This blender is decent for the price and worked well for the first year but now anytime we turn it on, we can smell an extremely strong burning smell and there is heat coming from the motor. The burning smell carriers over into the taste of the smoothie. I reached out to their customer support so I’m hoping they can help

Author: Diyana.
Title: The blades got rusted
Body: When I bought this product , I was very happy with it. I have been using this blender for one and half year. In the description it says that the blades are STEINLESS STEEL, (But it is not true) My blenders blades got rusted, and I cannot use it any more, because it is NOT safe to use rusted items. If you bought this item check your products blades frequently.

Author: cheryl

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: I didn't realize how small it is but that's my fault. Anyhow I'd keep it if it wasn't for the lid. The spout leaks while blending and it fits over the cannister like a Tupperware lid. You actually have to snap it on the cannister and it's difficult to remove. Too bad. I have to return it.

Body: I think the blender works good for what I paid for the product. The problem comes after done blending. The lid/cover over the glass pitcher is a hard plastic. I do not know why they went with this design instead of a flexible rubber design. The lit fits so tight that it takes quite a bit of effort and pressure to remove. I have had to pull the pieces in opposite direction so hard that I have spilled the contents in the glass pitcher many times.

Title: Maybe I got a lemon
Body: I bought this blender because I don’t use a blender often but still wanted a decent one. I also bought this one because it had good reviews. I’ve used this twice and think it’s awful. It leaks. The lid suction cups itself to the top so you have to pry it off every time. The smaller pour spout doesn’t stay shut because it just a flap of plastic. It didn’t blend well for me either. Perhaps I just got a dud one because it did not work for me at all. I’m giving it away.

Author: Regina Phalange
Title: Lasted less than 2 years - bought in March 2021
Body: Average low-end blender. Worked okay for less than 2 years with a lot of maneuvering the blending in stages to get it to smooth everything, then the blender replacement cutter assembly (which ends up costing $25 with shipping and tax to replace from the Hamilton Beach website) seized up and got stuck and would barely turn. My engineer husband was able to take it apart and lubricate it and it's working again, but overall this blender is just average or worse. We tend to go through these types of blenders about every 2 years in different brands in the $40 range. I can't bring myself to spend $300 or more b/c on the cost of the higher-end models, but at this point I'm starting to wonder where the break-even point is and how much is enough. I might just spring for a good one the next time I'm at Costco.

I bought it in Sept 2020. We used it about a dozen times in two years. We followed all the directions and washed it right after using it. We used plenty of fluids when blending. The base was just wiped off with a damp cloth.. We tried to use it yesterday and it started smoking and burnt out. I don't know why it died so soon. We are disappointed and sad.

I make it with almond milk, protein powder, frozen fruit, and bananas, and coconut cream, all of which made a creamy smoothie. Not with the Hamilton beach. Not enough blade action tried every which way just came out blended but no creaminess more icy. Returning it from my old brand.

Author: Ash
Title: Simple and Effective
Body: I love this blender. It's by no means one of those fancy-schmancy blenders, but it's not cheap either. It's simple (it's not confusing, it's clear what every button does and what you need to do), and very effective. The pour spout is definitely a plus! I find it super easy to clean, anything inside doesn't get into everything so you don't always have to take it all apart to clean it. It's dishwasher safe. The side of the glass bottle have measurements on them, so that's helpful so I don't have to get a measuring cup dirty. It's definitely loud, but any blender you get it going to be loud so I don't see that as necessarily a bad thing. I definitely recommended it, if you want something good but don't want to spend a bunch of money on something that's not necessary (: This gets the job done just fine.

Author: Angela Sher
Title: The little Blender that's capable of Great Things!!!
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   I am very big on using glass and refraining from plastics, as I had health scare recently, and was delighted to learn that this particular blender takes Mason Jars! I started to make daily protein shakes for my workouts - it's super easy! I start with my dry ingredients (protein powder, cinnamon, beta alanine, glutamine, collagen peptides) - then I add my watery ingredients such as Almond milk, and a splash of lemon juice. Now I insert the blade inside the cup, and twist tight the black converter - at this point you gently insert the whole thing into the base, NO TWISTING! And gently hit the smoothie button (warning don't use the Milkshake button or your shake won't be smooth!). In less than a minute you got a deliciously smooth protein shake!!! It works better than my Nutri Bullet! Then, come with me for the green smoothie test! Enter cinnamon and ginger, cucumber, celery, kale, spinach, avocado and lettuce + water. Hit smoothie, follow up with crush ice, which is a pulse setting, at the very end. Voila! Green smoothie is ready, and I honestly doubted it would be able to do it. I thought I'd need an expensive Vitamix - no sir! Worked well enough for my needs, and I'm happy with it. As far as noice levels, it's lower than my NutriBullet, and doesn't stink like something's burning or leech plastics into my drinks. So I kissed NutriBullet goodbye and replaced it with this little beast. Now for the cleanup!!! The best part! With NutriBullet the plastic cups stunk so bad after my protein shake, I had to soak them in vinegar every night! With this thing, I am rotating so many Mason jars (regular mouth), it's unbelievable! Also washing them takes seconds - no smells, no soaking, no chemical poisoning nonsense! Because plastics are so bad for our health, and this Little Blender is capable of big things !!! I am very satisfied.

Title: Gets the job done and Okay for the price
Body: I use it probably 5 days out of every week to make fruit/veggie smoothies with protein powder for extra nutrition. It works great and it makes them very creamy like an old time milkshake. The ice cubes or frozen fruits are pulverized in just seconds with the pulse functions.The plastic container on my old blender was scratched and finally cracked so I bought this glass one. I had forgotten how heavy the glass ones are!! Yikes, not good for old arthritic hands and wrists.I also should have looked more closely at the speeds -- only has two normal speeds and two pulse speeds, but it gets the job done that I need done, just takes a little bit longer than my old one did to blend everything together.

Author: michman
Title: Quiet
Body: It's quiet compared to the Oster blender it replaced. The top fits so tightly it's hard to get on and off. This will probably get better as I think it will stretch from being removed and replaced on a daily basis. Other than that, it works well.

Author: Kumar
Title: Works for the smoothies I make
Body: I make simple smoothies (berries, almond butter, water, protein powder, banana), and for that use case works pretty well. I've been using it for 3 years. Please make note that you need to add water/liquid for the blender to work.The reason for my 5 stars is that I was able to purchase replacement parts. Mysteriously, the blender collar had disappeared. I hate throwing away stuff, but it was pretty easy to find replacement parts for this on the company's website. The shipping fee was quite high (blender collar - $3. shipping: $12. Lol), but I was happy to find a replacement. 5 stars for working reliably for my use case and for making it easy to find replacement parts.

Author: Anna P.
Title: It's terrible
Body: The only thing this blender will blend is leafy greens, and it struggles to do that. No carrots, no cucumbers, no celery, no ginger. Waste of money and I'm so disappointed.

Author: Charlotte Hewitt Bradford
Title: Lid doesn't fit and it's like blending with a missing muffler
Body: This blender does the job with all settings but the lid doesn't fit — you have to hold the top down — and it's so noisy it's like being in a jet hanger.

Author: kathryn thomson
Title: Hamilton Beach 58148A blender to puree!
Body: this blender has almost no power, it wont even blend ice, let alone thicker foods. its useless for blending!

Author: Maria Gomez
Title: Worst blender ever
Body: This blender is only made to mix. Don’t try to crush ice or make a smoothie with frozen berries because you’ll only get the fruit stock in the blades -which by the way are not sharp at all!-

Author: Chad Johnson
Title: I Hate the Lid
Body: The blender does a good job on my protein shakes but is almost impossible to get the lid off once you put it on.

Author: AHMED H ARAFA
Title: Plastic Top Cover
Body: Product as described in sales page. Top plastic cover does not fit on Glass jar. Unable to sit close the cover on the glass jar.

Author: leslie peden
Title: Great blender
Body: It’s a great blender. I had my blender before this one since I can remember however I wish it was a bit bigger but it is great super powerful took me a bit getting used to but I use it now all the time!

Title: Very low Power
Body: Did not stand up to a five star blender was unable to fully crushed crushed ice with fruits and at times when it was turned on it would only make noise crush a little and stop

Author: Museeb Sharieff
Title: Don't waste your money
Body: I would not recommend, I opened the box saw the quality and returned. It took me three seconds to decide.

Author: Goran

Body: When the smoothie is done and if you pour it in the glass, the lid sometimes leaves if you r not pressing hard on the lid while pouring. There should have been some type of lid lock to keep it place.

Author: Wagener

Body: It sucks, it doesn’t blend crushed ice

Author: THE CHILIN
Title: Duro muy poco
Body: La use por unos 6 meses mas o menos y no funciono mas el motor empezo a hechar fuego , es una terrible licuadora no recomiendo comprarla .

Author: Kiarra Wright
Title: Wouldn’t buy
Body: Honestly just horrible it’s a struggle to blend every single time I would not recommend even if you need a cheap little quick blender, not worth the struggle

Author: Sophia Sarpong
Title: Power to blend is C
Body: I wanted to use it for purée but it can’t puree

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Doesn’t blend
Body: This product duct don’t even attempt to buy it

Author: Jen_In_The_Fur
Title: Don't waste your money, buy a Ninja.
Body: It says it's for smoothies but this thing took FOREVER to blend everything. I'd have to stop the blender MULTIPLE times to stir the ingredients. It also left chunks of ice. I just purchased the 900 watt Ninja, and I'm so happy with it!

Author: robin
Title: Lasted 5 months
Body: The blender worked well until it didn't. Used weekly for protein shakes and smoothies. It went kaput while blending frozen strawberries one day. Very disappointed.

Author: Davide

Body: I bought the blender a year ago and today after using it very little it started making very loud noises as if some gears broke. It is a pity because until today it had worked well but within a year it broke and it would be nice to understand why also because I paid it $44 which is not cheap.

Title: Do NOT buy if you want a blender that crushes ice. It does not work!

Author: Dasia

Body: the top doesnt seem secure enough, but the blender works very well for smoothies, shakes, purees, etc

Author: CKP

Body: Doesn't chop crushed ice from my freezer which was crushed before it went into the blender. Some foods need more than 2 speeds like frozen fruits to make them small enough to drink in smoothies. Difficult to fully clean without handwashing.

Author: Hetvi V.
Title: Doesn't really blend
Body: This blender is trash. Doesn't blend anything without copious amounts of milk or water. I find myself diluting everything. It's also very noisy and it's so difficult to take the lid off. I keep having to shake it because nothing really moves inside. Everything just gets stuck of the side unless I have a very large quantity. Major regrets but my return window closes a week ago :( please don't buy it

Idk what it’s called) makes it not as easy to clean with all the opening pieces and all, sometimes it gets a bit jammed but that could be my bad putting too big of frozen strawberries in but overall it’s great very happy

Author: Casey Andrews
Title: You get what you pay for.
Body: I bought this to replace an old Hamilton Beach blender that has been a staple for years. The price was right, and there are so many positive reviews that it just made sense to try this one out. Well, perhaps the one I got was defective, or from a really bad production run, but the blender did not meet expectations. It did not crush ice, even when the ice added was already crushed, and certainly did not blend anything smoothly. Everything that i tried to blend in this blender ended up going into the bullet to get actually blended.If you use your blender all the time, I would recommend looking elsewhere. Ninja makes a blender that would blend this HB blender, which is what i ended up getting after returning this one after one week.

Author: Parthinia

Body: Not even two months and the motor burnt-out. All I've used it for is smooties here and there and it the weak motor couldn't handle it. Do not buy

Body: This is the 3rd one I have owned. I will keep buying them as long as they are being sold! My son didn’t use enough liquid and burned up the motor. Twice. I bought this one and said hands off! The top doesn’t come off when I pour and the spout design makes it so there is no mess. I make smoothies daily and just love this one. I have tried blenders, smoothie makers and they all made pouring a mess. If the lid didn’t come off unexpectedly then the part where liquid comes out was nit made fir precision pouring. So mess and frustration. Buy this one. You will be so pleased and wonder why you didn’t try it sooner!

Might also be the reason it broke because it’s just so weak to handle the amount of smoothie I make. Should’ve spent extra $50 to buy a 1400W ninja blender!

Author: Robert
Title: Doesn't quite smooth bananas
Body: I got this as a replacement to a 15+ year old blender. It is okay, and it's very inexpensive, but it doesn't quite blend the entire banana. I make after-workout smoothies, and bananas are a primary staple in them. Even when I break the banana up (which I didn't have to in my old one) it still doesn't blend them. There are always some banana chunks. I think the blades should be more of a 45-degree angle than the way they point almost straight up. I like the glass pitcher and the way it opens on the bottom to clean. FYI make sure the bottom is tight when replacing. I like that it is much quieter than my old one (tho' that isn't really saying much because the old one was hella loud!!). But it is a good by, inexpensive and it seems solidly built.

Author: Brandon Kelly
Title: Doesn’t blend

Author: nmoniquew

Body: It gets the job done after a good 10 mins of blending. It only works well when blending very watery things. Takes forever to blend with ice, yogurt, or even steamed foods. I’ve made protein shakes, smoothies, salsa, and many other things that should’ve been easy but it just did not perform the way I’d expected it to.

Author: playkate
Title: Never able to use
Body: I ordered this blender shortly before leaving town for an extended time so I did not have an opportunity to try it out. By the time I got home the return period for the item had already expired. Upon my first attempt to use the blender I discovered that the lid did not fit and the blades were not sharp enough to chop ice. It is very nice looking and appears sturdy so I was really dismayed that it was completely useless. It was a total waste of money and I still have to buy another blender.

Author: Jasper K
Title: Love it!!
Body: Great blender, got it a few months ago and have been enjoying my smoothies since. I kept thinking to myself how all these ingredients can come together as a smoothie and whether its actually good for you. I usually just add frozen fruits and protein into my drink, but some people like greenery in their beverage so they include spinach or kale. Growing up I ate a lot of kale....but not the kind you think. Chinese kale, I found out that the veg I'd been eating for the past 20 years of my life is Chinese kale. Did you know that broccoli is in the same veg family as well? And Cabbage. And Brussel Sprouts. But the kale we all know about is the hearty, fast growing plant. My mom and I had a hobby of planting these in our backyard. It produces leaves in the first year, and later in the first year or sometimes the next it will grow a flower stalk. After that is the usual flowers that grow out then the seeds. Once the seeds mature it dies, like any part of life it always has to come to an end. Great plant.

Author: Kam Leang
Title: Nice blender but tough to remove lid
Body: This thing blends well. Seems sturdy with its glass construction and its interface with the base is a solid connection. Only part I do not like is that lid can be hard to remove. I miss the cheap old rubber lid on my old blender. But otherwise it works great and seems like it will last.

Author: Ehab
Title: Very bad product
Body: Very bad product

So it doesn't make sense to buy a $500 juggernaut. It does a good job on smoothies and only sounds like a small jet plane in the kitchen when running. It does a good job of smoothifying, grinding ice cubes and frozen fruit, spinach leaves, etc.It's a name brand that should last a long while. And did I mention it has a glass pitcher?

Author: crystal miller
Title: Good Blender

Author: Mar Burgess

Body: This is an affordable and very well-working blender. It is simple to clean and has very easy instructions to follow. I blend frozen fruit with this, and it makes a milkshake very well. Mine was creamy and enjoyable, and I really do enjoy this product. A big thank you to the manufacturers for making a wonderful object affordable and works fantastic! You will not be disappointed with this purchase, friends :)

Author: Shanna
Title: Beware!!
Body: Beware!! You may or may not receive a malfunctioning blender and they WILL take FOREVER to refund you your money back. I bought a blender in early May, blended up oats and bananas about 2 times and after that it stopped working. AFTER 2 USES IT STOPPED WORKING!!! I sent it back in hopes to receive my money back in May and STILL haven't received my money back. It's September 1 now!!! This is ridiculous. Smh. I don't recommend buying unless you like taking a risk on them sending a messed up blender or not.

I had been using a food processor before I decided to get a real drink blender and after figuring out the best way it blends I love it. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars however is because a piece of the base was chipped from delivery upon opening the box. And I don’t know if that is the reason it leaks a tad under base but I hate it does because that little bit of liquid draws ants.

Author: ConnieO
Title: Big Disappointment
Body: I was hoping to replace my old blender with a better one, but this surely wasn't it. First, the blending power is not enough to even break up ice or frozen berries. No matter how long I pulse the mixtures, there are always big lumps of fruit or chunks of ice left behind. It also does a poor job of blending powdered smoothie mixes. Once again, it leaves lumps. The blades on my old blender were so sharp I could not touch them. The blades on this one are blunt and as dull as butter knives. Not worth the box it came in. I've gone back to using my old blender and will donate this one to Goodwill.

Author: Regular American Guy
Title: As long as your fruit is not frozen, this will work fine.
Body: I purchased this primarily because my wife and I make protean shakes every morning and our old Ninja finally broke. Since ALL electronics are now priced beyond belief because of chip shortages, the economy, and government overspending, we decided to save some money and purchase this blender. On a positive note, it works with fresh fruit and veggies, on a negative note, it you use frozen fruit like we do, it's a dud. The blades would not spin and it locked up. I had to dig everything out of the blender and just feed everything in slowly...one ingredient at a time. ( I really miss our old Ninja...) So, if you just want a inexpensive blender to do light work, buy it. If you need some extra juice for your juice, spend some more money on a more powerful blender. Oh! And the lid will NOT stay on the blender. You have to hold it down the entire time you are using it or it will pop up on you.Hope this helps.

Author: Anne L. Watson
Title: SOME of the contents get blended
Body: A lot falls under the blade. It's useless.

Body: Fairly quiet. Very very strong. Only a few buttons which I like. Easy to use and clean. I use it every day and no complaint whatsoever.

Author: Clayton Vondriska
Title: Used it 10 times before it shorted
Body: While it worked, it was a decent blender. But after only 10 or so uses, something shorted and the blender stopped working. If you’re in the market for a blender, look for a brand with more longevity. Even a cheap blender should last a year. Very disappointed and frustrated that I need to replace a blender AGAIN.

Author: Denank
Title: Blender
Body: I make a lot of smoothies using frozen fruits and this product works ok, but doesn't completely blend them as I would like. It leaves tiny bits and pieces that you can feel when drinking the smoothie.

Author: Brian C.
Title: Blending power not as strong as expected.
Body: Blending power not as strong as expected.

Author: Angela Devilleres
Title: NOT FOR SMOOTHIES!!! Unfortunately, this has become a closet appliance!
Body: I was going to return this .. but due to health issues, I couldn't get it done in time.This was originally bought for making healthy drinks, such as smoothies etc.However, this failed in the most important department *CRUSHING ANYTHING FROZEN* I tried so many ways to get this blender to crush ice & frozen fruit completely with no avail.My daughter had to shake the blender and then we even had to take a utensil to try to get the ice or frozen fruits to the bottom where the blades are for it to continue crushing (because it doesn't come with a stick for that) this is with liquid in it as well.I was so upset that the description for this item was just a TRAP to buy it .. and unfortunately for those who are on a fixed income or very limited kitchen space is just SOL.So, since the 2nd day that this was recieved .. it's has been stored in the closet, because it's not a Blender that can handle any type of SMOOTHIE or CRUSHING ICE OR FROZEN FRUITS!!!If you want to use this for anything other than Blended drinks with crushed Ice or Fruits, then that's great. It has great power and is easy to clean.JUST ... NOT RECOMMENDED IF YOU WANT IT FOR SMOOTHIES ... Save your money!!!!

Author: julie t.
Title: Poor design
Body: Plastic Lid would not stay onI wasn

Author: Greg Perry
Title: Sound appliance
Body: It is well make as well as sturdy

Author: John Michaelson
Title: Very noisy, takes a lot to work...
Body: This is maybe one of the least good blenders I've seen in my life. It sits there in the smoothie mode just loudly whirling and not doing anything. I shut it off, take a stick, and jam everything down and still barely anything until like literally 2 minutes of whirling loudly, it finally catches on something and then makes my smoothie. And it is LOUD! Very loud! Neighbors can hear it. My wife was downstairs and I thought she was running the carpet cleaner.We are not impressed. We got exactly what we paid for - cheap blender, works cheaply. Glad other people have better luck with theirs but I don't see how. This is hardly a defective machine, it works, but just not like a good blender would.

Author: Betty Singletary
Title: It s great
Body: I like the multiple uses.

Author: Kathleen
Title: Great blender. Great price. Very well packed. Shipping was right on time!
Body: This blender is great for me. I’ve not been disappointed at all. It isn’t loud. It’s a breeze to clean. And it’s a nice looking blender!

Author: Lillianna
Title: Not for smoothies
Body: Don’t know why is so hard to find a blender to make smoothies. Is that not what they are made for? I don’t use ice just fruit, leafy greens and milk. Doesn’t work without a lot of manual finessing(sticking spoon in to stir and compact in between blending). Save your money up for a more expensive blender that actually blends.

Author: MJL
Title: Thick plastic lid
Body: I am happy and disappointed at the same time about this blender. The lid is a thick plastic with a pouring spout but to get it off the glass container takes a bit of strength. You have to pull hard it's not that easy, but I suppose liquid would come out when you don't want it to if it were not tight. All in all, this is a nice blender for the price. It does what it is made for blending, mixing, pouring perfect.

Author: LoriAnn Coker
Title: Powerfully Perfect
Body: I bought tbis for juicing. My bullet was packed because we were selling our house and I wanted to start juicing again.I researched many blenders and came across this one.The product is built strong, it looks good love the glass and the price was in my budget.Most importantly, it does the job perfectly! Easy to clean!I highly recommend this product!

Author: Teresa A. Rodriguez
Title: Disappointed
Body: I don’t like to write bad reviews, but I was disappointed with the grating operation of this blender. I made cookie crumbs with Oreos and it took forever- I wished that I just smashed the cookies with a hammer instead.I ended up returning this product ; I purchased it because of the GLASS container which I highly preferred over plastic containers. Keep looking for another blender- my opinion .

Author: Eagle U.P.
Title: Cavitation w/o blending
Body: Absolutely useless for making milkshakes. The primary purpose for the purchase. Necessary to stop and manually push ice cream down.

Author: Theresa
Title: Works
Body: Got it to make smoothies and blend. It's great

Author: Lynne M. Mcdonald
Title: Doesn’t really make a smoothy
Body: Does not make ice into smoothy

Author: dennis214
Title: Hamilton Beach Blender
Body: Great Blender, performs great and does all the blending I need it to do. However, the writing on the front of the blender, the label for the functions is disappearing slowly. I won't be able to see what speed to put the blender on. They could have made it better so it doesn't wash off eventually.

Author: JD
Title: Leaks at base
Body: I purchased this blender on Prime Day. My partner used it once. It was cleaned and put in the cabinet. Weeks later, we pull it out to make some iced coffee. The liquid started coming out the bottom of the blender. We poured it into a separate container, assuming we had mis-threaded the base. After taking it apart, we carefully reassembled the jar, ensuring the gasket was lined up correctly and base properly screwed on. We poured the liquid back in and attempted to blend. Again the liquid began coming out of the base. This was only the second time using the blender. It doesn’t seal correctly and makes a mess all over the counter.I suppose it’s worth noting the plastic on the lid and base are both fairly flimsy. This may be why it is not be holding the seal.

Author: Melissa Tamborello
Title: Waste of money!
Body: It lasted for two months, it started over heating and stop working.

Author: Loretta H.
Title: Blender is nice.
Body: It works well. Ice doesn't crush as easy as I'd like. Ice gets trapped under blades and stops the blade.But, it does blend other things.

Author: Rachel
Title: Will Not Resucitate
Body: I had this blender for about a month now (purchased early June 2022). Fresh out of the box, it was perfect. Did everything I need it to do - especially as a protein shake/smoothie person. It even crushed iced for cocktails great. One day out the blue a month into this thing, I'm making vinaigrette for a salad (nothing fancy - oil, balsamic, fresh basil), and it completely poops the bed. Won't turn on. There's no button to reset. Tried every outlet in the house... Nada.Thinking I should call the manufacturer at this point - since I still have the dang box for this practically new blender - and the phone number for their offices is just as dead as the motor on my blender. Great! Tried going through Amazon, and apparently this is a manufacturer specific issue. De-Friggin-Lightful!So now, I'm about to Office Space a brand new blender - while I run to Walmart for the good Oyster blender I should've gotten in the first place. Do yourself a favor, and just eat the trip to the store, at least they don't have you run around the entire internet trying to fix something an allegedly streamlined Amazon or Hamilton Beach (which is usually a spot on brand for everything else) should've had a grip on.

Author: FRANK CAT
Title: Good low cost blender
Body: Inexpensive and easy to use and clean. Not the best power but good enough for most purposes.

Author: Graciela
Title: Me encanto la licuadora
Body: Me facina mi licuadora

Author: Adriana
Title: Not a very powerful blender.
Body: I needed a new blender last minute and this was my only option. I ended up returning it because it just was not powerful to make a vegetable puree. the blades are super tiny and it cannot blend parsley or cilantro.

Author: Grizzles
Title: I'm Amazed
Body: After researching blenders from $25 to $250, I decided on this one after reading the reviews. The review posted by Jesse Lidgey prompted me to get this one. I can't believe the quality of this rather inexpensive one. My husband makes smoothies nearly every day and this blender does it quickly and efficiently. We've probably made 40 smoothies since I bought it and they come out perfect every time. Good looking blender as well, so I don't have to hide it in the pantry. Love this blender.

Author: Keek

Body: This blender is so loud and blends nothing. Not frozen fruit, not ice. Nothing. Everything just moves to the side and goes under and around the blades. I’ll be returning this immediately.

Body: I bought this blender after my Oster broke. I use the blender for smoothies. I bought this one because it was so reasonably priced. I am very happy with it.

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: Blender is nice looking works fine But the lid is made very cheap hard to place on and take off, don’t buy this one

Title: It's ok .......
Body: This blender did not do the job the manufacturer says it does. It's not an ice crusher nor does it blend frozen fruits. The blender just throws the food on top of blades a never let's it fall down so it gets stuck there no not convenient no not helpful no I'm not . After putting a lot of milk into the mix it worked better but i didn't want this but oh well the glass on this thing is really thick and looks sturdy the blades are just metal beaters that mash and beat the food around . I let the blender run for a long time to see if it would make up it's mind if it was going to work or not it did I did a load of laundry.... kidding no it's ok if you're not in a hurry.

Author: Ahmad
Title: Worst blender ever
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   Whoever created this must have been high. Nothing about this blender is good. First of all, why is it even called a blender if it can’t blend as seen in video? This is the third different time I try it. And there was only soft frozen fruits in there and couldn’t even blend that. It just moves everything to the side and stays like that. No matter how many times I stop and scoop, useless. Second, what the fudge is up with the lid?? Like how the hell do they not test these things before releasing them? How do they not see how IMPOSSIBLE it is to remove that lid?! I’ve broken 4 nails and almost chipped a tooth (I was desperate) trying to remove that piece of 💩 off. Ladies with expensive nails- do NOT, I repeat, do NOT BUY THIS BLENDER. Consider yourself warned. Also EVERYONE, do not buy this blender unless you like very loud noise while watching your product do nothing.

Author: Mnkdm

Author: Hannah Monday

Author: chrisjweaver

The first couple times, we had a ton of difficulty of getting it to actually blend. Tonight we used it and it started smoking, crackling and literally caught fire in our kitchen!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Author: Kindle Customer

Recipe says to blend for seven minutes which I did and burned out the motor. It has been used about 3 times. NOT VERY RELIABLE !! I don't know if I would purchase another one.

Author: Bambina

Author: A. Keesee
Title: Too Hard to Use
Body: I ordered this blender to replace my nutribullet that I had had for over 10 years. The blender itself is very basic. which I expected. It does not crush ice well, even on the proper setting but I could overlook that. Unfortunately, the top is too hard to get on and off. This is NOT the blender for anyone with any type of mobility issues such as arthritis. It hurts my hands to try to pry the top off. Also the access portal on the top is either stuck closed or, once it is open, it is stuck open. I would not recommend this model to anyone.

Author: Kindle Customer

Body: Blender works but arrived cracked on plastic ring that screws to base of pitcher.

Author: Felipa flores

Author: PitSki
Title: Nope
Body: Nope, nope, nope. The glass pitcher is super heavy and don't even get me started on the lid! Once it's on, it's never coming off. After I was eventually able to pry the lid off, I had turned the pitcher upside down, thank goodness it was empty. When I discovered that feature, it went directly back in the box to be returned.

Author: Frank
Title: Great unit for the money.
Body: Not the best for chipping ice but otherwise a great unit at a great price.

Author: virg
Title: Great milkshakes
Body: Love the glass pitcher with the pour spout. The lid snaps onto the pitcher which is also nice. Much quieter than my previous Oster and blends faster and better. So easy to clean. Simply rinse add some water and a small amount of dish soap and blend for 10 seconds. Great!

Author: S TOMS
Title: I like it.
Body: It's okay. Smaller than I imagined.

Author: Adam
Title: Motor burned up after 3 months of infrequent use
Body: Motor burned up after 3 months of infrequent use. Went to blend this afternoon and the unit heated up and wouldn’t blend. I use this blender maybe once a week? Definitely a very short lifespan on these. Save your money and spend a little more for something nicer and more durable. Now shopping for a new blender

Author: C d.

Body: First we tried water and ice it wouldn’t except chop or chip the ice. So we tried frozen strawberries blackberries and blueberries with yogurt and a little water mind you plenty of water to make a smoothie. It was terrible wouldn’t even slice the strawberries. Please don’t waste your time.

Author: Jared
Title: Mediocre cutting power.
Body: Personally, I am not happy with the purchase. I'm new to cooking and wanted to use it to chop vegetables. This is not something it is good at. I imagine when I go to make a smoothie it'll get the job done but I am already expecting that it will have some large chunks left over. I regret not just buying a superior blender.

Author: Sire Natty
Title: Efficient and Worth the price
Body: I was so geeked up to receive my blender. It feels good having to blend my fruit smoothly. It's not as noisy as anticipated and easy to clean.

Author: tahsen

Author: farod

Body: I like the size and it isn't so noisy. Very easy to dismantle and clean. But the blending poeer fell a bit short for me while making smoothies. Overall, it is a good product.

Author: Robert Lappin
Title: Broke 3rd time I used it - No return" option even though it's only been 2 weeks !?!?!?"
Body: Broke 3rd time I used it - No return option even though it's only been 2 weeks !?!?!?Was able to make 2.5 smoothies with it before it broke ... just stopped completely - had to plug in can opener to make sure it wasn't the outlet ... UGH!

Author: Dustin P.

Body: Everything works ok for the money. But it bogs down especially with frozen fruit. It clumps up and you have to keep stopping to break it up and stir it to continue making smoothies

Author: Jane Briggs
Title: Missing part in order
Body: I received this Hamilton Beach blender yesterday and it was lacking a critical part to work. I have called Hamilton Beach and sent email with no response. I have tried to talk to someone at Amazon but no luck. So I’m placing my complaint here. I needed the blender soon so need the Collar that’s missing in the box. I disliked that no one can tell me anything about a missing part! Amazon is going to have a problem if they are selling Hamilton Beach products and customers can’t get in touch with them. If you call the number in the instructions they tell you to email any issues. I still haven’t got any response from email and not sure if email was correct. No way to talk with anyone.

Author: Robert Smith

Body: I have to put on my headphones because this sucker is so loud! And I have less than 50% hearing.

Body: Not enough power for blending fruit in with your smoothies. I should of returned. Stick with the Ninja Blender..

Author: Paul Ahern

Author: Diana Cortes

Body: Low power. My 13 year old blender did a better job making salsa. The nose level wasn't much quiet enough worth mentioning.

Author: The Melvin’s

Body: Made my first smoothie in it today and it works! I’ve never had another blender and don’t intend to get another now that I have this one!

Author: Nicole Harvey
Title: Cannot get lid off
Body: The lid is near impossible to get off. I kept it because I thought it may get easier to get off after more usage, but it has not. Sadly I just missed the return window, as I wish I could return.

Author: Jesus Ruiz
Title: Better quality on this products.
Body: Not working as I expected, and you have to keep pressure the buttons to blend your species or your vegetables.

Author: Brittany
Title: No, no, no!
Body: This thing just doesn't have much power to truly blend. Made my kids smoothies (with kale or other leafy veggies) and no matter how long i let it run it still has small chunks. Not very appetizing. Wish I could return it but it's after the cutoff. Need to upgrade to something that has some muscle!

Author: mizugakun
Title: Cannot blend what I want where other machine can do it easily.
Body: It cannot blend frozen or hard stuff: the size of the knife is too small to create a flow that blends all material (including ice) in the container. Cleaning is pain in the *ss as well since the glass is heavy and the shape of it makes it not easy to clean. The material of the lid is made by something very cheap and it is hideous. Machine itself can be broken very easily because it is too fragile. To conclude, the functionality is not good, it's not easy to clean, and the materials are cheap. I had very bad experience with this machine and regretted for purchasing this piece of garbage.

Author: Cassandra day
Title: Smoothies
Body: Bought to make smoothies blended everything perfectly with ease

Author: Ann S
Title: Great blender for making frozen coffee drinks.
Body: I specifically searched for a blender for making frozen cappuccino coffee due to the cost of buying this type of coffee at Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts. This blender has buttons for milkshakes, smoothies, iced coffee, and to puree. I buy Mocha Cappuccino in the bottles and will make frozen cappuccino ice cubes in a silicon ice cube tray so the cubes will come out easily into the blender. I then take a refrigerated bottle of the cappuccino and pour it over the cappuccino ice cubes, add chocolate and Carmel syrup, and pulse the mixture together and have the best frozen mocha cappuccino coffee. Thank you.

Author: Diamond Tierra
Title: Eh…
Body: Great blending power but it leaks

Author: Derek Evans
Title: Average Blender
Body: Does this blender blend? Yes and no. The worst part of this blender is the very narrow area where the blades are. If you are looking to crush ice as the title of the product suggests, good luck. Best situation, you push the ice down with the other items you want to blend or blend the ice inside of a liquid. Without anything helping the ice move in the blender the ice will just bounce against the blade for a few minutes before, 'maybe', crushing. Additionally, if you have enough thick liquids or frozen items this blender cannot blend all the way through. I add frozen strawberries, yogurt, milk, and fresh bananas to this thing and the bottom 50% mixes and the top half just sits there.I have used this blender for a year, almost daily for a few months and it does work. But if you compare this to a Nutribullet - no challenge. I literally used my Nutribullet for the first time and went woah. Not from the Nutribullet itself, but just how much better it is than this blender.

Author: Truth Seeker
Title: Too Noisy-Wear Ear Plugs!
Body: I think it is too noisy and I often smell something like burned motor or something after blending. It does blend for smoothies but often leaves some fruit unblended. This blender actually scares me a bit due to the noise level. Not much fun to use. One thing you have to use a lot of water for chopping to cover the vegetable....I am going to try cole slaw soon. I used a very used Oster basic blender for years and liked it much better. Wouldn't have bought this one if I had to do it over again. Please use ear plugs when using as not good for ears!

Author: Anna
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: This blender doesn’t blend anything! The blades don’t even cute through the strawberries!

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: Bought this blender after reading all the wonderful reviews. Now sending it back after 2 weeks for many reasons as I am not happy. The lid , once closed , is almost impossible to open. I had to blend holding it down with my hands with the lid half closed. The blender works well , but it occasionally leaks. Should not be doing that especially since it is only 2-3 weeks old. RETURNING IT !!!! Buy with extreme caution. Do not recommend.

I mainly got this for smoothies--I just have spinach, frozen fruit, and some juice, and it struggles to blend them all. By the time it's all done, the smoothie is just super runny.Don't recommend if you're using it for anything other than making sauces or something.

No mode seems to make the blended smoothie consistency that you get at Jamba. Also, the top looks like they glued multiple pieces together. Overall, the quality is subpar.

Author: fotroofgrl
Title: Don't waste your money.
Body: I should have trusted the negative reviews. This is the WORST blender I've ever owned. I've been making smoothies for a very long time - I know how it works. This blender can't even handle the softest of overripe banana and milk. Like, it just sort of stirs the milk and doesn't touch the fruit. Perish the thought of adding frozen berries! When you look at the blades, they are the dullest pieces of metal you could imagine - I'm wondering if someone forgot to actually sharpen them, because there is NO edge at all on these babies.If it worked, I could tolerate how loud it is, but it's just not worth it. Save your money and get a different blender.

Body: Has trouble blending bananas like really ?

Author: hawkmtp
Title: Works great
Body: I use it to make thick frozen smoothies.

Author: J.L.
Title: For the price, not bad, but underpowered for me
Body: Received this as a gift after owning a Ninja 1500W, which itself is no BlendTec/Vitamix. Unfortunately this Blender struggles with even watered-down smoothies and some frozen fruit. That's because this blender is actually 700W PEAK power, which basically means that's the power when the blender initially turns on and them plummets. If it runs continuously at that load, it will burn up. Mine routinely starts bogging down (again pitcher full of lukewarm water and no ice added) and you can tell the motor won't last. Looking at the specs of the motor itself on the base, it says 120V/3.7A; that means it's actually a 450W continuous motor.If you're blending lighter stuff and a little more patient then I think it could maybe work. The interlocking mechanism with the base feels nice. The glass pitcher is nice. The lid, however, fits WAY too snuggly on the top that I who crank out forearm and finger exercises struggle. I can't imagine a nice old granny trying to pry the lid off...Not saying you need to go with the $400+ models, but find something with at least double the wattage, I'd say. Both Oster and GE have some more powerful, moderately-priced blenders I'm looking into.

Author: Rayon Anderson
Title: It's worth the buy

Author: Dan Bechtol

Author: J. Smith
Title: Great Blender for Smoothies
Body: I have been using this blender for a couple of weeks now and I like it! I consider the amount of noise it makes to be average, not exceptionally quiet or loud either way. It is pretty easy to clean and the shape of the pitcher makes it easy to pour into a cup. I will say the thing that I love is the shape of the blade, the blade is separated vertically so I don't need to always stop the blender and shake it to remove the air pocket created by traditional blenders. I just turn it on and it continues to blend without getting stuck by the air pocket. Would definitely recommend!

Author: Star
Title: Waste of money - totally not as advertised.
Body: This is a piece of crap. It says it has several blending speeds and it only has two speeds. It only as 5 buttons, one of which is the off button; two are 'pulse' buttons, the remaining two are medium and low. That's it. It does not blend ice. It does not blend beans. It does not blend a combination of things as in a recipe. It will blend eggs. LOL..big deal for that. So will a fork. I am really angry at how misleading the info is and how I wasted my money and I'd love to get my money back, but no go on that. The warranty is only for damage done on their end. Don't waste your money. I'm sorry I did.

Author: My experiences
Title: It works well as a blender - not a food processor substitute
Body: This isn't a Vitamix by any stretch of the imagination. But it's I think it's a decent value for the price. Where else can you get a 40oz 5 speed blender with a glass pitcher for under $40 USD? I picked this blender for a couple of reasons1. The previous blender I had for over 15 years was a Hamilton Beach2. The toaster I have is also a Hamilton Beach, which I’ve had for over 20 years.Do I like it? I think so...Short recap of below1. For a sub $50.00 blender I like it. It works well2. I really like the (heavy) glass pitcher. This is the main reason why I purchased it.3. I like the base (motor) it feels solid, and it works very well4. It’s quieter than my old Hamilton Beach blender, which is my only point of reference. For me that’s good.5. The button feel very similar to my old blender which lasted a long time, so that too is good.6. I REALLY don’t like how hard the top is to remove7. I don’t like the cheap feel of the plastic bits attached to the pitcherWhat I like1. I like the glass pitcher - yes it's heavy but it's also made of glass thick enough to withstand crushing ice relatively quietly. Plastic pitches sound like they may shatter in the process.2. I like that the bottom screws off making the pitcher and blades easy to clean.3. I like the several blending options (though I use the two pulses more than the other 3 options).4. It makes a great smoothie & crushed ice drinks such as Margarita or Daiquiri very quickly and evenly blended.5. Worked great for making pesto & Harissa too, though the parsley had to be added in a bit at a time to ensure smooth consistency. I typically make these two items in my Cuisinart Food Processor which performs both of the above tasks in about 1/3 of the time it took in the blender. The consistency is also better in my Cuisinart. I figured I’d give the blender a go on these just as a test. I’m not gonna try making peanut butter.6. The base and mechanical bits under the pitcher have a quality feel for the price sub $50.00 price tag. The blender stays put, and a hand isn’t required on top of the blender to keep the pitcher from walking off the spinny bits.What I'm on the fence (can’t decide) aboutit's not particularly quiet - but quieter than my old blender, and definitely NOT quieter than my Cuisinart Food Processor. So I’m on the fence.What I don't like, and I mean really don't likeThe top is made of LDPE plastic making it extremely hard to get off when at room temp and especially straight out of the fridge. I’m not being a wimp; the top is extremely hard to get off. So hard I'm afraid the lifting tab is going to snap off in my attempts. My wife gave up getting the lid off and leaves it for me to struggle with.I don’t even try anymore to get the lid off if its cold. I run the whole pitcher under really hot water before I attempt to get the lid off. The hot water makes the LDPE plastic top pliable, making it easier to remove. Effortless is not be a synonym I’d use to describe removing the lid from the pitcher.This would be a deal breaker for a person with disabilities, Arthritis, weak fingers, and/or an elderly person. There is now way my Mom wouldn’t be able to get the lid off this blender.What I mildly don't like1. The top has a secondary flap, for what I’m not sure. The flap doesn’t have a proper hinge. The hinge is molded into the lid of the pitcher. Being made of LDPE plastic, I'm pretty confident it's going to snap off in time.2. The whole top / lid to the pitcher has a ton of nooks and crannies making it a challenge to clean quickly. A brush and soaking in hot soapy water is what works for me. I use it every day, so I wash by hand instead of using the dishwasher.3. The base that holds the blades onto the pitcher is made of thin ABS plastic which I’m quite certain if the base came into contact with counter top at an angle with a bit of force, aka dropping the pitcher onto the base or inadvertently smacked against the edge of the counter it will result in a broken base.. Maybe shatter would be a better termThose are my thoughts and experiences with this pitcher – You decide.

Author: DebPhilly
Title: I don't recommend this
Body: I wanted aninexpensive blender to replace my inexpensive Oster that broke when I dropped it on the floor. I should have stuck with Oster.I use it for smoothies and the frozen fruit gets chopped, but not blended. It's also annoying having to keep my finger on the button.

Author: Andrea Phillips
Title: Stopped working after the 2nd use
Body: If you are looking for a reliable blender, please keep looking. The first time I used this blender, I had to shake it in order for it to chop up the ice. The 2nd time I used to, it completely stopped working. Horrible!!!

Author: CathyB
Title: Not very powerful
Body: We like our smoothies and frappes! Poor old Oster blender finally bit the dust (center post wore down to a cylinder from being square!) so I shopped and ordered this one.We used it for a total of three days -- about 10 times for our family of four -- before deciding the thing was just underpowered. Effectively crushing ice and/or frozen fruits was obviously beyond it's capabilities...even using the crush ice setting.It got donated...hopefully whomever ends up with it doesn't need much power, Bought another Oster locally.

Author: lige
Title: not much
Body: It is easy to clean . . . and that's the only thing I liked about it. It's very cheaply made and the motor got warm and started making a noise. I was making hummus, nothing difficult to blend. Really cheap, really not worth even the 20 bucks I spent on it.

Author: Gary P
Title: Piece of junk stopped working after about 8 uses
Body: I usually don't review products. That is a good thing, meaning everything works properly. I had a vitamix which lasted many years. Decided I'd go for something cheaper, and this looked like a good product. Did not work very well, but got the job done after a while for my smoothies. After about 8 smoothies, it stopped working entirely. Because I bought it over a month ago, Amazon would not except a return/refund. What a joke. Looks like I'm going to have to spend a ton on another vitamix cause this did not cut it.

Author: A. D.
Title: A blender that does not blend
Body: I was excited to finally find a blender that would work with mason jars. I'm usually blending only 8-10 oz of things, and when you try to do that in a 40+ oz container it just pushes everything up the sides and doesn't blend. But this turned out to be a total dud - I don't know if it's the shape of the blades or how dull they are, but this thing doesn't puree anything. I put fresh (non-frozen) blueberries, small curd cottage cheese and water on smoothie setting for over THREE MINUTES and it was still 20% chunks. Ran it for ANOTHER full minute, no improvement. So this has to be returned, total waste of time!

Author: Keljo
Title: Works great
