Author: Clothilde
Title: This blender does not blend. Zero stars. Do not buy this.
Body: Returning because it simply does not work. Cannot call it a “smoothie” if it has chunks of watermelon, strawberry, or even a ripe banana in the drink. Tried leaving on longer. After three minutes, still had chunks in drink. Tried preparing different size pieces from larger to smaller, always with 1 cup liquid as per directions, and different buttons, although there is a Puree Smoothie button.I’ve been making fruit-yoghurt-spinach drinks for over 50 years. I know how to use a blender and prepare the fruit. My old, moderately-priced Hamilton Beach one that I am replacing after maybe 15 years worked beautifully in fraction of the time.Also the top is a poor design and made of cheap materials. Hard to pry off so will most probably wear out or crack. Don’t need the spout & will probably leak or wear out.The motor is not too noisy. And the glass jar seems sturdy. But it just does not make smoothies. Majes “chunkies.” Useless. What a shame. What a waste of resources and effort.

Title: It’s a blender that doesn’t blend
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   Complete waste of money. I don’t even fill it all the way and it doesn’t blend as you can see in the video. All I put in here is frozen fruit, sliced banana, and some almond milk. It takes me about 15-20 minutes to make a smoothie/açaí bowl which is the reason why I bought this, to make those two things. I have to manually stir and stab everything in the blender to get it into a perfect position so the blade grabs everything and blends the ingredients. Once I put everything in, I’ll hit one of the buttons and nothing happens so I have to take the lid off, mess with everything inside and press the button again. I repeat this give or take 10 different times just so the blender can do it’s job. Smoothies are supposed to be made within seconds but this takes up so much time — it’s not worth it at all. So disappointed.

Author: D.C Cranston
Title: low budget blender
Body: I was excited to get this blender as hamilton beach is a pretty well known brand. There are pros and cons to this blender that I will go through. Starting with the pros, this blender is made of quality materials. The glass is thick and strong, I have dropped it in the sink before and the glass did not chip or break. Now to the less satisfactory part of this blender, the blades just don’t do their job well. Even when making a milkshake I have to thaw the ice cream until it is pretty much liquid for the blade to be able to turn the ice cream. When making smoothies and attempting to blend frozen fruit the motor sounds like it’s dying and it is not able to blend the frozen fruit. I would say this is a low budget blender that barely gets the job done, i would recommend spending the extra $15-$20 to get a better quality blender.

Body: The reviews that I saw (maybe I missed some?) didn't mention how hard the lid is to get off. So odd but a real pain! Another con is that I need to stir the smoothie ingredients (even with plenty of liquid) at least once during the process or it just sticks and the engine revs and isn't productive.

Author: Mike McKee

Body: It worked okay for a couple months. After a while, it was not great at breaking up ice. Then it started to leak.Decent price. But I guess you get what you pay for. It made me sad. I threw it out.

Body: Was doing a smoothie and I realized the milk was dipping a bit from the bottom. As soon as I lifted it, the bottom fell down and created a mess everywhere. DON’T BUY. Pay and bit more and get a better one!

I considered the cost of this item a loss and purchased an OTTER.blender to replace this one. My previous Otter lasted many many years and still worked when I replaced it.

Author: northernmommy
Title: It’s okay
Body: I didn’t expect it to perform like a Vitamix or Ninja but for the price it’s a pretty good blender. I love the glass pitcher. It does it’s job blending frozen fruit and ice for smoothies. It’s a little loud but not the loudest blender I’ve owned. The pour spout on the lid is great but the lid is harder than heck to take off. Overall I would buy again

Author: Caro
Title: So far, it works
Body: I had read review after review on so many blenders. It's always difficult to decided what blender will not be too loud, or which one will not be smoking because the wiring is bad, or which one will end up breaking because the base is to cheaply made. And even reading review for this specific blender, I had mix feelings about. So far, it's been working well. The base is plastic but the top is glass. Very durable and easy to clean.

Author: John t.
Title: Doesn't blend frozen fruit!
Body: I don't know why this gets so many stars. It doesn't work at all. I got this to blend frozen fruit for smoothies. When the blade goes, the fruit and everything else just goes to the edges and nothing is actually mixed (see picture attached). I have to stop the blender and push everything around at least ten times to actually get it to blend. So disappointed, especially from a well known brand. I'd send it back but I made the mistake of throwing the packaging away before actually using it. Not doing that again!

Author: Kathy Hindrichs
Title: Great blender for everyday use
Body: Very easy to assemble and clean, this blender is perfect for my need to have my daily healthy smoothie.

Author: CH

Body: This blender is very poorly designed. The lid cannot be closed completely, and if the blender is over 75% full whatever you are blending leaks out the top. This is a design flaw and not somthing that is unique to my unit.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Nice blender
Body: Love that it’s glass & not plastic. It will hold up especially if you are crushing ice. It’s used mostly for protein shakes & I put ice & frozen fruit in. Blends nicely.Only thing that makes me give it 3 stars is it only has 2 speeds.

Title: Motor worn out after a couple of months
Body: After a couple of months of use, the motor smells like it’s burning up. This blender is cheap garbage. Do not buy this piece of crap.

Author: Kimand2cats
Title: Very noisy and won't even blend milk shakes
Body: I have waited to review this because I don't use it very often. I really like the glass container, but the lid looks very cheap and will not seal. Will not blend ice or frozen fruit to make smoothies. Also won't even blend ice cream into milk shakes. Hamilton Beach is a well respected name and so I am very, very disappointed. I purchased this as a set along with a food processor. The food processor motor quit working within 3 months and never did chop well. The food processor went to the trash, and this is not far behind.

Author: Rebekah
Title: Absolute worst blender ever
Body: This is literally the worst blender. The first one we bought burned out and had to be replaced. The second one just literally doesnt blend anything. We have to shake it around and re-angle it and it still won't work. Absolute worst blender.

Author: John
Title: Works great for smoothies
Body: I was surprised by the quality of this blender. Intending to make use of it to make fruit smoothies. It seems to hold roughly 60 ounces of liquid, and has a good motor for ice, frozen fruit, and anything else I've tried so far. The glass is thick and made of strong material, has no cracked or worn from freezing or hot water. The glass doesn't stain or stick with items, and you're able to clean most of it with just hot water from the sink and the stubborn stains come off with a simple wipe of a paper towel. The noise level is a bit higher than I'd hoped, but it comes with a powerful motor in exchange. The lid is a bit tighter than I'd like at most times, but this does mean you don't need to hold it down while using it.

Author: Carla
Title: DISGUSTING!!!
Body: I was so excited to receive this blender to continue with my smoothie journey. Taking a chance at buying this blender despite the reviews, just to be leaving a bad review myself. When the package arrived, the packing was nice and looked very pleasant and safe. I opened the box with the blender just to see a DIRTY/USED blender sent to me. This blender still has food remains left on it from the previous user. I did not purchase a USED blender. I like to order everything NEW! This is very disturbing and disappointing. DO NOT PURCHASE , if you ask me. PICTURES ARE ATTACHED!!

Author: Miriam
Title: It doesn't work at all Don't waste your money on this
Body: Doesn't work

Author: Navi
Title: Good purchase

Author: Marilyn Miller
Title: Okay if all you want is smoothies or baby food.
Body: My old blender from the 1960s finally up and died. I don't use a blender a lot so I didn't want to spring for a Vitamix or other powerhouse blender. That may have been a mistake.It's okay for pureeing very soft cooked vegetables and soft fruit as long as you put in enough liquid -- at least a cup, more if possible -- but things still get caught under the blades and do not get blended. I think it would overheat easily because it started to smell hot after only 10 seconds on the puree setting. I tried pureeing some rather thin potato soup and ended up with uneven chunks, had to take my immersion blender to it to get the right consistency.It has an easy clean button and that's how I'm accustomed to cleaning a blender, but this had food seeping under the seal that did not get cleaned in the cleaning cycle, so you should plan on taking the whole thing apart after every use.Incidentally, it's loud. It sounds like a jet taking off, even when I put padding under the base.Also, I'm not sure how stable it is. The base is very light plastic and the container is heavy glass. The container does wiggle around on the base, doesn't feel very secure. I'll probably put it out for a garage sale and see if I can find a used Vitamix.

Title: The product is very nice! I really love it!

Spend some money and yourself a Vita-mix those things last forever!

The media could not be loaded.

Title: Thanks 😊

Body: Good one!

Author: Bailey
Title: No power. Doesn't crush ice, barely even breaks it
Body: Can't make smoothies. Ice and frozen fruit don't blend and the amount of liquid required to make them work gives you something of a slurry not a smoothie. Doesn't do a simple nut butter. Guess I'm gonna save up for a Vitamix. A value blender back in 1950 actually worked. I don't know why people are okay with the garbage companies mass produce these days

Author: Melissa
Title: Awesome Blender
Body: I bought this for my husband for Christmas (2021) he is the smoothie maker for the whole house. It is not super loud, obviously there still is some noise. The top pore spout makes a huge difference when pouring into cups. It chops frozen fruit with ease. Well worth the money.

Author: Jack Sparrow
Title: Broke
Body: Broke after using frozen strawberries

Author: christina mckinney
Title: Do not buy this.
Body: We’ve had this blender for just a little over a month. It is extremely loud and no longer blends. My son used it once or twice weekly to make fruit smoothies. It was not used excessively and was only used to blend fruit with milk. It lasted one month. DO NOT BUY

Author: Randy Cook
Title: I guess you get what you pay for.
Body: Mine broke on my third use.

Author: Brooke Thomsen
Title: Doesn't blend well.
Body: It doesn't blend very well. Has issues mixing all the ingredients together and will just blend what's on the bottom. When you want something pureed, it still leaves ingredients chunky. Not good for smoothies or hummus.

Author: Billy
Title: Very Powerful
Body: Very Powerful

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Average blender
Body: I like that it comes with a glass pitcher and not a plastic one.... takes average time to blend stuff gets the job done, pretty loud, but good for the money

Author: Travis Stapleton
Title: Super loud, and can rarely blend simple ingredients
Body: I've tried to mix all kinds of smoothies or foods in it, and mainly I get the loud blending noise, and I can watch the inside sit completely still. The blades don't work for liquids...?

Author: Joe G
Title: Broke within 3 weeks...
Body: glass cracked in literally less than 3 weeks of use....nope didn't drop it or anything.

Author: DW
Title: No power
Body: This blender will not make a smoothie. It does not blend/grind fruit and vegetables up, it leaves small bits. The lid also does not fit well and pops up when blending. Very disappointing.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Blender
Body: Worse purchase I could have made, as soon as I turn it on to blend for a smoothie the glass cracked, will never purchase again cheaply made.

Author: mr
Title: Basic Blender
Body: Works as advertised

Author: JessickaLynn
Title: Hard to blend frozen fruit
Body: Hate leaving bad reviews. It works when I hit blend, then get a spatula to mix everything around then blend again. Have to do this like 3 times to get everything to be able to hit the blade. It has a hard time blending frozen fruits like mango and pineapple. But once it gets everything it blends very well. Just annoying =/

Author: Jonah
Title: An amazing blender
Body: This is an amazing blender. It is very powerful. I've had other blenders that are garbage and you have to dilute everything you blend. It's super easy to clean. My previous blender had an issue where it leaked from the part that screws into the blender itself because it was never aligned and cheap. You can really tell the plastic is of good quality because of the thickness and the blender itself is a very thick glass. It was also a great price. Normally blenders that are this good are usually much more.

Author: Patty
Title: Good power, cheap flimsy lid
Body: Makes smoothies with frozen fruit like a champ. Plenty of power. Only negative is the lid. It's flimsy, doesn't seal tight and the spout is useless unless you like to make a mess. If you hold the lid on while blending and take it off to pour, you'll be ok. For the price, not bad overall.

Author: GirlyMom
Title: Do not buy!!
Body: This blender quit working just weeks after we bought it. It smelled like burning rubber and was hot to the touch. Very dangerous! Do not buy!

Author: cpk1964
Title: It broke down just after 1 year with only chopping baby kale and baby spinach once a month
Body: It's beautiful. Stable on the counter. Mess free really does let you add items mess free. Only problem is it only lasted just over the year mark. Contacted the company to see if I can just by the motor base. To be continued.......

Author: Juan
Title: Gets the job done
Body: Pretty good for the price

Author: Tommy Volk
Title: Poorly designed cap
Body: The lid is somewhat annoying to put on and, holy crap, it's next to impossible to take off! I spent about 5 minutes wearing my fingernails down trying to get the darn thing off. Will definitely be returning. Haven't even used the blender yet.

Author: Wendy
Title: Cheap quality
Body: I was disappointed in the quality and size of the blender. Blender was also bulkier than I thought it would be and didn't fit well on my counter space. I returned for refund.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not sharp enough
Body: Not sharp enough

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Small blades
Body: Disappointing power. I bought this to make my smoothies. It takes forever to blend frozen fruit. I think it’s due to the small blades. And the plastic parts that help to turn the blades are already wearing down and it’s only been two weeks! I bought it because it got high ratings. I busted out my old blender and it did way better. Bummer.

Author: Emily R.
Title: Good cheap blender
Body: It makes a decent smoothie and milkshake. If you use any kind of powder (i.e. protein powder) or thick consistency product (i.e. peanut butter), it becomes a whole lot harder to clean because they go down into the bottom of the blender and you can’t just do the self-clean blending function.

Author: Lee Banning
Title: There is a flaw
Body: Overall I love this blender. It is really good. It can turn vegetables into pulp for making juice really quickly. But it has one major flaw. the lid is rubber, and it does not fit well on the glass jar. When I am blending my vegetables for juice, it comes off. I don't know if this is a flaw for this one item or for the entire product. I would not recommend this to my friends for this flaw. But I still love my blender.

Author: EAR
Title: Short life. Dead after couple weeks
Body: The thing stopped working after couple weeks of use. Started puffing smoke as if something burned inside. Shame because it worked good when it was workig

Author: Sharon
Title: It does not liquify
Body: It can not liquify vegetables, you will have to hold the right button until your finger sore

Author: Merri
Title: I needed breadcrumbs other one broke
Body: Takes a long time for me to make bread crumbs oh, that's right bread crumbs fresh bread crumbs, fresh parsley fresh grated cheese, chopped garlic, so now I can only make a cup and a half at a time. So I guess I'll be using it for the summer time for our drinks

Author: Jay Coventry
Title: Brand+name quality
Body: I bought it mainly to chop up sliced strawberries and mix it with unsweetened vanilla almond milk to make healthy smoothies. No sugar, I use Amazon's brand of stevia. Tastes great.What I like about the blender in particularly, there are five settings, two of them to manually hold down as you blend, and the other two is for when you don't want to hold the switches in.Because of what it is, it is naturally noisy but because it does the job fairly quickly, you don't have to hear prolonged noise. I blend the smoothie in about 20 seconds and that includes two cups of sliced strawberries and it does a great job. Very easy to clean.It's what I expected from a brand name and I got it.

Author: vito randazzo
Title: For the price is not too bad
Body: Groceries and drinks

Author: Dr. M Labib
Title: Leaking
Body: The blender is leaking. I do not know if I received a defective unit or it is how it is!

Author: H
Title: Broke in less than 3 weeks
Body: I do not recommend this. It broke within less than 3 weeks and didn’t blend my food very well. Spend a little more and get a better one

Author: Richard M. Ludemann
Title: Blender
Body: This item is a plus for any kitchen. EZ to clean and use

Author: Wendy Wayte
Title: I thought it was more powerful.
Body: Didn’t chop up frozen fruit you had to do it longer then I thought. But it still did job takes a bit.

Author: Maria
Title: Works great!
Body: Simple to use, arrived early, does what its supposed to and reasonably priced. i recommend.

Author: Cheyla Stotler
Title: Your basic blender
Body: Needed a regular blender for my sister to make smoothies. This is perfect. No bells and whistles or crazy prices. Basic blender.

Author: JOE LI, NY
Title: Barely works
Body: Does what it should. Wish it had sharp blades. No edge whatsoever. Pulgerises doesn't cut.

Author: CO
Title: Easy to use
Body: I waited to review this blender until I had it for over 60 days. So far, no complaints at all. It blends everything and very easy to clean. I do recommend for the people who may not know this, put your softer foods at the bottom and the harder foods at the top to blend. It makes it a lot easier and gentler on the blades.

Author: Kimberly Fuller
Title: The Lid doesn't Stay on
Body: The Blender Lid does not stay on and it does not Blend every good

Author: jongsok kim
Title: Too weak to blend frozen fruit
Body: Blades are too small it cant blend a frozen fruit. Pretty disappointed

Author: Jeremy Keil
Title: Best value blender out there!
Body: If you're looking for a daily blender for a smoothie and/or protein shake, this is IT! I love everything about this blender, especially for the cost. The only negative thing that I can say about it is the cover is sort of hard to take off as it seals very tight, but hey at least you don't have to worry about it coming off while it's blending! :)I make a shake daily and I use fresh or frozen fruits, ice, protein powder, peanut butter and milk and have had ZERO issues with it blending it all.My advice, if you're looking for a basic shake/smoother blender, LOOK NO FURTHER!

Author: Tracey R.
Title: TERRIBLE!
Body: This blender is awful! I tried to blend cooked vegies and rice and it wouldn't even blend that!

Author: John and Chrisite
Title: Not very durable!!
Body: We bought this to make protein shakes after the gym. We put ice, protein powder and milk in there. That's it. It lasted one month. What a piece of crap. Don't buy this if you plan to do more than blend up mushy rotten tomatoes.

Author: Roderick mozee
Title: Good products
Body: Good product

Author: JM. Trosinski
Title: It does a great job !!!!!
Body: Superior blender !!!!!!!No hassle.

Author: Ray

Body: I used it twice and the second time I noticed it leaking when I took it apart to clean the blade parts it was broken around the ring preventing it from sealing.

Author: Catherine McCormack

Body: It did not circulate what was in the blender at less then half full..can't make a smoothie if you have to keep stopping and pushing any fruit down into it..that makes me the blender..

Body: I made a good milkshake with this model 51848A blender last night. Today, I am making something that required chopping a raw veggie. This model was weak and inefficient. This model did not come with the appropriate attachments and I haven't been able to find them. It looks like a separate purchase will need to happen as chopping things by hand gets harder every day as I get older.

Author: Joanna Mueller-Demelles
Title: Love it

Body: I have on this blender For a year now It has no power It makes a nice pesto but it is horrible for smoothies it just bogs down and cannot smooth out frozen fruit Looking for something with more power

Author: iRockDenim
Title: Don’t waste your money.
Body: This blender blends so you get what you pay for. The issue is more about how well it works.I’ve found that the motor at the bottom doesn’t always connect properly with the blender blade. There are times (and a lot more frequently than I’d prefer) where the motor spins and the blade in the blender doesn’t. This doesn’t only occur with frozen foods, it happens with liquid too which is my biggest complaint.This blender hasn’t been reliable and I can recommend it since it doesn’t always work.

Body: I love everything!

Author: Blanca

Body: Wonderful product I dropped my existing blender on the floor and broke it and within three hours my new one arrived from Amazon, I just love it.

Author: Catherine L
Title: Good while it lasted, broke after a month
Body: Just received this blender last month after the Hamilton Beach that we had for 10+ years broke down. Worked great for the little over a month that it worked, then this morning my husband went to make our twins a smoothie for breakfast snack and it started smoking and quit working. Awesome, not only did I have to scrape together extra money to buy this piece of junk, but now I have to find a way to buy another so the girls can have their morning smoothie.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Broke after a few useses
Body: It just suddenly stopped after I used it a few times. Didn't add anything hard, I just used it to make fruit smoothies. I'd spend your money elsewhere

Author: Logan Simms
Title: Worst blender ever
Body: This blender is awful. It can’t blend yogurt spinach and bananas. I mean if it can’t blend that then it can’t blend anything. What a waste

Author: Dave
Title: Lid doesn't fit easily and impossible to get off
Body: I bought this on January 5 and used it. for the first time on February 20. The blender works well, but the lid is impossible to put on and subsequently remove. My husband finally was able to get in on solidly, but wasn't able to remove it without a lot of struggle. I couldn't do either. Already, I regret buying it. The lid fits too snuggly when you put your weight on it to seal. As my husband said, this blender will be a problem.So sorry I didn't try it sooner.

Author: Robert Britton
Title: Excellent product for shakes
Body: Great power, easy to clean

Author: paul jones

Body: As expected. It’s a little heavy, but it’s glass.

Author: Johlisa Spivey
Title: I love it
Body: Works wonders with my smoothies worth the money

Author: Marianne Lancaster
Title: Not a good blender as it makes a mess.
Body: There were two issues:The top didn't line up with the pitcher.The pouring spout caused a huge mess.

Author: Barbara S.
Title: Great for the price
Body: The power is superior, the glass container is large and easy to clean BUT the lid doesn't fit. I have to hold it so stuff doesn't fly out. However, I really need the product and it works so well, I'll put up with it. Maybe I can find another top that will fit.

Author: Crystal lee
Title: Powerful and Sturdy
Body: Very sturdy and powerful. Louder than my old one, but it mixes very well. Love it.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: An Appliance Has Never Made Me Want to Kill Someone Before
Body: In an effort to avoid spending $$$ on a Vitamix, I’ve tried basically every blender out there. Nutribullet, Ninja, you name it, I’ve bought it. And I can confidently say that every five star review of this blender is either fake or written by someone who used it once and then gave up on their New Year’s weight loss resolutions, because this is the worst blender I have ever used. Do not waste your money unless you enjoy the following:1) watery liquid mixed with chunks of fruits/veggies that somehow never get blended2) a lid that is so hard to remove, you WILL either smack yourself in the face when it finally rips off3) spending 20 minutes trying to get a smoothie texture to no availHonestly every time I use this, expletives are flying left and right, and I swear to myself I will finally just shell out the cash for the Vitamix I should have purchased 4 blenders ago.

Author: Morgan
Title: Not even a month &stopped working
Body: We used this daily for smoothies at home, once a day might I add, and its suddenly just stopped working, literally just died after last use. So strange. Annoyed as it was a good blender.

Author: ANGEL
Title: Not good for shakes or smoothies! DO NOT BUY
Body: I was hoping that the bad reviews where just certain people who had experienced a blender that wouldn't blend; Low and behold the blender couldn't even blend apples and cucumbers. Don't waste your precious time ordering this blender; You will only be disappointed.

Author: Paulette W.
Title: Best appliance. Description true to its word
Body: Very very easy to clean and it's not overwhelming with noise.

Author: Love and Happiness
Title: Nice blender. Better than my Ninja
Body: Love how well this blender works on the smoothie setting. Wish it had a self timer to turn off automatically. The lid is very challenging to get off. I prefer it though over a Ninja I’ve been using for a couple years because it blends better. I use greens, veggies, and more and this is excellent for that.

Author: Gerard Breve
Title: Potencia
Body: De muy buena calidad mucha potencia!

Body: burned out 1st use making a smoothie

Title: Satisfied
Body: Good Product

Title: good stuff
Body: Nice!

Body: Works better than my Ninja ever did and is easier to clean. I highly recommend if you just want to casually blend smoothies.

Author: Melissa Manier
Title: Broke the first time I used it
Body: Barely had anything in it and it started smoking

Author: samayise
Title: Still working great after EIGHT years!
Body: I think the time approve the quality of the blender. I can’t believe it’s been 8 years 😭

Author: Dan S
Title: Good blender
Body: Groovy smoothie machine

Author: Gabriela W.

Body: The reviews were great so I purchased it. The blending power was very weak. I returned it.

Author: paulette pizzano

Body: No good bad power

Author: Big Bob
Title: Mix well
Body: Works as good as more expensive ones I've bought very powerful as well as gentle for different products

Author: Lucy Robinson
Title: Horrible blender
Body: Horrible blender do not waste your money

Author: acio
Title: Worse blender I've ever owned
Body: It will always be a mystery how you can purchase an item because it has TONS of great reviews and have it be one of the worse things you've ever bought. It seems to run perfectly, not too noisy, seems plenty powerful enough, definitely MUST have the lid on unlike other taller blenders I've had or else splatter city. Okay, still not quite a deal breaker. But when I have to blend something like frozen cranberries or celery 4-5 times and I still have the CHEW on my smoothie when I'm supposed to be drinking it, THAT is a deal breaker and worthless as a blender.I'll never understand how so many hundreds of people use the same dang blender and not have the same issues. I tried pulsing it after a few blends, held the pulse buttons down for a while. A little better but still had to chew on little parts of celery. I NEVER had anything like that with all the cheap Oster blenders I've purchased over the years. And I mean the cheap ones. I only make simple smoothies. Sometimes I'll throw frozen fruit in and greens but usually powdered greens and cacao powdered mixtures.Unfortunately I didn't pull it out of the box and try it out until a month and a half after I purchased it so I guess it's going to Goodwill :((

Author: Mehnaj Ali
Title: Not as great as the older models.
Body: It doesn’t blend any fruits or veggies well. It takes forever to make a smoothie. Unfortunately I missed my return day by 3 days so now I’m stuck with sadly

Author: Cathy Cummins
Title: Would Never buy again!
Body: I bought 2 of this item, one for myself & one as a gift. Both of them quit working after one use. Bad product!

Author: E
Title: Started smoking and malfunctioning out of the box…
Body: I’m in a hotel at the moment and needed a blender. Tried this today to make a smoothie and it started smoking A LOT right away. I stopped then came back to it several hours later. Again, it was smoking so much I had to open the window and just call it quits. Wouldn’t blend anymore, but rather just spin whatever it could around.Bummer, since Hamilton Beach I know makes some decent products. Will be returning it and going back to the “buy once cry once” motto.

Author: Stx
Title: Don't get one of the fancy, expensive blenders - this works great for frozen fruit smoothies
Body: Last year we decided to get one of the expensive upside down, super power, blenders. What a mistake! Frequent leaks, a pain to add more ingredients after starting to blend, then the motor died early. Back to the basic Hamilton Beach blender - aaah. It blends 0 degree frozen fruits with plenty of power, it's easy to add a bit more liquid, is easy to clean, has plenty of capacity, has never leaked while blending, and best of all cost far less. Sometimes basic is better, this is one of those times.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: does not blend well
Body: The blades are so small, it does not blend well.

Author: Book Lover
Title: Works great, but VERY tight lid
Body: The lid does not screw on, it is just very snug and you have to push and pull to snap it off. Almost sent it back, stupid design. But with use and warm water soaking the lid, it loosens up a bit. Still don't like it.

Body:
The media could not be loaded.

Author: chris ulrich
Title: Great product for the price!
Body: I use this product for fruit/veggie smoothies it's fantastic!

Author: Mandy
Title: Don’t waste your money
Body: You get what you pay for. The lid looked like it was old and used but I figured I’d give it a shot. Washed it and tried to blend frozen fruit that was thawed and soft. The lid came off easily and wouldn’t “lock on.” The pour spout wouldn’t close so I held it down. It wouldn’t even blend! There was plenty of liquids in there the help with the blending and it just kind of sloshed the fruit around without actually blending. Just bought today and sending it right back!

Author: J. Vogt
Title: Not as easy to use as I expected
Body: Requires a lot of help to blend frozen smoothies.

Author: Thomas A.
Title: Nice blender for not a lot of money
Body: Seems to do what we need quite well. No problems crushing ice cubes, mixes well, and cleans easily.Update: lasted 3 months before crushing ice ruined the motor/gears. Not worth the money after all. Take the cash you would have spent on this and put toward something of higher quality.

Author: Gloria
Title: Came in good condition and blended my coffee beans perfect .
Body: I blended my coffee beans works great.

Author: Selene
Title: No!
Body: I hated this blender! The blending quality sucked. I’d have so much trouble making a smoothie with frozen fruit and just adding ice to things. I attempted to make salsa and it was a fail because it wouldn’t blend. I ended throwing it away

Author: petvet4
Title: Great blender
Body: I had to replace my old blender at Christmas. This is well made very useful.

Author: Garrick Pelletier

Body: Does not circulate, everything gets stuck at top. Worthless

Author: Craig Taylor
Title: Disappointed!
Body: Bought this as a replacement blender; falls well short! Leaks while it’s blending, really leaks while you pour, barely enough power to blend ice cubes. Struggles greatly just to make my smoothies in the morning. Great brand, very poor design on this model. Disappointed!

Author: dariusz leja
Title: Don’t buy this
Body: Big mistake you have to open mixed fruits with the spoon close and makes a game no it’s not for the people

Author: Poppy
Title: Not good product

Author: Dan

Body: It broke the third time I used it...

Author: A. J.
Title: Nice and works effectively
Body: I got this as a bargain return like new so I may be a bit more impressed as it was very inexpensive... Good to look out for discounts; Still would have been happy paying full price for a classic blender with the classic heavy blender glass. It is a workhorse.

Author: Charis nance
Title: Weak
Body: This blender is weak and barely blends. Took forever just to make a smoothie and it still wasnt blended throughly. Will be returning

Author: Sid
Title: Designed with parts to fail.tons of replacements on amazon.
Body: The plastic base can't handle the torque of the motor.If i knew it was made you know where,i'da never ordered it.Spend alil more and get a quality one.

Author: T.J. Barker
Title: Straight from delivery package to trash can....
Body: Immediately started leaking at bottom through rubber seal which made a huge mess. After re-tightening was able to slow the leak down enough to make one smoothie. Motor so weak it reminded me of something you would see next to a kids eazy-oven in a fake kitchen. Was able to limp through one smoothie and into the trash it went... DO NOT BUY

Author: Debra Boggs
Title: Loud
Body: Mixer loud had to order a different one at bed bath and beyond.

Author: Bo
Title: Not worth it
Body: I would not recommend this product, as you must fully disassemble 3 peices to clean. Without doing this, food gets stuck in a rim, behind the blade, and cannot be loosened with water. For the trouble, this blender needs a lot of help to fully blend smoothies.

Author: Matthew
Title: Food gets stuck below blades, fails to blend
Body: Tried blending frozen fruit with sufficient liquid for smoothies. Lots of fruit chunks simply got stuck below the blades and did not blend. Another large portion of fruit hugged against the sides and would not blend. Required frequent stop/stir/start in order chop the fruit. The indentations in the sides allow fruit chunks to get stuck meaning they don't get blended.This things a piece of garbage and doesn't even work. Crushes ice very poorly as well. Skip the BS and just spend the extra $60-80 on a real blender that works and will last.

Author: Philip R
Title: Huge design flaw
Body: This product gets one star for a very foolish reason: the cover of the glass blender jar is IMPOSSIBLE to remove once it’s snapped on, and I’m a strong guy. Usually design problems like these are picked up in the prototype stage. Shame on you, Hamilton Beach!

Author: Isabel
Title: Que no sirve para hacer jugos de frutas no licua nada
Body: No ma agrado porque no licua las frutas

Author: Darth Zorg
Title: Not quiet at all

If you don't, you will have a real mess even if you only fill it less than half way. Very disappointed they put these out on the market like this. Being returned.

Title: Horrible Customer Service. Not happy.
Body: I bought this blender and I have a problem with the lid. The vent opening does not close all the way, and yes, I did push hard to close it and it pops back up.. Also, I can't get the lid off unless I pry at it with a butter knife. It was a real pain trying to hold onto a cold blender full of a milkshake, having to maneuver it while prying on it. I reached out the manufacturer and asked if I could get a replacement lid Not the whole blender, just a lid. Their response was to tell me to push the vent down until it clicks. I DID and it pops back up. Then they told me the lid will loosen with use. Hopefully it wont fall to.the floor as I struggle to get the lid off. I am going to use it for a few more times and I will probably return it before my 30 days are up. What good is a making a smoothie/milkshake if you cant get the lid off to scrape the rest of it out?

Author: Long-time Customer
Title: Makes Chunky Smoothies
Body: My previous 10-speed Hamilton Beach blender did a great job, but finally died after 12 years. Nobody actually *needs* 10 speeds on a blender, but the shape of the jar and the blades did a great job at turning my semi-frozen berry/veg/protein concoction into a very smooth-drinking breakfast.This new blender has several problems, however.1. No matter how long I leave it running on high, the smoothie always has many chewy chunks of fruit and veggies. I don't know if it just doesn't re-circulate well enough, or if it gets stuck under the blades.2. The jar is very rectangular compared to the more conical shape of my previous HB blender. The vortex in the previous conical one quickly re-circulated the mixture and produced a fine, consistent puree. This one seems to just whip in more air and creates a lot of foam without actually pulling through the liquid as much.3. The tight-fitting lid is pretty pointless, at least to me. The ability to pour through the lid from its built-in spout is not useful. I'm used to taking off the lid while it's running on high so that I can add protein powder. If the lid is attached firmly, it's very difficult to remove without risking pulling up the entire jar.4. Once the lid is off, the liquid bounces and splashes around way too much all by itself. It splashes out of the jar, even at half capacity. The previous blender would draw the liquid straight down and circulate in a tight vortex.5. The lip of the pour spout is actually constructed with a concave ledge on it, a little divot where the chunks get trapped. I can't tell you how annoying and stupid this is.There are *much* better blenders out there. Avoid this one.

Author: dragonflyeye
Title: Inexpensive Workhorse
Body: Couldn't bring myself to pay much for a blender I wasn't sure I'd use more than occasionally, but this thing has encouraged me to try new things! Never thought I was the smoothie type, but I make 2-3 low-carb smoothies a week. And, I'm using it to cream soups, instead of my immersion blender, which wrecked one of my pans when I wasn't thinking. The only thing slightly annoying is how hard the lid is to put on and take off. Not a deal-breaker for me, as my hand strength is pretty good, for a 68 year old lady.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Stopped functioning in 6 months
Body: Bought in June this year, It Stopped functioning in November, Had to Trash. Pretty Disappointed.

Author: Gordon B. Williams
Title: great
Body: Ideal for milkshakes!!

Author: April
Title: Great force for the price
Body: Love it so far and I made several smoothies in one day and it worked fine with light noise. Top is a little hard taking off but ensures secure for protection against splatters.

Author: Elaine fairbank
Title: Piece of junk
Body: Disliked the product. The cover goes on but we can’t take it off. So very unhappy and will not be using it.

Author: Jahel

Body: I have had this blender since last February. About two months ago it began to leak when I mixes my mother's milkshakes. Now It leaks every time I put any liquid in it! I am ordering a new blender of a different brand!

Author: Phil C.
Title: It blends
Body: It blends. Nuff said.

Author: Susan
Title: Doesn't really do well making smoothies!
Body: I bought this to make smoothies. Most of the time it just doesn't do a very good job. It seems like it just shoots the ingredients up above the cutting blades and the blades just spin without blending anything. I tried to troubleshoot the thing on Amazon, but it wasn't available. I wish I'd spent a little more money and bought something else. Not really happy with this at all.

Author: leah DiProspero
Title: Hamilton Beach Blender
Body: This was bought for me as a gift. And I love it. It does everything I want it to do. It is quite loud, but that's ok by me. It is very easy to clean. Dishwasher safe even.

Author: Maureen
Title: LOVE IT! AND WAS A LOT CHEAPER
Body: EASY CLEANING AND DON'T HAVE TO TAKE APART! JUST FILL WITH HOT WATER 2 OR 3 TIME. NOISE AS EXPECTED.

Author: Barbara Usack
Title: Awful.
Body: After reading the reviews I bought this to replace a very cheap Oster that made amazing shakes… Very creamy. Not only does this not blend up my shakes (and I even tried pulverizing the oats and other ingredients before adding them to the blender,) my shakes are very runny on the top with the majority of the ingredients sunk to the bottom. Considering I have a shake almost every morning I cannot express how extremely disappointing this is.And although I read how terrible the lid is, I didn’t think I would have problems with it. I was *eventually* successful in getting the lid off of my shake, but once I ran the soap in the blender I was unable to get the lid off. I can only use the blender by resting the lid lightly on and throwing a towel over it to ensure that I don’t make a mess in my kitchen. (I might even start this mixing the lid all together and just use a towel.) I would never buy this again.

Author: Claudio

I wanted a ninja and didn’t want to spend the price but after using this I will be upgrading.

Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   I love this blender, and it’s straightforward to use. Had no issues. This’s the first time I used it. Very satisfied with my order, as always!

Author: Susan K
Title: Glass is way too heavy. Would not want to lift every day.
Body: I was looking forward to using this. While I do have a titanium plate in my right wrist, I have never been bothered by lifting pots and pans, etc. This glass piece was way too heavy. I really do not see how many women would want to lift it every day. I put soap and water in it to wash and once I picked it up, water went everywhere, onto counter and floor. I realize it just needed to be screwed in tighter at the base as I guess it was jarred in shipping but I would prefer a different design. I have had blenders before and they were light weight and worked fine. I will be replacing this.

Author: Robin Hines
Title: Can’t even chop up frozen fruit
Body: I don’t know what machine was being reviewed here but it sure as heck isn’t the same Hamilton Beach piece of crap that I received. The motor power is sufficient but the pitcher is very poorly designed. The base of the pitcher is too wide so there’s no way for the frozen ingredients to funnel down onto the blades. Ya have to keep stopping so you can manually push down the stuff. I sent it back and bought an Oster

Author: colby abernathy
Title: Broke the second time i used it
Body: Used this blender to make simple smoothies. The second time i used it it started off fine and then mid way through it slowed down to where it was barely spinning and started smoking. I unplugged it and let it sit for a bit and tried it again later and it barely spins at all now. Don’t know if it over heated or what but i can hear pieces rattling in the bottom of it, was definitely a waste of money for me.

Author: KimD.
Title: Cheaply Made. Doesn’t blend period.
Body: Very cheaply molded plastic. Only two “blades” at blender inside base. Top did not fit without much effort. Tried precooked puréed carrots and squash for soup. Did nothing but swirl ingredients around. Then tried premixed smoothie açaí packet frozen and crushed with almond milk and yogurt. Not enough power to do THAT! Don’t expect a lot for $40 but more than nothing. Worse blender ever ever ever.

Author: Rufito
Title: Absolutely love this blender!
Body: Easy to clean, works perfectly for me!

Author: Timothy D. Richards
Title: Awesome!
Body: Powerful, easy to clean, looks great. Can’t ask for much more.Buy it.

Author: TTC
Title: The lid is plain stupid
Body: When I first got this, I noticed that the lid wouldn't fit. I tried to make it work. It was a failure. I tried to pour it through the spout to see if it would work. Of course the lid fell off, and the smoothie went everywhere, including on me. The lid just won't fit. That is something that is an easy fix for Hamilton Beach, the designers and testers were asleep at the wheel.

Author: C&C
Title: Blender broke after trying to make gravy.
Body: It worked great for the first couple days of having it. Crushed the large chunks of frozen fruit with no issue. Tried to make gravy with it and the whole thing shut off on me and now won't turn on. Really disappointed.

Author: OrcWhl
Title: It’s a cheap blender
Body: It works. It has two settings which are either continuous or staccato. It does blend things good enough. It is as I would expect for the price I paid. I purchased it because the blades didn’t look like they’d slice my finger off when cleaning and thus far, I am uninjured. There are some grooves under the blades that are not easy to reach with a standard kitchen brush. If you know not to twist it on its stand, it does not come apart (unlike what happened with one of these reviewers). Just set it on the stand and a little juggle to ensure it’s sitting secure on the spinning grooves, but no twisting needed! It is loud, but it’s a blender so of course it will make loud noise.Overall: good enough for my needs.

Author: Albano

Body: Worst blender on the market just got a ninja so much better and worth the money this garbage motor burned out in 3 minutes

Title: Works Great with Mason Jars
Body:
The media could not be loaded.

I had heard that some blenders will attach to standard mason jar threads. So now, with this Hamilton Beach Blender, I can blend a lot or a little and have various sizes of jars to choose from.

For a smoothie, the fruit did not fully blend in. Large chunks left after running it for over a minute. Don't recommend at all!

Author: Darren Gonzalez
Title: It has lasted quite a while for a cheap blender.
Body: I think I have now had this blender for 5+ years. For $35 I was expecting to get a year out of it. I use it practically every day to make smoothies with ice and frozen nuts, and the blade and motor work just fine for this purpose.I did have to replace the blade/cap assembly at the bottom because the seal rotted out due to leaving it in standing water. And the little flap on the lid just broke too, but these are minor things. If you're concerned about buying something cheap that doesn't work and will have to be thrown out too soon, don't worry about this blender.Sure, there will be lemons as you can see if the reviews, but you're more likely to have an experience like mine. Yes, it's loud. And no, it's not a Ninja. But what do you expect for $35!?

Their product are poor quality and they cannot handle the flood of calls from warranty claims.My units Motor failed after just 9 months (~100 uses). So sad. It is under warranty but Hamilton Beach WILLNOT REPLACE because they are 'out of stock' (but it is still for sale on their amazon store) and are trying to up-sell me to use a warranty credit and pay more to buy a more expensive blender.Bait and switch.Hamilton Beach masters of bait and switch.

Author: Definitely Not a Ghost
Title: Worth a minimum price bender
Body: It's a minimum price blender. For its size, it's about as low on the price market you can go, and it measures up to that standard. Looking for something that'll just EAT through fruit and anything you stick in it? This is a $30 blender. It's not gonna do anything, it'll slow down with too much. Looking for something that'll just chew through stuff slowly but surely and make some easy blender food, like smoothies and ice cream mixes? This is a $30 blender. It'll do that, and you'll have gotten it for a bargain.

Author: Bmscora1

Luckily, I was given a food processor I can use for pesto and I guess I will use this for bulletproof coffee and smoothies. I like that the container is glass and that it’s not terribly loud. Wishing I had gone with the (pricier) Oster.

The lid is what made me remove stars. It is pointless to put it all the way in when blending because it is a pain to remove. Have to use your finger strength to pull it off.

Author: DMarie
Title: Great Blender for Smoothies
Body: I use this occasionally for fruit smoothies. It blends well, looks good on the counter, and is easy to clean. No complaints.

Author: AM261
Title: Cheap, you get what you pay for.
Body: I replaced a blender that had broke, and the other one used to blend perfectly. I guess you get what you pay for. Because this one was cheaper than the others. Every time I made a shake it wouldn’t blend everything all the way. But this morning I made one. When I added the fruits and vegetables it ended up making a humongous mess and it wouldn’t blend everything. It got all over my new clothes, and my brand new shoes and I was on my way to work. I tossed it out, I’m buying a NINJA. I do not recommend this product.

Author: Whitney Crisp

Body: I like how easy it is to clean, the only issue is I can’t even make a milkshake with it. Completely useless. Tried to blend ice with it just to see if maybe the ice cream was just too thick, no. It melted the ice. It didn’t even blend it. It melted the gosh darn ice.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not powerful
Body: It gets the job done for smaller And softer foods but definitely not strong enough to crush ice or blend frozen fruit for smoothies. It is also very loud for something that doesn’t blend well. Good for smaller raw foods

Author: Sky
Title: Works as advertised!
Body: I use it mainly to make smoothies and other frozen drinks. Crushes ice better than past blenders. A little loud, but does the job.

Author: Patricia Whitaker
Title: Great blender
Body: Great blender for the money.

Author: Lush Landscapes
Title: Stupidest design ever
Body: My husband tried to make pesto - it would not even begin to chop up the basil leaves or the nets. After 20 minutes the leaves were slightly bruised and the nuts were completely untouched and pristine. The garlic was barely bruised. The parmesan and olive oil however were a soggy mass of oily mush.My husband finally gave up and tried to remove the jar from the base. In any food processor or blender I've ever used, you secure the blending jar or container to the base by giving it a little twist to lock it into place. Then to remove it, you give it a little twist in the opposite direction, Not this one. My husband gave a little twist to the blender jar to remove it from the base and when he lifted it, the entire bottom of the blender jar - the collar and the cutting blade assembly - separated completely from the blender jar, leaving a big hole in the bottom of it and unblended pesto flowed out all over the counter and floor. What a mess.This is a worthless piece of junk and made my life a little worse just by owning it.

Author: Jesse Lidgey
Title: I'm stunned...
Body: We are all familiar with the visual of the crotchety, old man shouting at cars driving 3 mph over the speed limit in his neighborhood. When we see him we may think to ourselves, Geeze guy, settle down, you're going to pull something... before it dawns on us that before long, WE will be that crotchety old man or woman. For me anyway, there is this realization that given how jaded I already am at 35 about all of life's little annoyances that full-on crochetyness is an inevitability...and that it isn't all that far off.What makes me particularly salty are all the CRAP products out there that CRAP OUT on you before they should. When did it become a bleeping foregone conclusion that 80% of consumer products will turn to worthless CRAP in mere months? $200 for this? CRAP in a heartbeat. $120 for that? Yep, turned to CRAP in lightning speed. Sure, the more you spend the lesser the probability the product will be CRAP but there is no hard and fast rule where you spend X and you're guaranteed to avoid CRAP. It's a poor commentary on the whole human race in my opinion...but I digress.Every so often however, in the midst of thousands upon thousands of CRAP products here and CRAP products there, you come across a gem. THIS BLENDER, LADIES AND GENTLEMAN, IS THAT GEM. I think I paid $29 for this thing when I bought it a few months ago. I figured meh...I can either spend $29 and get a CRAP blender or $100 and get CRAP blender like I've historically done in the past...so I decided to go the cheap CRAP option. You can imagine my surprise and utter delight when this beast turned out to NOT be CRAP...but a ray of light and hope in a dark, dark CRAP consumer-product world.I use this blender virtually every night and I'm not easy on it. I jam a lot of frozen fruit down it's gullet before slamming the puree button without remorse and it gobbles the frozen fruit like Joey Chestnut gobbles hotdogs on the Fourth of July. It's incredible. I love this blender. I LOVE IT. And to have paid $29 bucks for this thing?! You kiddin me?! Unreal!Despite relying upon reviews, I seldom write them because I'm a busy guy...and that is something I feel badly about. But this freaking blender... I couldn't NOT write a review. So I hope it helps you make the decision to buy this thing...and I hope when you buy it and start loving it like I do...that it helps you to become just a little less jaded too.March 2022 Update - Oh yes, she's still goin' strong! So if you came here looking for CRAP, best keep a walkin'!

Author: Bit 'O History Buff
Title: Won't power after 5 uses; less than 2 months old, and TERRIBLE manufacturer customer service!
Body: This blender's power suddenly stopped after literally 5 uses. On the rare occasion I've used it, I use it solely to blend protein powder, almond milk and banana, with 6 small-sized ice cubes from a silicone tray, which I add 2 at a time so as not to jam. Since this purchase is 7 weeks old, Amazon advised me to contact Hamilton Beach (which can only be done via an email submission form), as my purchase is still under warranty; I did. I provided the model number and the issue. I could not initially locate the series number. A CSR from Hamilton Beach write me and guided me to find that before I could be helped. I then made the time to figure that out, send a reply with the series number, and ANOTHER CSR wrote me to tell me that I would need to detail all of the ingredients I've used with the blender, their MEASUREMENTS, and when the last use was, before I could be helped further. I have never had to go through such hoops for a replacement purchase -- of a BLENDER, no less. This thing's going in the trash. Guess I'll eat the darn $35. NEVER AGAIN, will I buy a thing from Hamilton Beach.

Author: LoveSkulls13
Title: After 10 unsuccessful minutes trying to blend a smoothie…
Body: …I finally gave up, poured the whole, still un blended mass into my food processor and had it done in 20 seconds. Of course, by then it was pudding, not a smoothie. Understand, this was BEFORE I added anything like frozen fruit or other harder to blend items—it was all soft fruits and vegetables. I’ve had excellent luck with refurbished appliances, so I don’t know if it’s the refurbishment that sucks or the appliance itself sucks; all I know is that it…sucks. Maybe it would be okay if you only need it a few times a year for cocktails or something like a thin diet drink, but if you’re plan on using a blender on a regular basis, don’t cheap out like me. The only reason I’m giving this two stars is 1) I should’ve sent it back after the first disappointing time I tried it and 2) when it comes to appliances, more often than not, you get what you pay for—I should’ve paid out for a ninja or some other heavyweight. Because, dude—pudding’s great, but you can’t slurp it down running out the door because you’re always late like me.Update: Forgot to mention another important downside—this thing is LOUD. I mean, like heavy machinery loud. My cats aren’t even fazed by the vacuum cleaner, but when they see me pull this out, they scatter. This makes my food processor sound like gentle rain. I really, really hate this blender.

Title: NICE BLENDER FOR THE PRICE
Body: This blender is a nice blender for the price. I use it to make smoothies. It has a glass pitcher, but the top and other parts are plastic. The box indicates that the item is made in China. It is not the quality of product that I am used to owning, but again, for the price it's a nice purchase. The top was too snug and difficult to fit initially, but after a few attempts of firmly pushing it into place and lifting it off, it became easier. Now the top can be put on and taken off easily, while still being the snug fit it needs. I do not put the plastic pieces in the dishwasher because the plastic appears to be of poor quality, but I expect if I hand-wash the plastic it should last as long as the motor. I would recommend this to people who would like a nice blender within this price range. However, if you are looking for top-of-the-line in a blender, this isn't it.

Body: I like fruit smoothies. The fruit settings are stupid and dont work. So if you up for a frustrating time of slamming your blender against the counter over and over this is the blender for you.

Author: S. Bailey
Title: I Threw This Hot Mess Blender" in the Trash"
Body: I don't write reviews. However, this blender works so poorly that I'm making an exception.I make fresh juice drinks and smoothies every day. I also travel frequently and I'm happy to use absolutely anything that's available to keep up my routine. I am not a blender snob. I see no point in those $300 blenders and have an amazing $60 blender from Oster for my everyday smoothie workhorse. I purchased this blender to use at a rental house I was at for an extended time during the pandemic. This is the absolute worst blender I've ever encountered. Let me be clear... There is no blending. Chopping? Used loosely, maybe. Blending? No.Blades are dull.Power is weak.Unnecessarily noisy (all blenders are loud. This is NOISY.)Does not blend - anything.Leaves everything in big shredded chunks more like you pulsed a food processor.I first tried a kale drink and it was undrinkable. Everything was the consistency of knife chopped vegetables after blending. And not incorporated into the liquid at all. Ok smoothie drinkers, you know kale can be tough so I tried to give it the benefit of the doubt. I've since tried all of the following: apples, grapes, beets, spinach, orange, celery, cucumber, pineapple, strawberries, kiwi, raspberries. Lots of water, no ice, nothing frozen. All just undrinkable, unmixed, chunky messes every time. I'm happy with thicker drinks with all the pulp. But this...is not that. The tipping point for me - I attempted simple strawberry banana and yogurt smoothies for the kids. 3 of the softest things you can find. Total failure. Never blended up no matter how long it ran. The banana and strawberry stayed in chunks so big they just ate it out of a bowl with a spoon.If you take nothing else from this review know this - this blender is such a hot mess that when I bought another Oster to replace it, I briefly considered keeping it to donate and decided it would be horrible of me to give it anyone else. It's in the trash.

Author: Christopher Denny
Title: Read your manual & stop whining like this blender...
Body: Yes, it might take both thumbs to pop the lid on this blender, but it has to be tight because there is an open and close spout on the top. You could not pour from that spout if the lid was loose. (Better a little tight than loose at all.)...Read the little manual that is provided. It recommends adding 8 ounces of liquid to any beverage that you make: milk, water, juice, vodka--whatever suits your drink. This is not primarily a vegetable chopper. You can't fill it full of carrots and get carrot juice. If you want a smoothie, then follow a smoothie recipe. Add anything hard (like carrots) in chunks; not whole pieces. If you are looking for a great blender for milkshakes and/or smoothies, this is it! Only takes a few minutes to clean. Looks better in person. Nice design. Takes up very little counter space...If you want a healthier shake, then add a protein drink or reduced fat lactose-free milk to frozen yogurt. It's as satisfying as any high-calorie milkshake. I haven't had the occasion yet to add booze, but I'm sure that goes down easy, too. (Plastic flexi-straws are still sold in little boxes at Target for 89 cents. But for the thicker shakes, you can find the big, individually wrapped straws in a big box on Amazon for 9.95.)

When removing the glass container from the base you have to pull it straight up, if you turn the container as you’re removing it the contents will empty out of the bottom. I let it run for about a minute and the fruit & vegetables are pulverized. The cover does not fit snugly on the glass container. Noise level is same as other blenders

Author: Novel Gazer
Title: Good price, good value
Body: Our workhorse Cuisinart blender finally died after 15 years and we needed a replacement. We were willing to spend $80 or so on a Cuisinart or other prestige-name blender, but the reviews were so mixed. Apparently even the big brands just don’t make ‘em like they used to. And all of the plastic (as opposed to glass) now typically used in blender pitchers gave us pause—we just didn’t buy the explanations that plastic is somehow better. We like the solidity of glass. So after reading the mixed reviews on much pricier blenders, we decided to spend less money and take a chance on this blender for the time being. We have been pleasantly surprised. It is light, but feels solid and runs well. And the separate pour spout minimizes drips. The only reasons the review is not five star is that the cleaning setting (an alternative use for one of the regular settings) doesn’t seem to work super well (still need to wash the pitcher out with a sponge, not a huge deal) and the tight-fitting lid is very difficult to pry off when it is time to wash the pitcher. Hoping it loosens up a tiny bit over time. But overall, we are quite pleased—so far, so good!

Author: L. Jimenez
Title: CHEAP PLASTIC
Body: This is the by far the worst blender I have ever purchased. I previously owned a blender by Hamilton Beach, so I thought it was a decent buy at 29.99. After all, the Hamilton Beach blender I had before which is similar to this model but better quality in every way (rubbery plastic parts rather than hard, crappy easily shattered plastic), also cost me roughly $30. I prefer glass jar blender for the same reason as it comes with a thick, heavy glass, rather than that hard scratchy plastic and which this happens to be, but the glass on this model appears to have a yellowish tint, maybe it's me, but it was the first thing to turn me off. Secondly, the top doesn't close properly and when you look closely at the cheap black plastic there's a thin little odd flap at the top that doesn't adequately cover the useless hole in the lid and the plastic appears to be made of some hard black play-doh my two-year old chewed up and fashioned into the blender top, complete with a tiny, clear plastic flip top that scream I'm cheap! Not smooth at all! C'mon Hamilton Beach! I know it's all about planned obsolescence with products we buy these days, but this is downright INSULTING to make something of such poor craftsmanship. I like a good deal but if you can't enjoy it, it's not worth it! So Kohl's, here it comes!

Author: Jon Reyn
Title: This is great
Body: My older one i got broke after 2 years, and another one I bought that was also a food processor (was ~$45) broke after the first use (i was making a smoothie with frozen fruits). This works great, easy to use, easy to clean, and have had no issues. I should point out that this is glass and the previous ones I had were hard plastic (this makes a difference in the durability of blenders). Also, it sound like a blender; just as loud and everything if anyone was wondering about the noise level.

Author: Patricia
Title: Good price, NOT worth it
Body: When it didn't die, after 4 months of use in a single household (I had surgery in that 4 months so max used a dozen times- I am prolly exaggerating on the use), it had a good blending power. The gasket to keep it tight, failed by the 4th use. Thought it was used error. No, it wasn't. That is why it made it harder to clean when it didn't seal right. Honestly, I'd pass this one over. Don't go through the trouble I did. It now doesn't turn on, even after the reset they advise you to do. It has turned into more of a headache to use this blender than the small single blender from Slobly, I found. It was a good price but it not worth it. Even if you get the insurance, be prepared to use it.

Get it.

Ninja's are dangerous, but they're a lot faster, a lot more effective. Darn it.

Author: Lisa V.
Title: Does not blend seeds well
Body: I purchased this item based on reviews after viewing and comparing several models. After using twice to make smoothies, it does not perform as expected. The base is too wide and allows seeds and honey to sink to the bottom not allowing the blades to pull up and mix. I ended up with a chunky smoothie. The pour spout is awkward and not easy to clean because of the crevices. I'm really disappointed with this blender overall. I'm not sure how long I'll put up with it before getting rid of it because I'm sure that I cannot return it. I already know which blender I will be purchasing to replace but will go elsewhere to purchase.

Author: Dana hume
Title: as advertized
Body: It is a great blender, exactly what i expected.

Author: Heather McCarthy
Title: Bought This to Replace a 10+ Year Old Oster Blender
Body: Does not have the power of my previous blender! I use this several times per week to make dairy-free milk and cheese alternatives after my old blender burned out. This blender does not blend up soaked cashews smoothly, so straining the resulting mixture is an added step not needed prior to this unit. This might be great for someone making smoothies, if they don't mind extra texture in their drinks. Might be perfect for margaritas or milkshakes. But not great for making plant-based beverages or sauces.

Author: Rebecca Leuenhagen
Title: It's just a blender.
Body: I've used my blender about a dozen times to make breakfast smoothies. Ingredients included kale/spinach, liquid, berries. It is not unusual for a leaf to get stuck on a blade and not be shred. It produces otherwise leaf bits 2-3mm size. Fruit pureed completely. I typically make 12-16 oz quantities. It's motor is also loud-it sits in the corner of the kitchen so the sound hits the underside of cabinets, and two walls. Maybe I should have spent more for a smoother smoothie maker.

Author: Lucretia
Title: Must buy
Body: Great inexpensive blender, super durable too.

Body: Buyers beware. Spend your money elsewhere. This blender is extremely loud, is not powerful enough to blend anything frozen (ice, frozen fruit etc) without great difficulty and smelling like burning rubber/plastic.First of all, two out of the three times I have used it the bottom has come apart while removing the picture from the base and made a huge mess. I am so disappointed I wasted my money.

I was always left with little chunks of frozen fruit in my drink instead of a smooth smoothie. the top reviewer suggest adding more liquid for better mixing. i added enough oj and frozen berries for almost 2 pints of smoothie and i have no interest in drinking more than that. if i wanted to drink a gallon then maybe this would work. i don't know because i didn't try. i personally think the blades are set to high and with the wider sides of the container, the frozen parts slide underneath. i don't know. i guess i'll go back to my 10 year old blender.

This Hamilton works Great if not Better than my Ninja at Blending and chopping up Smoothie Fruit. Such as Apples! If it can smooth Apples I thougt, as thats the hardest fruit I put in my Smoothies, then I am good to go! And it did. Completely Smooth Smoothie! I am so Happy that this Blender worked so well, like I thought it would and I love that the Picher is made of Glass. Fullly Pleased with this Product!

Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   Dislike that it smokes the 2nd day of use after 5-10 seconds of spinning. Even my dog has to cover his face when I blend in the morning. Just kidding about the dog. It has some positives but unfortunately if the blender doesn’t work it’s no good. I guess that’s what you get for going cheap.

Author: Kerrie
Title: Don't Plan on Ice
Body: Could NOT get it to blend ice for a smoothie. Thought at first that I'd missed extra parts in the box or something, but after I watched the youtube video it became apparent that mine just didn't work like the one in the video. The video uses a lot of frame cuts so I don't know if somewhere in the background they secretly ran the thing for 20 minutes to get their smoothies or what, but I can't get it to crush ice. If I hadn't already opened it and tried to use it I would be returning it to put the cost toward a Ninja blender.

Author: a reviewer
Title: Don't waste your money.
Body: Quite possibly the worst blender I've ever purchased. Yeah it's cheap and there's a reason for that. It was supposed to be a time saver for me in the mornings, but it takes 15 minutes to blend a simple smoothie. Fifteen. Minutes. With pauses while I pry off the impossible lid to smoosh things down in hopes that it will get actually blended. We're talking five ice cubes, a cup of milk, protein powder, half cup or so of small frozen fruit pieces, maybe some spinach. Fifteen. Minutes.

Title: Great Option for the Price!
Body: I have several other Hamilton Beach appliances and I can only hope this one will last as long. It's sturdy and gets the job done. I've yet to use the self-clean feature, but I doubt that's much quicker or simpler than just hand washing it (which isn't effortless, so 4/5 there). My biggest complaint is the cover seems to fit a bit loose (not too big of a deal, I just make sure to hold it down for extra assurance). Overall easy 4/5, and not too far from a 5/5 purchase.

Author: LDuBoise

Author: Matthew McGinley (real name™)
Title: Good blender for the price
Body: It did my smoothies just fine, ice and all. No problems. What more could you ask from a blender? Not like the ones years ago where the blades would break upon encountering ice. This one works fine and is a real bargain for under $30.

Body: Only smoothies and its its dull as ever wont blend after nearly less than 90 days but to late to return

Author: Lisa Butler
Title: doesn't engage
Body: Have only used this twice but we noticed that both times, there are moments when the spinner at the bottom isn't engaged with the blades. It just spins making an incredibly loud sound. All at once it will catch and do the job but only for a few seconds and then it's just spinning again. Can't say that I'd recommend this product. It's pretty disappointing.

Body: It works well, just like any other blender, looks to be of good quality, like the rest of the brand’s products. I’ve only made purées and milk shakes so no ice crushing at all. It’s as noisy as a regular blender too.

Body: Yes i like itVery good product

Author: John C. Tucker III
Title: So far so good
Body: I just got it today and used it for the first time, of course it is better to wait a few months before writing a review to see how it holds up. However I decided to start my review now and edit it or update it in the future after more use. But I did use nine pieces of frozen banana approximately 1 inch each and it blended with no problem whatsoever. I keep on reading and occasional comment on here about how it does not crush ice or frozen fruit? Not sure if they got a lemon or defective blender because it blended up these Frozen pieces of banana in seconds. I had a blendtec that was probably $350 that I had for many years that ended up failing. Of course this Hamilton Beach is not nearly as powerful or as loud but I could buy 12 Hamilton Beach blenders for the price of just one blendtec. Aesthetically it is much nicer than my blendtec was and I like the glass jar instead because the plastic ones always get stained and cloudy after a while. So far so good

Author: Peggy J.

Body: Don't waste your money. Mine stopped working. I haven't even had it for a year.

Body: This is a cheap blender that gets the job done but if you're gonna go after the most basic glass jar blender that money can buy, save a few bucks and just get this one https://amzn.to/3wPZLwi. The blades and motor are basically the same and does the exact same stuff. Only difference is the price. Save a few bucks and drop elite from the name. Hope this helps

Body: Bought two of these because the first one took so long that I thought it was lost. I was trying to blend cardboard suspended in water for an art project. Half cardboard half water with a nice layer of water on top, nothing it shouldn't have been unable to handle. Within 20 seconds on the second lowest setting the blending unit starts smoking horribly and then dies. Wack.

Author: Ahmad J Ahmadi

Author: Nicky Flippers
Title: Lid from Hell.
Body: I never in a million years thought I’d be leaving a negative review on a blender, but here we are.Power and noise level aside, this thing fails my test because it takes the power of Thanos and full infinite stone gauntlet to remove the top lid. Try to push it off with your thumb, you’ll snap your thumb in half. Try to pry it from the front, you’ll tear your finger nails off. Want to wedge a butter knife between it and try to hammer it off like a stone chisel? Prepare for a catastrophe. Because that’s what I had to do and it ended in absolute disaster that has me still cleaning up after three days. It just baffles me that a lid would be more secure than a space station airlock. At this point I just leave it on and stuff the ingredients through the pour spout because I just don’t have the will to fight it anymore. This blender has broken me and I’m two more smoothies away from breaking it.

Title: Would not buy again

Title: Works as Well as I Had Hoped
Body: Decent blending power. Gives me consistent, smooth, fully blended drinks. No problems so far. Just remember to load your ingredients into the cup you're drinking from, NOT the blender. I add the fruit, milk/liquid, and ice into my 16 oz bottle BEFORE I dump it into the blender to make sure I know there's enough liquid inside. doesn't matter if it's a $30 blender or $300 - don't measure inside blenders, can create a lot of problems.

Title: Works Better than More Expensive Blenders
Body: This blender works better than much more expensive blenders. I use it for making smoothies and it blends them perfectly...no having to open lid and stir contents to get it to blend like I did with another popular brand that was more expensive. It's easy to clean except for the sprout on top of lid, I don't know why they put that there. It is noisy but not any more so than most other blenders. The only real negative is it's hard to get the lid on and off but that just makes me work my muscles more, so maybe that's a positive too! Highly recommend!

Title: High power, however, cannot process food properly
Body: Second review after using the unit for six months, the shape of the blades does not work well for pasty or more solid food, shortly after starting to rotate, the food concentrates on the side and a gap is created in the center. It is necessary to turn off the blender and stir the food with a spoon, turn it back on and repeat this process until the desired food processing is achieved. I try to make hummus and it takes me longer for that reason, I don't recommend this product.

Author: meg
Title: Milkshake machine!
Body: I love milkshakes but got tired of hand mixing milk and ice cream together. I bought this blender brand new and as soon as it delivered, I plugged it up, and it wouldn’t turn on...I was going to give this blender a one star review, but then I called Amazon to see if they could help me with this problem. They ended up sending me a second one and had me return the broken one.Once the second blender delivered, I plugged it in...and it worked! I was very happy with my purchase and highly recommend this one. It is a bit loud, but that’s expected for a blender. It’s also cheaper than most blenders that work the same. This blender has 4 settings (one specifically for milkshakes!) and they all work very well. It’s very easy to clean, just don’t cut yourself! Hamilton Beach brand has always been a very good brand to me. If you’re looking for a blender to make milkshakes or smoothies, then this one is for you! Five stars for the new blender!

Body: ...which is to say, not much for this cheap blender. I've had it for 1.5 years, and it's time to admit that it SUCKS. It does not blend. Despite their wave technology in the blender pitcher, hardly anything ever moves around. It takes me upwards of 20 minutes just to make a fruit smoothie because I have to stop every 3-5 seconds to stir/move the contents around. And even then, not everything is blended. Learn from my mistakes and pay the extra $10 or so for a better blender.

There's like a pocket/gap at the bottom of the blades that make it hard to clean without using a knife or risk cutting yourself on the blades.Overall, terrible purchase.. Do not buy.

Title: This is a really great blender if you don't want to blend things
Body: I bought two of these blenders in hope that I could get them to work. The first one worked for about 30 seconds. I stopped it to mix in the contents and then it wouldn't turn it back on. I was sent another one and this one turned on but the blending power is really poor. The blades don't spin contents into them unless it is super liquidy and so it will only blend what is immediately around it but none of the other contents so you have to constantly stir. It shouldn't be so hard to max a smoothie! I am returning this one too. I'm not that mad because of the price point but the reviews seemed misleading. Ya, it's easy to clean. But that's about it.
