Author: FitMom29
Title: Lasts 6 months
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   First, I’ll start by saying I’ve ordered this blender 3x. I first ordered it in 2018. At the time I used it maybe two days a week before I lost in in a house fire. While replacing everything, I ordered this again Feb 2020. The first one arrived broken. Amazon sent a replacement. I used it faithfully at least 5 days a week to make my morning smoothie. I always add leafy greens to my smoothies along with flax seeds and chia seeds. They didn’t blend well and my smoothies were always crunchy with seeds and bits of greens; kale was the worse. It also has a hard time with ice and frozen fruits/veggies. It took a delicate balance of almond milk and water to get it to finally blend without making the smoothie too watery. Washing it wasn’t too bad but the gap below the component holding the blades was nearly impossible to clean.I noticed the motor starting to have a hard time about 4 months in so I started to break out my smoothie by adding a few ingredients at a time and then blending. It officially went out for good just under 6 months in. Since the price is low, I’d say double it and get something that lasts longer. My main motive for buying this one is because of the glass, but now I’ll be looking for more well known blenders.

I've used it a total of 6 times so far and it only worked great 1 out of the 6 (blended liquids), it worked just ok 1 other time (made a smoothie with fruit and ice) and it sucked all 4 other times (smoothie, herbs and seasoning blend, pureed pumpkin, can't remember). I had to keep on stopping the blender, opening it and using a fork to either dislodge the items in the blender or push them down. It was frustrating. I don't know if it's because of how the blades are positioned but it truly doesn't work like it should. Also the noise it makes! Oh my goodness. I'm surprised a lot more reviews haven't mentioned that. Please do yourselves a favor and purchase a different blender.

Author: Karen
Title: Never again, Hamilton Beach!
Body: This is a terrible blender.I received it as a gift a few years ago when I was contemplating getting more into cooking (I don’t really cook) and a friend heard me talk about researching blenders. It’s horrible. It’s never been particularly good at blending and the tiny food processing part is also not great. However, it was a gift and I was basically stuck with it. I also did not start magically cooking (surprise, surprise) so that was fine.Until yesterday.Now, due to the pandemic I’ve been home ALL THE TIME, and I have actually finally been trying to make more food. Last year, I made some watermelon juice with the blender by blending up chunks of watermelon and I thought, hey, let’s do that again when I bought a bad watermelon back in March, April? (Time has ceased to have meaning.) This watermelon was one of the ones that is pretty dense and not sweet at all but should taste OK with some ice mixed in as a drink. So I cut it into chunks, tossed it into the blender, hit the button, and waited.And waited. And waited. And waited.Nothing blended.I tried stirring it a little. Taking out some of the watermelon. Adding some water. Nada.In desperation I kept hitting the pulse button and that didn’t do anything either.Please keep in mind that this blender sounds like an aircraft carrier taking off directly next to your head. I put ear plugs in.I let the blender on for 15 minutes before giving up. That was definitely a mistake on my part - I should have given up much earlier.But the story’s not over!So yesterday, I once again cut open a watermelon to find out it was terrible (I just can’t pick them, I guess), so I decided to try the blender again. Only this time, I thought I’d be smart and dice the watermelon into tiny little pieces first. (Think the size of onions in your salsa.) And, hurray, it worked! Juice was made in about 5 seconds!Feeling pleased with myself, I pick up the pitcher to pour it out and IT SEPARATES COMPLETELY FROM THE BASE. The watermelon juice explodes out everywhere over my clothes, the counter, my cabinets, and my wood floor.So now I no longer have a usable blender, wasted about an hour of my day (prepping and cleaning), and had to toss out half a watermelon (and most likely the other half).I’ve used this blender less than 10 times.DO NOT BUY THIS BLENDER. SAVE YOURSELVES.

Body: Great for every day use!

Author: Wanda Williams
Title: Blender still working strong
Body: I purchased this blender over two years ago and it still works perfectly, haven't had no problems. Well worth the purchase

Author: leelah
Title: Happy with my purchase.
Body: I love this blender. It's great for smoothies made with frozen fruit and veggies. The clean up is simple when following the included instructions. The noise level isn't great but it takes very little time to blend ingredients and shouldn't bother the neighbors.

Author: Kimmie
Title: Blender is awesome.
Body: It came at the right time. I am loving it.

Author: Jannah rashiid
Title: Horrible get something else
Body: Horrible blender. Doesn't blend seeds? Horrible and cheap

Author: Kimberly
Title: Disappointed
Body: The glass leaked on the bottom into the mixing area. Cant find any obvious cracks orvrrasons why it would.

Author: Amanda Owens
Title: Blender
Body: The blender is a little smaller than I was expecting but still big enough for us. It is a thick glass not plastic which I didn't realize but again not a problem just unexpected. It is a little loud but most blenders are. My daughter loves smoothies so it gets lots of use.

Author: Noncho
Title: Decent product
Body: Still works (it's been 6 years), I didn't use it too much but overall it did its job.

Author: annie briggs
Title: Great for smoothies
Body: The top doesn't fit on right but i hold it on and its fine for smoothies.

Author: NoWorkyJerky
Title: Bought 2, broke 2 in 3 months.
Body: I'd get about 30 or so pulls from this device before the motor stops working. Just making smoothies here.

Author: Ricardo Arenas
Title: No good
Body: It lasted 2 days, beware! Don’t waste your money

Author: Dawn Hallums
Title: The best
Body: Love it

Author: CapeCodMom
Title: Not a good blender
Body: Not a good blender, the bottom is a cheap, light plastic piece that broke within 3 months of using, liquid all over the counter and floor. Also the lid on it has a part that is a plastic that does not close. You have to hold it shut with your hand so the liquid doesn't shoot out at you. What a joke! Who made this? lol Also I tried to go to Hamilton Beach website and purchase the jar collar and they no longer sell it because they know it's defective!! I am now looking for another blender. Does anyone have any recommendations? I use the blender for Bulletproof coffee every morning, that's it!

Author: misscrusty
Title: Pass
Body: Cheap materials other than glass jar. Had to wrestle with lid to remove and it was so flimsy I was afraid of breaking it. Affordable / powerful, yes. But also any ugly appliance. Returned.

Author: Mo
Title: Not my best purchase.
Body: Patience is what I need to use this blender. Not very pleased with the blending power. I struggle with smoothies and blending iced okra. Requires a lot of patience.

Author: Happy Shopper
Title: Awesome Blender!
Body: I compared this blender to the expensive brand I've been using for the past 5 years. Decided to give it a try. It actually blends BETTER than the expensive brand I have, and is so much easier to clean! It is not always true that you get what you pay for, in this case, the less expensive blender actually is better than the higher priced one! Thank you!

Author: Maria C. Velasquez
Title: Listen to the reviews on this one
Body: Im not often one to believe reviews that are too negative if they are countered by great reviews at the same time. I went ahead and made the order but im beyond disappointed. I got this blender because my Ninja smoothie one wasn't even blending frozen fruit. I thought for sure this blender would at least do that. NOPE. The blades are far too small and it doesn't blend frozen fruit, ice--- just liquid really. DO NOT buy.

Author: Share
Title: God for the value
Body: Almost Everything is great about this blender except the loud noise it's fast but it's loud otherwise I would have given it 5 stars

Author: S.j
Title: Sad
Body: Stop blending after a few uses

Author: Mark Feeney
Title: Weak blender
Body: Wanted to use it to make smoothies... won’t grind up frozen fruit.

Author: Nicole
Title: Very nice and worth the money
Body: The product is very nice and great price.

Author: Angela Long
Title: Easy to clean!
Body: Love it, exactly what I wanted! Does what I would expect from it.

Author: Sayana
Title: Fine
Body: It is not a powerful blender but fine with smoothies with soft fruits and veggies if you'll cut to tiny pieces.

Author: Dan
Title: only for small smoothies
Body: The machine only lasted about 2 months. The engine is not made for frequent usage with ice crushing. We ordered a more powerful now. You need 1500watt range to do big smoothies and crush ice.

Author: Sherry Wu
Title: Great product you could buy!
Body: This blender is easy to assemble. The shipping is faster than I thought. And I used it to blend a avocado banana smoothie, which is really great. There are different functions you could choose to blend. The noise is not very noisy which I could stand. And it is easy to clean after I used the blender. Very satisfied.

Author: Nicole B.
Title: A+ Blender and Fantastic Seller!
Body: A+ Blender and Fantastic Seller!

Author: Susan
Title: Great product
Body: It was a gift

Author: stacey keeton
Title: The cost is what I like most.
Body: Very happy with my blender. I made my first healthy celery and tomatoes smoothie. Very satisfied.

Author: Alison Pfeiffer
Title: Do NOT buy this blender
Body: I never write negative reviews, but I am so disappointed with this blender. It does not chop anything. When making smoothies, it only blends the very bottom bits by the blades. I have to turn it off and mix up the ingredients with a spoon multiple times before I can have a completely blended drink. I have tried adding more liquid, but it takes so much liquid to blend properly that by then it is basically juice. I will be purchasing a ninja next time.

Author: jane missildine
Title: Great product!
Body: Great, accurate, with fast shipping! Thanks!

Author: KB
Title: waste of money
Body: barely blended anything

Author: Sandra Fink
Title: Quite the power for as small as it is but not to small perfect size
Body: I really like this blender,So far have made milkshakes yummy,I’m sure I will be doing a lot more 😎

Author: Roderick J. Rogers
Title: Great value for the money
Body: I bought this blender primarily to make smoothies, mixed drinks, salsas, and salad dressings. I’ve used it a couple times since it arrived a couple of days ago. It meets my expectations. the build quality is very good for the price point. I’d definitely recommend it.

Author: Andreasinwa
Title: Great blender for the money
Body: This blender works well. I really like having the glass container rather than plastic as it seems much more substantial. It does exactly what I needed it to do and I am pleased with the purchase

Author: Patricia Hayes
Title: Smelled bad then started to smoke and does not blend.
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
  
   Very disappointed with this blender especially since I like Hamilton Beach products. First of all this blender wouldn't blend normally... I had to use the pulse button but even that barely blended. After pulsing for 5 minutes with minimal results, it started to smell strong. I took the jar off the base and saw smoke where they connect. I then flipped the base over and a lot of smoke started coming out of the vents. It smoked over 5 minutes. Thankfully I was able to return it. Used it only once**

Author: cimi
Title: Disappointed
Body: Just received this blender today and I'm already disappointed. The lid will not stay on so I have to hold it down to use the blender. If anyone else had the same problem with the lid, please let me know how you solved it. I know I could send it back but that's more trouble than it's worth. I thought I was buying an American product so I was very disappointed to see it said Made in China on the box.

Author: Christiana Munaier
Title: Terrible
Body: Its literally the worse blender ever

Author: Andrea
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: Awful. Bought this to make smoothies. Takes forever and doesn’t work. It’s so frustrating!

Author: Lindsey W.
Title: DECEIVING INFO on item page
Body: when I found this item I was searching specifically for Hamilton Beach model #58149, which is the blender and the 3 cup food chopper together. it shows available in stainless & in black. the stainless was not available, so I chose the black. well when you choose the black option, it switches to item 58148(A) which is just a blender... Unfortunately I didnt see this BEFORE I ordered, because I wasnt expecting to be scammed. I ordered the 58149 because I needed the blender AND the chopper. Not what I got -- this is still showing this way - so use caution when looking at or ordering this item ! I will update the review on the performance if I decide to keep and use the item

Author: R-estatic
Title: Doest do s...
Body: AWEFUL

Author: Tinman
Title: Not bad !!
Body: I just use it for mixing drinks and easy stuff but if u need power get one that has a bigger motor & more buttons

Author: Lisa D.
Title: Not so great
Body: Sorry, wanted to like this but even making smoothies was difficult. All the fruit would get stuck at the bottom everytime. After 2 months, it started to get real hot and smoking. I threw it out and bought the Ninja!

Author: Angela
Title: Husband loves itDoe
Body: Husband loves it

Author: Cam Brown
Title: Good product.
Body: Slightly loud, but works well. Easy to clean. Thick glass pitcher.

Title: Never worked.
Body: Followed instructions. Tried to use. Never worked.

Author: keesh
Title: Your average blender
Body: Easy to use, like your typical blender. Nothing special about it. I typically use this blender for smoothies and it works well for that.

Author: Gene Peterson
Title: Great for blending water.
Body: Noisy. Poorly designed so it creates a pocket of air and everything just sits on top that bubble unless you pour more and more liquid into it. Great if you like watery smoothies. Or filled with glass chards because the pitcher broke for what seems like no reason.

Author: Nikolai Gravin
Title: Very useful and easy to clean
Body: I bought it to make soft, baby food when I had my widsom teeth removed. I have been using it for all kinds of juice and to cook mashed beans. It is very easy to clean: just take out the bottom part and you can clean the blade. Inexpensive, too. Love it.

Author: Katina George
Title: Nice addition to the kitchen
Body: Love this blender

Author: Al Bova
Title: Solid and well made
Body: This is a nice traditional blender, great for frozen drinks and fruit smoothies at a great price.

Author: P. Bloch
Title: Burned after 6 months
Body: Try to blend cooked beets (a little hard) and got stuck. Smelled burned.After that didn't work. Tossed it!

Author: Ms Stone
Title: Loud but

Author: Ellen Kibling
Title: Fast shipping
Body: Works great

Author: A
Title: Good value
Body: Works well, good value

Author: CS
Title: I like it.
Body: I purchased this to replace an old Osterizer blender, whose motor had burned out when I tried to crush ice. So far I'm happy with its performance. I like the fact that it will crush ice.

Author: Blanca Barajas
Title: Easy to clean.
Body: I love this blender. Is easy to clean. Its heavy duddy. I use it with frozen strawberries to make smoothies for my kids.Love it so much

Author: Matthew P. Lachance
Title: Is it amazing ?
Body: It's a blender...

Author: Vrtualme

Body: Not enough power to make smoothies. I've tried a few times now & it's pretty much useless as a smoothies maker. Would return it, but I've already tossed the box & such.

Author: SR
Title: Good one and worth for the price
Body: I love this belnder. I have experimented all the settings and it works perfectly. Until now I don't have any problem as it's just been a week. Will come back and review again after 3-4 months.🙂and yes it's noicy

Author: Orly E
Title: arrived fast. good product.
Body: Good product for it's price.

Author: marie a desir

Body: It is a nice blender...but it chops the content instead of blending. The blades are not correctly align to give you that smooth, unchop blend you're looking for.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not happy
Body: We had this blender for 4 months and it quit working! Will not buy again!

Author: Jeffrey Carrowiano
Title: Don’t use too much frozen items. It can’t handle too much.
Body: Great product, a little loud, I use it when I travel in hotel rooms and I get up super early and worry about disturbing my neighbors, so that’s the only reason I noticed it.

Author: L. E. Rike
Title: Cracked
Body: Cracked shortly after I bought it..was very careful with it.

Author: MrsFox
Title: More for your money! Love it.
Body: I love this blender. It's super heavy duty glass, and it was not expensive.I like that I can put it in my dishwasher and boom its clean! It works great!

Author: Marco Schindelmann
Title: It Bends Rather Than Blends Food
Body: OMGOSH!!! Worst blender of my life, and I'm OLD. It spins things around in circles and clumps them into submission. Portable version of the Gravitron. Yes, ZERO stars...

Author: Bria
Title: Must buy
Body: I bought this blender 6 years ago and it is still my favorite blender. It is inexpensive and works amazing gets the job done.

Author: Juan Peralta
Title: Leaks
Body: Started leaking 2 months in

Author: Jennif3rG
Title: Great product
Body: Great product

Author: NonameFlex
Title: Perfect blender for my daily smoothies!
Body: Great blender! I make smoothies in it and it works like a charm. Easy to clean, durable and the easy to pour out top makes it mess free. I would highly recommend this product.

Author: VJSmith
Title: Perfect Blender for Price
Body: I had purchased this blender years ago when it fell and broke. I replaced it with a cheaper name brand that did not work out. The other brand came in about five or six different pieces that had to fit together and would not function if one of those pieces was off. I junked it and replaced it with this one, which has only three pieces the top, the cylinder and the base. Plug and play. Pay the extra dollar or two for piece of mind.

Author: Carol Schmitz
Title: Didn’t last long for hard jobs
Body: It was working well until my husband ran it too long and hard. Didn’t hold up to that and died

Author: Blaze
Title: good, but doesn't fully crush ice
Body: it does really well on frozen fruit, it works for what i wanted it for. does not cut up ice though.

Author: Lori
Title: Great product to blend my smoothies.
Body: I am impressed with the power of the Hamilton Beach Elite Blender. I bought it primarily to blend my smoothies. It does great with ice and frozen fruit. I like the lid with it’s pouring spout, as well. It’s a bit noisy but I will compromise that for a smooth smoothie.

Author: Toni C.
Title: Can’t beat this price!
Body: I’m super happy with this purchase. I think this blender is fantastic for the price point. Bought this because I started a smoothie detox. Sometimes it struggles to chop up frozen fruit if I haven’t added enough liquid or let the fruit defrost enough, but otherwise no issues. Cleaning it is super easy and I’m blown away by the size and quality of it.

Author: Leogirlj
Title: Great Choice!
Body: This blender is strong, effective, & very easy to clean. I love it!

Author: Michael Chaney
Title: Good Blender For The Money
Body: I just needed an inexpensive blender for smoothies and hummus. I have been making both for weeks now with no problems. Ice and fresh or frozen fruit blend efficiently and quickly with no lumps using smoothie mode. The blender makes really creamy hummus with chickpeas and olive oil. The blender is noisy but that's not a deal breaker for me. Good blender for the money.

Author: riotkitty
Title: Not bad!
Body: I've used this blender once and it was to make some broccoli soup. It worked fine. It's just very loud when in use. It's easy to use and clean. I'm hoping to make more things with it in the near future.

Author: Sabrina
Title: Good blender for smoothies
Body: Overall I like (not love) this blender. It works well with my frozen fruit for my smoothies.The main thing I don't like is that the whole thing is kind of large/heavy/awkward, especially the lid. So far it's getting the job done.

Author: Kirankumar T.
Title: Don't buy
Body: I literally used it twice to make some green juice and it was pathetic, I could feel the chunks in my mouth. I put it away and try to use it after a month and it won't work! I can't even return it because the return window is closed.

Author: Clara
Title: Brittle plastic parts, doesn't blend ice properly - SPEND THE EXTRA $ AND GET SOMETHING ELSE
Body: This blender only lasted us about 10 drinks. Mostly used it for protein powder shakes comprised of ice, fruit and powder. I added small amounts of each ingredient slowly but it didn't matter, the blender is not powerful enough to handle an ice tray of ice.... The motor sounds like it has something caught inside of it, probably plastic. After a couple of months it started to burn out and smoke.I wish I wouldn't have cheaped out on a blender.

Author: Andrew Farrell
Title: Works.
Body: Works.

Author: Michelle L
Title: Smoke
Body: This blender started smoking and bad smell

Author: Nina
Body: Wasn’t disappointed

Author: KAREN GAINES
Title: Worst Customer Service For Smoking Blender.
Body: I have never written a review before, but the poor customer service for a dangerous and inferior product has prompted me to do so. This product started smoking less than a month after purchase. After writing to customer service, I was informed I needed a series number. I sent them every number my elderly family member could find on it, including a number that said Series. I sent them a copy of my Amazon order. They just keep regenerating the same email, telling me they can't do anything without a series number. This family member had a different, smaller blender for many years. I thought I was doing him a favor by getting a larger one and now I regret it , because he has nothing to use.

Author: Oldadmark
Title: This is horrible for grinding coffee beans!
Body: I bought this for general use but mainly to grind coffee. This replaced one that stopped working. The previous one had no trouble grinding beans. This one is terrible. Beans and partially ground beans get caught in the space just below the blades. No matter how many times I empty it and regrind, the same thing happens. Horrible machine!

Author: Charity hope
Title: Not working
Body: Used for for a week and started making grinding noise then smoking and stopped working

Author: ForeverYoung
Title: Do not buy!!! Spend the extra $$ for a REAL blender!!!
Body: I received this product February 30th and have used it under 10 times between now and then... After about the second use I started to notice the blades dulled even more and would take 10 mins to make a simple basic smoothie (it could not grind the fruit down)... And after just 30 days of owning it, the product burned up and no longer works. It’s cheap for a reason. Just spend the extra $$ on a real, functioning blender. Don’t waste your money on this junk.

Author: Kevin Speicher
Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
Body: This Blender is cheap and flimsy. It’s loud and it smells like it’s burning with every blend and even tho I’m only blending powder and water. ABSOLUTELY DOES NOT, “CRUSH ICE.” Wouldn’t recommend.

Author: Kayli Christina
Title: Extremely loud and hardly works
Body: Literally the worst blender I have ever purchased. Takes 20 minutes of struggle to even get the food to blend, and is extremely loud probably waking up every single one of my neighbors so I feel bad even using it. I wish I could return it but it’s already too late and I threw away the box it came in. Save yourself the money seriously.

Author: Marina
Title: Great
Body: I got exactly what I was looking for!

Author: Betty Newbold

Author: Kirsten

Body: I’ve used this blender three times and it BROKE. The blade completely broke off from the bottom. Pretty upset and would like a refund.

Author: Greg
Title: Doesn’t blend anything frozen
Body: Does not blend anything frozen no matter what setting you used. I’ve had it less than a year and it’s already broken down on the second use. Refund please.

Author: Nic

Body: It’s the same as the older version now I have 2. To do smoothies it takes along time with this brand ice is difficult to break down.

Author: Jasmyne Harper

Title: Don’t get it
Body: This thing is a complete disaster. It has basic design flaws, stuff gets wedged in at the bottom and doesn’t blend. It leaks and is a pain to clean. Manufacture needs to discontinue this and get a new designer.

Author: Alex

Body: I've had this for about a week now and I wish I didn't cheap out. Blades get stuck when blending frozen berries, it is extremely loud and everything gets stuck near the top. This thing doesn't blend well at all and only blends the bottom 1/4 of the blender and thats only if the blades don't get stuck. Trust me and spend a little bit more to get a more reliable blender.

Author: Hanna

Author: musiclover 1953

Body: I thought because of its low cost I would receive a bad product, but it turned out to be pretty good. Has not given any issues, and is not crazy loud.

Author: Mike Zelasko
Title: NOT AS GOOD AS DICRIBED

Body: Burned out the first smoothie. Everything looks and feels cheaply made. Not recommended for anything other than juice and batter.

I can’t make myself anything using the blender due to its noise.The lid has this weird vented hold. So when you put anything powder in the mixer it puffs out Of the vent if you are. Or holding it down. Powder everywhere.

Author: K. Wil
Title: It was great until....
Body: It was great until it wasn't. I've owned this blender for all of a month and a half. At times it stalls and kind of smells like it's burning and other times, it blends with precession. Until I noticed my smoothie leaking from behind the blender. It took some time to figure out what happened but I took it apart and noticed the rubber ring was torn. How that could have happened, only God knows.

Author: Ema
Title: Wont hurt your wallet
Body: This is a really decent blender and the price isnt bad either. It does the job, and saves you money.

Author: Andrew Reames
Title: Great design and great value
Body: This is a great low in blender that gets the job done. Is it for kale and other ingredients and it plays of all well and makes the kill pieces tiny enough to drink.A big plus is there's no rubber gasket to wash. The design of the blade is such that it fits perfectly on the bottom of the glass blender picher. Hasn't totally high speeds which is really all you need. I like the design and I think it's a great deal.

Author: Helena Guevarra

Body: Smoothie wasnt really smooth and fine like the other blender

Author: Sherri Anderson
Title: I don't recommend easily or often but.....
Body: Actually a great blender for the price. Blade attachment is one unit so a separate rubber gasket isn't involved to cause problems and wear out before blender does. That's a huge advantage. My main use is for a protein smoothie adding frozen fruit. I would like a little more power but this one works well enough because it circulates the mixture extremely well ~ much better than I've ever seen. I don't recommend easily but I am basically very pleased with this blender.

Author: TAS

Body: When we opened the package, the glass blender was cracked. Unusable.

Author: Anthony Bear

Body: Probably too high of expectations for a blender at this price. Used it to make nutrient drinks from raw vegetable, but didn't seem to blend the vegetables fine enough drink. Ended up returning it. Will have to try a Ninja Pro.

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: Perfectly blends a smoothie. Milk, ice, and protein powder....you’d swear it was an actual milk shake. Creates an interesting vortex that draws the liquid down to the blades. Just fill it, push the button, and forget it.

Author: AAli

Body: Great blender and doesn’t make a lot of noise. Overall with price and performance it’s great!

Body: It doesn't blend fruits without putting too much water in. Even after filling it upto the top.

Author: Jasmine

Body: Noisy as ever! Gets the job done though. I haven't tried to blend whole pieces of ice but it blends crushed ice pretty well. 4 stars.

Author: Claudia Molina
Title: It great
Body: Great

Author: Shaun Parks
Title: Makes the best Pina Colada I've ever made.
Body: I bought this specifically as a bar blender, which is, it seems, the intended purpose.This makes the smoothest, creamiest, pina colada I've ever made, you just have to let it run a pretty long time.Also has made a pretty wicked mudslide.I've had more than a few bar blenders over the years, this 1 is a bargain for the quality it puts out. You can buy specialty bar blenders that make chunky, crappy, drinks. This thing may be plastic, but it works like a pro.

Author: Stef
Title: Doesn’t work well at all :(
Body: It cannot handle ice -- which is very disappointing because all I wanted was to make a smoothie. Had to wait 10 minutes for ice to “soften” before I could actually blend it. Otherwise ice just sits there at the bottom, blades spinning, releasing a burnt smell. Disappointed disappointed disappointed.

Author: T. Lee
Title: Worth the buy
Body: Decent blender that's able to efficiently make smoothies.

Author: Abc
Title: Disappointed
Body: Blades are blunt . Smoothies are not smooth enough.

Author: Jake
Title: The perfect first blender
Body: Had this for 3 years and it's still running. It can get loud, it can be hard to clean, but if you're not trying to spend an arm and a leg on a Ninja or a Vitamix, this will get the job done.

Author: Luisa Green-Roman
Title: Excellent
Body: Very good

Author: William DeRaymond

Body: except that it is cheap plastic, I think, They are sending me a new one, but I paid 5.99 for shipping and handling and it is going on a week and I don't know if it has even shipped yet. I am waiting to see if it will hold up the second time around till I buy a better blender. Other than this issue it worked great.

Author: Maria B.

Body: Literally just pulled it out of the box and the lid was all scuffed up as if it’s been used before.

Author: Amanda
Title: The little blender that couldn’t
Body: This thing struggles to chop up ice. I have to help it along by stopping to stir the ingredients around with a spoon.

Author: infolink77
Title: Went into the trash after a week
Body: Bottom plastic of mixing bucket broke after one week upon getting lose and me tightening it.I then was forced to keep on using it, and wanted to prevent spillage, so I put it into the kitchen sink for a quick blend and let the liquid let run out just a bit. The motor would not run.So I put it back onto the counter top as I thought that maybe the outlet at the sink wasn't working.It would not work on the counter top either, all the while I already had the liquid in the jug and frantically trying to get my sh.... blended... It all in a sudden started working and I ended up flooding my counter top anyway...It went in a nice trajectory right into the trash bin.Hamilton Beach... I expected more from you, but I guess, $30 can't get you quality.I ordered a Blendtec. Went from lowest to highest quality and money.I really thought that Hamilton Beach was a standard that would hold up years and not one week.

Author: Vlad
Title: Good blender

Body: The top is kinda hard to remove

Author: Jake H.
Title: Good For The Price
Body: This is a good blender for the price, but it's definitely not my favorite blender I've ever had. It's a little leaky, and it doesn't chop everything up. I make basic green smoothies with spinach and fruit, and I get full pieces of spinach not chopped at all in my drink. I have to make sure to stop the blender, stir, start up again, and repeat the process a couple of times to get it right. Also, the container is full glass so you have to protect it very carefully not to drop it or get a crack while washing it in the sink.

Author: Ike
Title: Good quality, easy to clean
Body: Good blender. However I do not like the capdesign which allows to pour from the cap.Easier to use and clean by pouring from theglass than from the cap. Easy to clean blender.Met my expectations for the price.

Author: Nope

I usually dont add so much blueberry milk to my smoothies but i had to just so it would mix. I found i had to keep mixing the items myself bc it only liquified what was on the bottom

Author: jeanne Stillson

Body: Blends just fine- especially for smoothies. My last blender was plastic so I’m getting use to the heaviness of the glass one. All blenders are a hassle to clean

Author: Rated&Reviewed
Title: Terrible for green smoothies
Body: Doesn't blend kale or chopped spinach. Texture of plain frozen fruit + water smoothies is awful too. The lid is super irritating--it gets stuck and it's almost impossible to take off without it going flying. Don't buy this blender. (Also, the first one arrived shattered, had to reorder, and now am returning both).

Author: Philip
Title: Don't Say I Didn't Tell You So!! The motor starts smelling like it's burning in less than a minute!
Body: I've only used this blender about 5 times and already I'm smelling that funny smell like something is burning after less than a minute of blending. This is totally unacceptable. It wasn't even worth returning because they charge you a stocking fee. Not sure why- are they going to put it back on their shelf and sell it to someone else? Buy a different blender and save yourself the headache.UPDATE! I was washing the glass part in the sink, and, without hitting anything with it, a small piece of the glass chipped off. I didn't even notice it until I filled up the blender with liquid and it started spouting like a fountain!!

Author: mgpippo
Title: Disappointing
Body: I wanted a basic blender, nothing fancy. I tried to blend some almond milk, a banana, some quick oats. The container was not even halfway full...and it could not blend it! I tried to help it along but really this was very basic stuff and couldn't handle much of anything!!! Disappointed.

Author: Leslie Goetzinger
Title: Great deal
Body: Definitely worth it. Best blender I purchased.

Author: Dakota
Title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
Body: I bought this after reading multiple good reviews! I got the package the other day, washed the pitcher and tried using it tonight. It started off nicely blending, but then started smoking out of the base!!! The house now smells like smoke! Thankfully it stopped smoking after 30 or so minutes. The base is still hot to the touch! Be safe and order a different brand!

Author: K&H
Title: Broke fast
Body: The blender was great at first. Just like the reviews say. But, like the bad ones, it went bad fast. 3 weeks in the blades stopped spinning, something inside broke. Quick with my refund though. No customer service needed. So, I mean, seems to be a hit or miss deal.

Author: Jess
Title: Need more speed
Body: I love the glass of the blender. The speed seems a bit weak; not high-powered. Other than that, with discounts applied, it's a good steal and will be using it to blend more.

Author: Amanda
Title: Shocked at how great!
Body: Really thought this blender wasn’t going to impress me too much given the price but boy was I wrong! It shreds the ice and makes my shakes perfect!!! Even better than the really pricey one at work! I love the pour spout too!!! Definitely recommend this blender!

Don't buy this. Save up and get something that works.

Author: Skylar B

Author: Christian R.
Title: TERRIBLE!
Body: Do not buy this product. Spend your money elsewhere.I received this blender as a Christmas gift. It is absolutely the worst blender I’ve ever used. I can’t fathom how it’s rated so high.I use the blender to make protein shakes, and it is useless. Milk, a frozen banana, 3 ice cubes and protein powder is too much for it to handle. Blends the milk and powder but no amount of shaking gets the ice or banana to the blades. Takes 3 times as long as my last blender after all the stopping, stirring, and attempts to get the ice and banana chopped.

Author: Kelvin Dukes
Title: It could be a lot stronger , I'm just saying...
Body: Blending not very strong, blades are a little dull, have to be careful smell like motor may burn out, this is for mild use have a good feeling I will be replacing soon if used too often.

Author: clairebear
Title: Great option for basic blending needs
Body: Very impressed by the blending quality. It does a great job with smoothies, quickly and uniformly blending without leaving annoying chunks. The inclusion of an easy clean function is great, but I still end up disassembling it and cleaning it by hand, since there is a small space around the blade that doesn't get as clean as I'd like using the easy clean function.

Author: Amanda
Title: Works great
Body: Good price for what you're getting.

Author: Vera Scanlan
Title: A very sturdy, slick addition to your kitchen counter useful for many functions!
Body: I had a very old Hamilton Beach blender inherited from my dad and decided it was time to update. So I ordered the Hamilton Beach Power Elite Blender with 12 functions! My husband uses it to make his protein drink and I use it to make my healthy frozen fresh fruit smoothie with kale and ice cubes! The blender works perfectly for both our needs! We love it!

Author: Marcela
Title: Did not works espected
Body: Did not work as expected.

Author: Kindle Customer pjd
Title: Great blender
Body: Great powerful blender. Works perfectly well

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Works well for everday uses.
Body: Good buy for the price. Works well for small-scale uses. Can't over fill because it may cause blending to be sluggish.

Author: Aly
Title: Powerful, but inconvenient
Body: The blender's shaped at the bottom in such a way that it cannpt be easily rinsed out, there's a gap around the base of the blades where food gets caught, and it has to be disassembled to clean after EVERY use. It is more powerful than my last one, but I'm finding the top is getting popped off from both its vibration and from its design that's shooting ice cubes up to hit the lid.

Author: Marilyn Ross
Title: Its ok
Body: For the price it works

Author: EnJoyce
Title: Best Blender Ever!
Body: I purchased this blender as a gift for my daughter. I was able to inbox, set up and use it first To make smoothies lol. I was amazed as it performed better than my old version. It had a very sleek look, a lid that features a pourIng spout and the clean up was phenomenal. I would recommend this product for anyone that is looking for a quality blender. Great purchase as a gift and I'll have to buy one for myself.

Title: Worth the money

Author: Desiree oooo
Title: Sparks fly!! Becareful!!
Body: Just got in today and after rinsing out a few times and using it 3 times it works like a blender should. Nothing fancy. I am concerned about it sparking on me. I blended an iced coffee waited for it to stop and took it off when I removed it I seen a spark and a puff of smoke. Really concerning if I cant get help I will be returning it for safety purposes. Will update when I figure out a solution

Body: It cannot make a simple smoothie. KeepsGetting stuck. Even if I keep stirring or adding more liquid. Not worth it, I don’t know how it was an Amazon top pick. Forgot to mention this when requesting a refund but the smell the it gives off.. terrible. Like an overworked machine that doesn’t do anything.

Author: ST

Author: AshleyRose
Title: Blender works but the lid is a health hazard
Body: 1 Star because the lid that I was sent is unacceptably made! Literally looks like it was painted black and the plastic is peeling! This was brand new out of the box!! Used the blender without the lid and just covered with a tupper ware lid because I did not want any of the plastic from the blender lid to get inside my drink. Horribly made lid

Author: Sassysusie

Author: Elizabeth

Body: Honestly, this thing is terrible. If you want smoothies that are 90% liquid it works great, but put anything solid in here and you're stirring it every two seconds because the thing wont pull down the chunks to blend it properly, and yes I put the recommended liquid/solid ratio. Get a different blender

Author: Chad
Title: Electrical hazard
Body: Less than a week of having the blender, 3rd time using, the blender started to smoke and give an electrical smell.

Author: Alba

Body: I'm very disappointed with this products.It's the worst blender that I have purchased. The blades are horrible.They are not sharp enough to crush fruit and nuts.

Author: Sarasota SMB

Body: Started leaking after 15 uses of mixing fluids. Of no value. I threw it out.

Author: LIA
Title: GARBAGE
Body: I only used this blender three times before it started smoking on me smh

Author: cmills
Title: Spend a little more for a better blender!
Body: Do NOT waste your money. I bought this to make my sons food and figured I didn’t need a fancy blender because I’m basically just mixing things like cooked sweet potatoes, sweet peas, green beans, etc. with breast milk. It takes 10+ minutes to purée already soft foods. I find it hard to believe it would blend frozen fruits and ice. Not to mention it is extremely noisy which is not a big deal, but for all the noise it makes you would think it would be pretty powerful.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great buy. Inexpensive for quality product
Body: Works fantastic

Author: Amy
Title: RIP off.
Body: This product is a RIP off. Does not crush ice nor blend fruit for smoothies. The worst purchase I have made plus very noisy. I'm highly disappointed. I do not like hamilton beach products at all.

Author: TP
Title: Great value blender
Body: I use this mainly for making smoothies and it works well enough. Not as powerful as some other blenders out there, but for the price it’s great and has several nice presets. Works well at crushing frozen berries, but can’t quite get all of the raspberry/blackberry seeds.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Good value.
Body: Easy to clean and sturdy

Author: Matt Joyce
Title: Good value
Body: Loud but very good for price

Author: karen Holbrook
Title: Awesome
Body: Love

Author: Richie

Body: If you just want a basic blender to blend nearly anything then i dont think you will find a better value for your money. for $30 it works great and have not had any issues with it at all and it cleans up easily.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Blend in small batches.
Body: I had a hard time blending some tomatoes and peppers. I had to blend in very small batches to get the blender going. I don't recall ever trying this hard to use a blender. Once I got the first batch to blend though, it worked fine.

Body: Makes good malteds. Very noisy. The cover does not fit well over the glass container. Very hard to get the cover on.

Author: Estimed_customer
Title: Easy to use and clean & does a good job
Body: The blender is easy to use and clean, and powerful enough for my purpose. I won't be crushing ice or similar tasks so I can't speak to that heavy-duty aspect of the blender. It works great for shakes, which is my main use. It's easy to clean, and the jar is made of glass, which I like. Overall, it's an excellent buy, especially with the glass jar.My only criticism is with the moving parts, because the main male and female gear parts located on the jar and the blender motor are made of plastic. The motor is powerful enough, but if there is a weak point on this device, it is the plastic gear. I talk from experience here, since this is common manufacturing procedure nowadays to use plastic gears on many devices (and often plastic lock-nut assemblies too) and they tend to fail consistently and early. Since it would be probably impossible to find a blender at this price-point with metal gears, I did not remove a star in my rating.

Author: Bryan A. Welser
Title: Beats my $200 Breville hands down
Body: I probably should have reviewed this product sooner, but I'm generally just not a review-writing kind of guy. But it was about 6-ish years ago when I really got into making frozen fruit smoothies for breakfast. I thought I needed a super special, extra powerful blender, so I considered the Vitamix, but decided it was too much money to spend at the time. I instead found a very highly reviewed Breville that was about $200. It was amazing - for exactly two weeks. Then it just died. Being so new, I just exchanged it through Amazon, and the new one lasted about 10 months before breaking down. This time I called Breville, and thankfully, it was still under warranty, so they sent me another one. The third one lasted about a year - better, but I still felt like I shouldn't have gone through three fairly expensive blenders in less than two years. I considered the Vitamix again, but in the end, decided to go cheap and see what happened - at under $30, if I went through a blended a year, after 10 years I still would come out ahead compared to the Vitamix (and if it ended up being terrible, I could always get the Vitamix later).Enter this Hamilton Beach blender. It was very well reviewed at the price point I was looking at, so I figured I would give it a shot. Close to 5 years later, and it's still going strong. In fact, I would say it hasn't lost a beat since it was brand new. Admittedly, I'm not making smoothies every day anymore, but I did for several years - and I do still make a few per week. It's always there when I need it. So glad I went with this model and not another expensive one! When (if!) it does end up breaking down, I will not hesitate before buying the exact same model again. Thanks for an outstanding product, Hamilton Beach.

Author: dawn
Title: Does not have 12 Functions or Speeds
Body: This is a good blender for the money.My complaint is the blatant false advertising that Amazon and Hamilton Beach use to make customers believe that there are multiple speeds by calling this product Hamilton Beach Power Elite Blender with 12 Functions. It does not have 12 functions it has 2 functions, blend and pulse. And 2 speeds. That is the truth and that is what should be reflected in they're advertising. I read all of the information on this product as well as reviews before purchasing and nowhere did I come across this information. I don't want my money back. I want something better. I want simple truth in advertising. I want to be able to buy products that are what they claim. We are letting corporate culture bully and manipulate us and I'm not putting up with it.

Very easy to clean. You can unscrew the bottom and clean everything out. It is a little on the noisy side when running at full power but most blenders are loud at full power.

Title: NOT for Bulletproof Coffee as mentioned
Body: I used this for a hot coffee drink and the gasket did something and it began to leak. Because of the other reviews, I purchased another one thinking I had just gotten a dud and it broke too. If hot coffee drinks are why you are purchasing this item, it is not for you.

Author: Lisa A

Author: Disappointed

Body: Easy to use. Options are clear. Excellent size. Highly recommend.

Author: Mthemasta
Title: Decent blender gets the job done, but if you want a top line blender this probably isn’t it
Body: It’s a decent blender but does not break down or blend large fruits or vegetables that well. I add supplement powders to my smoothies and if I put the powders in first it would get stuck at the bottom of the blender and build up which was difficult to clean (didn’t even get cleaned out in the dishwasher). To be fair the powder I was adding before didn’t dissolve or mix well. But now I make sure to put supplement powders at the very end (as well as stopped using the powder that didn’t dissolve well), so that’s not a problem anymore and cleans fine now. But it’s one of cheaper blenders so it gets the job done for what I paid.

Author: April Holland

Body: I was very disappointed with this blender. Not sure if I just got a dud or if they are all this way but it wouldn’t blend anything frozen...even 5 ice cubes was too much for it and just left frozen chunks.

Author: Jeffrey B.

Author: Yorky Espinal

Author: Katherine Conover
Title: Great design
Body: Works very well, pouring spout is very helpful.

Author: Ken
Title: Good low priced blender
Body: At this price point, the Hamilton Beach Power Elite Electric Blender 12 function blender is a decent buy. It is not the most powerful blender on the market, but for making smoothies, blending ice cream mixture, and basic jobs such as that, it is more than adequate. I haven't tried doing any crushed ice drinks so am not sure how it would handle that task. The pulse features work quite well for quick blasting while adding ingredients. The blade assembly unscrews from the pitcher for cleaning, as most blenders do, so it is easy to clean. I run the glass pitcher through the dishwasher. Most blenders are somewhat noisy, I would give this one a B on the noise scale. Better than many, noisier than some. Overall, a nice choice for a low priced blender.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: You get what you pay for with this blender. It doesn't blend frozen fruits well at all and is noisier than most other blenders I have had in the past.

Author: PJ

Author: Mengue Mintsa Alice Béatrice

Price point and performance are pretty well lined up. Worth the money!

This thing is good for mostly melted stuff, but frozen... forget it.

I didn't use ice yet, not very confident how well it will crush ice but I will give it a try one day and update this review. Definitely okay for the price you are paying..

Title: Decent Product
Body: This is a very basic, simple blender. It has a nice heavy glass body, a motor base with 4 choices (low, high, low pulse, high pulse), and a top. The motor is very loud, but seems powerful enough for basic smoothies, etc. The motor base has a cheap shiny plastic case. My only real complaint is that the blender top cover is a VERY poor design. It is hard to get off, hard to get on, plus it has a small trap door (meant for pouring in liquids while blending) which will NOT stay closed!I like the price, but I would strongly consider a different blender if I were to shop again.

Body: Though at first, from the photo, I thought this dispensed gum balls, I was relieved to see that it is another fine product from Hamilton Beach. I use it for blending, making smoothies, etc. and have had no problems with it. Sturdily built with all the functions you could possibly need, and at a great price. I have no reservations about recommending this, and only hope that the Hamilton Beech people offer me a few hundred shares in their company.

Author: Bill
Title: The lid is extremely hard to remove, sometimes has to be pried off with a tool, i use a table spoon.
Body: I use a blender daily to make a fruit and vegie green drink. I usually buy cheaper products by name brand mfgrs. and throw them away when the typical functions, seals, bearings etc. fail. Over the years I have found Black & Decker to offer the best value for the price, but they are very noisy. In an attempt to please other members of my family with a quitter product I purchased a comparable model from Hamilton Beach (#58148 Power Elite). The HB has plenty of power, but cant be thoroughly cleaned except in a dish washer and the noise level is greater than comp. models from other. mfgr's. I also found the need to blend longer at higher speed to achieve the texture I prefer in my smoothie, but the worst problem is the lid fits so tight I am the only one in my family that can remove it by hand and sometimes I have to use a tool to pry it off. If you are like me, don't buy this product.

Author: Desi Review
Title: Desi Review
Body: If you planning to buy this blender to make chutneys, blend tomatoes, blend spices, make a paste etc this is not for you. The blender can only blend liquids or make smoothies with water or milk. It could not even blend soft tomatoes into a tomato puree. It has a bad design on the jar which will not allow the ingredients to blend without liquids. So I returned it back to get a better one. Hope this review helps all desi people if u r planning to buy one because it is cheap.

Author: Nathan
Title: 30 Dollar Powerhouse. little loud, but hey its $30
Body: I use this thing twice a day to make protein shakes. If your doing a banana with it you will have to run it for a little bit to make it a smoothie. I just pick it up the whole unit and angle it around to make sure it chops and speed up the process. I also stick with grind over smoothie mode. Smoothie mode is loud. Honestly its 30 dollars and it does its job. Used it twice a day for probably 6 months now.If you are doing protein powder, put the liquid in first or it will be very difficult to get the powder chunks out of the bottom. Other than that it's super easy to clean if liquid first. I clean it after every use and its fine. Little powerhouse for the price.

Author: Tina B
Title: Ehh

Author: Dawn
Title: Glass chips and customer service doesn't care
Body: I don't use this blender often, but my daughter likes to make smoothies in it when she's home for college. This is a perfectly adequate blender for that purpose.Recently, she noticed the blender was leaking and found a tiny chip out of the glass at the bottom of the jar. I returned to this listing to see if there was any information about the warranty and found that 1) my blender was still within the warranty period, and 2) that the glass chipping in this particular, strange way seems to be a common complaint.I noticed that when someone comments that their glass jar chips that Hamilton Beach responds very favorably, encouraging the customer to call so that they can make it right. So, I called Hamilton Beach and explained my problem.First, the glass jar isn't a warrantied item (no surprise). Second, they no longer manufacture the glass jar, so you can't buy a new one, and third the way they offer to make it right is to offer to sell you a whole new unit at half price.Unfortunately, half of an inflated price, plus $10 shipping, leaves you only a few pennies shy of what it would cost to buy another one on Amazon with free shipping. Not much of a deal. I mentioned this to Hamilton Beach customer service, and they took all of my information down and gave me a case number...and I never heard from them again.There is a wide world of blender manufacturers. I'm willing to give another one a shot.

Author: J. Bush
Title: I'll never have to spend another dollar on an over priced smoothie again
Body: I bought this specifically to make smoothies. I found a fantastic recipe involving strawberries, heavy cream, milk, vanilla extract, vanilla yogurt and it's magic. I'd never owned a blender before other than a personal ninja given as a gift that I used once that couldn't even mash up frozen blue berry much less ice and I got rid of it quickly. This had great reviews, was very inexpensive, and the glass top is heavy duty and the lid and pour spout is awesome. It chops ice and frozen strawberries easily, I can do either the milk shake setting the whole time or pulse the ice chop setting. Literally done in less than a minute total. Easy to clean, hope it lasts a long time. I'm taking it with me on vacation to the beach where smoothies have become ridiculously over priced, bland, overly concerned with being low calorie and awful flavor. Who knows, people might start paying me for my smoothies.

Did I mention about easy to clean and easy to take out from base. For the price, I would spend money on this blender than Ninja. Can't trust all that plastic crap. you have to use good old fashion glass jar.I love my Bullet Proof Coffee, so I need a blender that able to handle heat. This blender is perfect for what I needed to do. and it's easy cleaning and it is easy to take the glass pitch in and out of base. now I just hope it last longer than 1 years of blending hot drink.

Author: CaniacGirl
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: I've been researching blenders in an attempt to find one that has powerful ice crushing power so I can make my own smoothies and frappes. I should have known that a $30 blender wouldn't have any significant ice smashing abilities, but I took a chance on this one based on the description and some positive reviews. I figured for 30 bucks, what could it hurt? Well, the bottom line here is that it doesn't crush ice worth a diddly. It also doesn't blend powders very efficiently, so this was a complete bust for me.Next time, I'll go ahead and spring for a nicer, more powerful blender. While I have no intention of spending $200+ for one, I'm thinking I'll at least have to spend $100 if I want something that can handle ice efficiently. Disappointing.

Author: Anon
Title: Great basic blender, nice price.
Body: We needed a simple unit for occasional blending tasks. We wanted something with a glass jar and a reputable brand but don't need to liquify baseball bats, brew soup, or other nonsense. Just an occasional puree, smoothie, etc. Other HB products we've purchased in the past have performed well so we went with this. The base is a bit light, but it is stable and works nicely. The jar is sturdy and the contours really do help make turbulence when blending to assist in a thorough mix. The jar base is easy to attach to the base, and is easy to remove to clean. The lid has more nooks & crannies to clean (but not bad) and fits a bit loosely so I tend to hold it in place. I don't really find a need for the doors/spouts in the lid, removing it to add items or pour works better. All in all, a nice unit at this price.

Author: Ron N.
Title: There are not 12 blending functions" as advertised"
Body: This is a well-designed blender and performs adequately so far (I just got it), but the description saying that there are 4 buttons that perform 12 blending functions ... well, that is simply not true. There are 4 buttons, and they do four things. Under each button, Hamilton Beach has listed 3 things the button (speed) can be used to do, but there are only two pulse speeds and two continuous speeds. My old Oster blender had 8 buttons that each did a different thing, and I thought that, since it was well over 30 years old, things might have improved so that now there would be 12 different things, but no. So to clarify: there are 4 buttons that perform 4 different functions, period. The description is simply false advertising.

Author: BohdiTree
Title: Struggles to blend a FRESH banana!
Body: It took several tries to get it to blend a soft fresh banana.A FRESH banana! Not a frozen or even refrigerated one.It also tended to just push powders that I added into a smoothie into the sides and down in the crevices where they would clump and not mix.And speaking of crevices this thing was designed horribly.There is a circular crevice around the base of the part that holds the blades.Why would you do this?So it can gunk up with whatever you are trying to blend and have to be cleaned out with the tip of a knife?Because that is exactly what happens every time.The part could have easily been made without that crevice. You just have to change the mold you are using in the production process.If you thought you were going to make smoothies with this forget it.What Darwin Award winners are designing this thing?It’s going back.The search for a decent blender with a glass pitcher goes on.Update:The poor little blender manages to blend the banana fine if I break into into small chunks first.Still hard to clean and still has a tendency to make powders clump on the sides and in the crevices rather than fully blending them.

Author: David H.
Title: Good luck
Body: I really did like this blender. I like the glass jar, it's not extremely loud, and it worked great for my purposes. If you're thinking about buying one, though, you should know that the collar (the plastic ring that screws onto the bottom of the jar), will probably not last you. It was probably a couple weeks after I got the blender, when I screwed it on a little too tight, and that caused it to crack. Luckily, I figured out a way to make it work in spite of that. I was able to use it every day, for more than a year, just by being really careful with it. Finally, the collar has another crack, and I simply can't use it without my beverage seeping through the bottom as soon as I remove it from the base.If I could buy a replacement collar for it, I wouldn't mind at all. I mean, the blender wasn't expensive. But that particular part is not available, so I guess I need a new blender. Of course I will not be going with Hamilton Beach.

Author: AD32
Title: Waste of space
Body: I received this blender as a Christmas gift the year before last and it's done nothing but frustrate me. First of all, my mother has a Hamilton Beach blender she got as a wedding gift in 1984 and that's what I was using before my brother gave me this. I tried it out by making a smoothie that I usually made in my mom's old blender and the new blender's smoothie was waaaaay more chunky than the old one's ever was. Nothing I made is like it should be. I can't make any blender baking recipes because it won't hold up to solid ingredients. Ice is hit or miss. The last straw was tonight I wanted to try blending dates with pumpkin puree and the thing wouldn't even turn even after I added a half cup of almond milk. I had to take the lid off and kind of stir it while it was on to get it going. Super dangerous. And I have to apologize to my neighbors because the thing is sooooooo loud! I'm so done with this thing. I can't think of a reason to keep it. I've used the mini chopper bowl that comes with it once and needless to say, that was also a let down. I wanted to grate baby carrots and just ended up with chunks of varying sizes. Oh! And I am constantly angered trying to get whatever I have in the blender out of it seeing as the sides aren't smooth. You have to try to get your spatula around the wavy sides of the pitcher and ultimately end up washing much of your food down the drain. The hole in the top, which is presumably for adding things while the blender is in use, is more of just a way for the stuff inside to shoot onto your counter and walls since you can't fully close it. The old Hamilton Beach had a removable magnifying class insert that allowed you to add ice/ingredients, but then close it back up completely and look through it to see how things were mixing. Such a step down with this one.Currently searching Amazon for a replacement. It's sad that the Hamilton Beach blender from 30 years ago is so much better than what they currently offer.

Body: I love this, great product and it's heavy duty glass. I don't even have to hold down the lid when mixing my bulletproof coffee. So happy I chose this one and even better due to product price. Only problem is that the bottom attachment that screws onto glass is plastic and it cracked within a couple of weeks.

With the one I received, you have to hold in the button for it to keep blending.

Author: Terry Grant
Title: The little blender that tried but just couldn’t
Body: Let’s do a compliment sandwich:The blender looks like it’s well build. The glass is solid, top goes on firm and is easy to pour. Device also looks like the problem I had with my old blender with the blade seal won’t be a problem with this blender.However, this blender is the little blender that could and just never could. It gives a good effort but it just isn’t strong enough to really blend everything thrown into it. Doesn’t matter when I order the kale, I still get some pretty large leaves in the smoothie. Thankfully my daughter is used to the kale now so it’s less of an issue, but if you were expecting a smooth blend of everything you put in the blender, this isn’t going to happen here.However, for $30, it mostly does sort of a reasonable ok job I guess.

Author: Johnny
Title: Pretty
Body: It’s quite a pretty site on my kitchen counter still have not turned it on. Not sure if I want to diet in 2019 just yet

Author: Jessica G.
Title: Do not recommend
Body: Worst blender I've ever had! The blades have no edge/sharpness to actually blend or puree anything other then liquid, it's worthless for anything more than just stirring liquid

Author: Natasha Clinton

Body: Doesn’t even blend well ! I don’t even use it, biggest waste of money I ever spent.

Title: broken in less than 2 mos - cannot use base completely cracked and broke
Body: DO NOT BUY!! BASE broke in 6 weeks! Not happy!!! Not good - lid leaks frequently - when blending leaks at spout - leaks when pouring. Makes a mess every time. Would not recommend.....that was before and now completely broken base. Do not buy!

Author: Nina Pesavento
Title: Worked pretty well, until it broke unexpectedly
Body: This *was* a fine blender when it worked. While it didn't have the most powerful speed or sharpest blade, it was a reliable, easy-to-use product for smoothies, bulletproof coffee, and some sauces that don't involve finely chopping ingredients. However, the other morning, after less than a year of use, the base of the blender unexpectedly broke and liquid spilled all over my countertops. The blender had not been dropped or tampered with—the plastic on the base simply snapped from regular use. This break is not something that can be fixed, and now I need a new blender again.If you have the budget to invest in a higher quality blender, skip this and go for an upgraded version. You'll end up sinking more money into blenders over the long run by choosing this model.

Author: Carmen

Body: The pieces of food have to be very small because if not the blades won't reack them correctly and it won't cut the food. Once it gets the food, it works good but it takes some time to reach the pieces sometimes.

Oh, and if you blend more than 12 oz, it will shoot out the top even with the cover on. I had to put a towel on it every time. Worst blender I’ve ever owned.

If you are looking to purchase a blender, please avoid this product. It doesn't last long at all, I was at least expecting a year out of it, I wasn't even given that.

I have it for more than a month now and I use it every day. I will update if there are issues but right now I’m very satisfied with it.

Author: Greg K
Title: Good Until Real Bad
Body: Well, this was good for a year and a half. But when it failed, I found actual pieces of plastic and the rubber ring from the motor in my smoothie. Hooray! Who knows how long I've been drinking bits of plastic as the blade gear had been falling apart. On top of that HB was completely absent when inquiring about the 3 year warranty, I ended up having to file a BBB report to get anyone to respond to me. Unbelievable. I shoulda stayed with the cheapo plastic pitcher blender I had for years prior to upgrading. I'd say avoid this model/brand.UPDATE: From 2 to 1 star because of the completely non-existent customer service. I called HB today to see how valuable my 3-yr warranty was, I left a message as instructed and was told someone would be in touch with me in 40 minutes. They never called. I also emailed them and there has been no response. I don't see myself buying anything by HB ever again.

Author: Andrea Horrocks
Title: Great for my main job... making bulletproof coffee
Body: I've been through about 4 blenders and have had issues with them either breaking (3 of the 4) or were just not good for the job that I use the blender for each day- making bulletproof coffee. I really did not want to shell out $300-400 for a quality blender, but at the rate I was going, I was heading that direction until I found this one. It has a vent on the link, in addition to the spout, that allows steam to be released, and its perfect for what I need it for.

Author: Nancy Matias
Title: Happy Customer
Body: I love my blender!

Author: Sir Deiblerr
Title: Zero stars
Body: You’re better off hand chopping whatever you’re making. No idea how this got 4 stars, paid reviews? In order to make a smoothie you’ll need half a gallon of liquid per 1/2 cup of solids. It simply does not blend otherwise. Even with that you’ll end up with chunks and berry skins. There is no user error here, read all manuals and instructions...this is just a terrible excuse for a blender. Forget about making something like pesto, unless you want to use a gallon of oil per basil leaf, nothing will blend. To top it off this thing sounds like bone crushing death. It is literally louder than a garbage truck. Further, the base is wobbly and the cheap plastic lid is constantly stuck. The only pro is the glass, but I’m not exaggerating when I say, this blender does not blend, so who cares about the glass material. Don’t waste your money, spend a little more or don’t bother. Seriously.

Author: Richard J. Brown
Title: Slow speed blender
Body: Bought this to replace my 20 year old Oster Blender. This one runs at half the top speed as my old one. Does not chop up apple or grape skins well. Plastic drive sprocket I doubt will last 20 years. Save your money and buy a better brand of blender.

Amazon refunded my money, of course. I seem to never go wrong with Hamilton Beach, so I gave this one a try. I have used it every day for 8 weeks and could not be happier with its performance. It is very powerful and never seems strained crushing ice and blending.

Body: I would not buy these again. Shop for and buy in store

Author: P W George
Title: Nice blender with a serious flaw
Body: I bought this blender two years ago, mainly to make smoothies and occasional milkshakes. It was used, on average, once a day for less than five minutes. It was excellent for what I wanted and had a design which greatly helped the blending process without need for constant stopping to get unmixed material down to the blades. After about a year it started leaking and I discovered that the plastic 'nut' that attaches the blades to the glass jar had cracked. I tried to repair it with different adhesives but nothing worked. Thinking I had just been unlucky with the first one I purchased a second of the same model. It worked just as well as the first one until the same problem occurred. Now I was a little upset and so I submitted warranty claims for both to HB. They accepted the claims and agreed to send replacement parts but with a charge of $6 for S/H for each. I replied asking them if they would guarantee the replacement parts without charging for anything if they failed (since I suspected a manufacturing problem in general with that part) and have heard nothing back, which I take as a 'no'. Too bad--I'm now using an Oster which is supposed to be pretty bulletproof. It's OK, but I liked the HB better, except for the leaking part.

Author: Alex Lefkow
Title: Doesn't crush ice/ make smoothies very well
Body: The machine is decent, but not great. When I try to make smoothies with ice, it doesn't crush it up at all and makes terrible smoothies.

Author: Kasumi Le
Title: Good but don't last long
Body: Only used it a few times and already it is leaking , I went ahead and retightened it by turning the bottom clockwise. No more leak. The motor also after four uses, it would have burning smell and there was smoke. I didn't even overwork it. It was good for a week. Maybe I got a dud

Author: Stan Lieberman
Title: Nice for the price, BUT...
Body: I use this only for smoothies, but the top is ALMOST impossible to remove when it's snugged all the way down. Just close it enough so no liquid can leak out. Be sure to hold it in place with your hand to be sure.

Author: Walt Whitman
Title: Won't chop dates
Body: I purchased this to replace a blender that finally gave out. My main use for this product is to blend/chop dates mixed with a cup of almond milk. After running the blender at various speeds for some time, I began to pour the liquid into my glass and realized that the dates had not been chopped one bit. I poured the contents back into the blender and blended it for quite some time. The dates were smaller, but not by much. If a blender is not able to chop a soft date, I'm not sure it's worth much. I knew I wasn't purchasing a high end product, but I expected it to chop a few dates with no problem.

Author: Joe
Title: Good looking gift
Body: Works great has good power

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Missing pieces!
Body: It was missing the glass part.

Author: Toy
Title: Not satisfied
Body: I used the filters to make sure I got a new blender. When I opened the package the lid was poorly glued together. I decided to go to the store to purchase a blender. I saw the same brand and checked the lid. It looked nothing like what I received. If the lid is refurbished, who knows what to expect from the actual blender.

Author: Nice guy
Title: Doesn't do what it is built to...
Body: It was a total waste of money, as this blender, though extremely heavy, doesn't blend!!The motor seems really powerful, yet the belender's performance is really below average. Hamilton Beach is a known name in kitchen gadgets, but this one is a huge disappointment. I have tried blending smoothies, ginger, and something as tender as mint and cilantro...the machine just won't do it. You have to keep running it, and time and again shake the jug, and poke with a wooden spoon, keep adding water...it gets extremely frustrating. It comes with a smaller blender, which is equally useless. Being brand new, it couldn't be blunt blades..it's just the way it has been built. I bought this mainly for a glass jug, as it's easier to clean and the smell of food doesn't permeate...but I am super mad at myself for not reading the previous reviews. I would go for a plastic blender that would actually work!!!My sincere advice is, don't buy this! Save yourself the frustration in the kitchen. There are blenders that are less costly, and do a better job!If the product still had return time on it, I won't take a second to send it back. Unfortunately, I am stuck with it...I have been looking for a replacement already.

Author: James
Title: Three Stars
Body: I don't like the plastic drive gears, but it works ok. When this completely fails I'll buy another Oster.

Author: David L. Wallace
Title: Totally satisfied.
Body: The glass jar is just the right size and has a durable, heavy feel. The pouring spout works quite well. It does a good job crushing and blending ice. I’m using the blender only for making smoothies and protein drinks. It works great for that, on a par with an expensive Cuisinart that I also have. This product is a great bargain considering what I use it for.

Body: This product doesn’t have sharp blades at all, I don’t understand their shape either. Not your typical blender blades. The lid openings are useless, can’t add food through them while it’s running. Smells burnt when in use and the back side of the base gets really warm. Only used it twice so far and will likely toss it and get a different one before it blows a fuse or ruins my electric outlet.
