Author: Reed
Title: it was good while it lasted
Body: This blender only lasted 3 years under very light use... I mean I'd go months without using it. Probably made less than 50 blenders full before dying... it was good while it lasted, unfortunately though that wasn't very long.Editing my review: Changing from 2 to 4 stars because I'm happy with how the product performed, and even though it didn't last quite 3 years, that meant it was still under the limited warranty, and Hamilton Beach Customer Service was very helpful.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Replacing my last Hamilton Beach - which lasted 20 years.
Body: Just bought this to replace my old Hamilton Beach blender, which just died. I had it for at least 20 years. Loved that one, and so far I love this one. I wanted one with a glass jar like my old one, and other than being shorter with a wider jar, which actually is a more ergonomic design - this is pretty much the same as my old one. Perfect for my morning smoothie and the random cooking uses - usually soup or salsa mixing.

Author: mav
Title: This is a mixer, not a blender. It ...
Body: This is a mixer, not a blender. It will mix liquids together, but it won't blend non-liquids into a smooth shake.

Author: Sandy
Title: Don’t buy this to make salsa
Body: I like the lid that you can pour from. Other than that this product is terrible. I make salsa regularly and it will not chop veggies. The salsa button is a joke. My cilantro collects in the blades so therefore NOTHING gets chopped properly. I like chunky salsa but with this blender I misfit as well be eating a salsa salad. I’m looking to replace it.

Author: Shim
Title: Cant blend if you stripped for it
Body: I'm unemployed and this blender sucks. doesn't chop frozen fruit even if its life depended on it. Sat there for 10 minutes basically hand blending the fruit myself, stuffing it into the blades which would maybe do well as a back massager on full power. If you stuck your finger into the blades at top speed it might tickle a little if your lucky. the most this blender can do is maybe make lemonade without ice. I've seen my grandma with full blown parkinsons and late stage alzheimers do a better job chopping fruit than this piece of dementia. what happened, did a little tykes blender get out and jump into a hamilton beach blender box? im sick and tired of seeing products reviewed 5000 times with mostly 5 stars and the few people who say its crap actually are the only ones telling the truth! how do these big hunker junk companies get away with selling toilet scrubbers as blenders? Anyways as you can see i need a job so please reach out if you hear of anything. sick people man smh.

Author: Wojtek Gornicki
Title: Four Stars
Body: Works fine so far.

Author: Samantha V.
Title: Cheap
Body: Broke in the first week, thought it would be better because it was glass.

Author: Lila
Title: Quality budget blender for smoothies
Body: It's no VitaMix, but if you need a quality blender for smoothies at a very reasonable price, this is your blender. Don't chuck everything in at once; start with your liquids, add your powders and greens, then build up to frozen ingredients. If your order of operations is correct, you won't run into problems. Easy disassembly makes it pretty simple to clean.

Author: chip6714
Title: Owned about six months. The bottom came off the ...
Body: Owned about six months. The bottom came off the blender today, the plastic piece that houses the blades. Very scary to me that there were cracks in the plastic that started showing up early on and then eventually broke apart spilling my smoothie all over my counter. Will not be buying any Hamilton Beach products again.

Author: Meshia Vogel
Title: Motor went out in less than a minute of use
Body: I bought this a few months ago. Finally got to try it out and in less than a minute of blending the motor went out. So I'm now trying to figure out what to do with a half blended shake.

Author: Ryan
Title: Noisy but strong and good priced blender. Does the trick
Body: Works well for the price.ProsVery sturdyCrushes ice quickly and blends wellInexpensiveConsIt is incredibly loud. Maybe because it is 700 watts? Other blenders I looked at were in the 450 range.The lid is a junky, cheap piece of plastic. I was surprised by this because both the base and glass jar seem high quality

Author: GREAT WHALE 🐋 7

Author: NL
Title: Works like a charm
Body: Works like a charm! Have had this machine for about a year now and it still works great. It is not the most powerful blender out there but especially for the price point works great and gets the job done. The glass is a nice addition, sturdy and it feels like it keeps a little cleaner than plastic jars I have had on blenders before. This is definitely great if you are on a budget and want a sturdy machine that will last a while -- perfect for smoothies and any other sort of blending. (If you use a lot of ice be a little patient though and make sure you have sufficient liquid)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: 2 Problems
Body: I can't give it 5 stars because the writing on the front of the blender is smearing off. I bought this about 9 months ago but just started using it the last 2 months. Pretty soon I won't be able to see what button is for what. Also, because this has a pour spout (which I wanted) it splashes the liquid out as soon as you start it. I have to hold a towel at the top when turning it on, otherwise it sprays everywhere. Other than these 2 defects, it works okay. I would choose something different next time, though.

I thought this was normal behavior but now the thing has completely stopped working. It worked wonderfully at first but I'm upset at seeing how short lived it was.

Author: AwakeInAnacortes
Title: Still love it!

Author: Tobrid
Title: Smoothie master
Body: Every morning, I put greek yogurt, a cup of frozen berries, half a frozen banana, a cup of frozen kale, a spoon of chia seeds, couple spoons of ground flaxseed, a handful of raw almonds, and a couple cups of almond milk in my blender. It doesn't even stutter - just chops it all up into a smoothie I can drink through a straw. Has never given me any trouble or failed to blend perfectly smoothly. Love this thing... especially for the price.Edited to add: I've seen a lot of people complaining that it doesn't blend all the ingredients, gets stuck, requires stirring, etc. I've found that when this happens to me, it's usually because I didn't add enough liquid to compensate for the solid ingredients. I just pop the top and pour in a little more - water, milk, whatever - and it solves the problem right away. This isn't the blender's fault; it's operator error.

Author: NY Adirondack Outdoorsman
Title: Superior quality at fair price from reliable brand !
Body: The best smoothie maker we have ever owned to date. The Hamilton Beach (58148A) Glass Jar Blender out performs many smootie makers that are 2-3x the cost. Superior quality at fair price from reliable brand !

Author: Beth
Title: Two Stars

Author: Ms. Nadia
Title: Nut, Fruits, Seeds, and particles of Ice are trapped below the Blades and never participate in the Blending process.
Body: I have only owned 4 Hamilton Beach Blenders in 25 years. The last HB Blender, a housewarming gift lasted four months. This one I purchased last June but used less than half a dozen times. It has been a disappointment for all my smoothies, and I do not dare use it for any other processing. The part labeled collar is open and performs as a trap for food particles to lodge at the bottom of the glass jar below the cutting blades.Nut, Fruits, Vegetables, Seeds, and Ice are trapped never participating in the remaining blending process. After cleaning, those particles are usually still trapped until they are sorted and individually picked out.I do not recommend.

Nowhere near powerful enough for soup--but making soup in a blender isn't something I need or want. Just don't get a hankering for a Margarita in the middle of the night. It won't wake the dead, but you'll need to make enough for anyone who's asleep when you start mixing.

Title: A casual blender
Body: Not going to dump on this blender, because I didn't realize the importance of blender wattages, vs what I was looking to do (break down flax seeds in a smoothie without pre-blending them). It just wasn't up to the job. I would say it was fine otherwise, but I only used it for the one thing (I didn't get around to taking it up to the aloha deck to have Isaac make some frozen drinks), and it just couldn't quite make the bits small enough.I did have a complaint design-wise: the lid has attachment issues. Getting it seated is one effort, but getting it off when you're done? Try to capture some video when you're taking that lid off, because there's some potential comedy gold every time, because I promise you one of those times, you're going get a face full of blended goods while prying that thing off.

I used this last night to blend up a homemade butternut squash soup (roasted butternut squash, red bell pepper, onion, bacon, and chicken stock) and it did the job just fine.

Author: J
Title: Good at-home blender
Body: This is a good product for at-home use. I've read that some people have trouble blending their frozen fruits... simple solution is to add more liquid to the mixture (water, orange juice, whatever) in order for the blades to turn properly to start liquefying the mixture. As far as noise goes: it's a blender... it's not quiet but the noise isn't piercing either. I've been using this product every day for over a week and it's easy to use, easy to clean. The bottom half unscrews and you can take the blade out to wash separately from the glass jar. The product overall doesn't feel flimsy at all.

Author: Austin
Title: Good low-cost blender
Body: I've used a lot of inexpensive blenders, and this one remains the best I've tried. It is well-made and easy to clean. The parts fit together well, and the blending functions work properly. Ingredients do sometimes get stuck while blending, but not nearly as bad as with other blenders, and a quick shake fixes it. It's great at crushing ice as well.This blender is nothing extraordinary, but if you're looking for something basic, low-cost and reliable, go with this one.

Author: Carol Joy
Title: Works great but hard to wash & dry pieces.
Body: POSITIVES: attractive, sturdy, well-made, does the job but protein powders ‘almost’ blend easily with some scraping-off the sides required. Good pouring spot in the corner of the square-ish shaped carafe. Priced appropriately.NEGATIVES: intricately designed lid with plenty of seams and small spaces is hard to wash quickly and powders get stuck in the very small grooves and pour spout. The lid is also hard to remove but probably because it offers a very secure closure: no worries it’ll fall off with pouring. But it is a struggle to pull off.The underside of the bottom piece, (which holds the blade), is scalloped and VERY annoying to dry thoroughly. These two factors I really hate.It’s also LOUD! All reviews for the option of buying it with the sound shield (more money and takes more space) were not great and to me didn’t block too much noice on the videos posted with sound comparison. This doesn’t bother me as much as cleaning the nooks and seams of the bottom and the lid. But I suppose if you use it daily (it’s as loud as a weed whacker, but with a whining noise), is likely not good for your hearing.NEUTRAL: the Glass carafe is HEAVY! I don’t mind as I’m strong but it was a surprise compared to my 15 year old model that bit the dust. However when my arthritis bothers my fingers, its weight is more challenging. BUT the weight is indicative of its quality.I considered returning it but the quality is so good I feel it will last a very long time. If you don’t mind noise and spending a little extra time to have to immerse wash and do detailed drying, I recommend it!

Author: Max AArgon
Title: This is a great blender. The fact that the main part is ...

Author: GG
Title: Great Value
Body: I am trying to move away from plastic, and was looking for a glass alternative to make my morning bulletproof coffee in. This is a great blender for the price! Blends and emulsifies coconut oil/MCT oil/butter/ghee effortlessly, and is SO easy to clean. If you plan to use this for hot liquids, you will be happy to know there there is a small vent so that pressure doesn't build up. The blender itself has a small footprint and doesn't take up much counter space at all. It is much louder than a Vitamix, but when using it for ~30 seconds a day that isn't really an issue for me, just something to be mindful of if that will bother you!

Author: Godsinger
Title: It's perfect for my needs!
Body: I have been looking for a replacement for my Magic Bullet. I make my morning coffee with collagen and coconut oil which needs to be emulsified. The pitcher to my Magic Bullet cracked and I could not get a good replacement. This is a 40 oz. glass pitcher which is perfect because I use a big mug. I like that it has openings at the top which allows the hot air to escape. I've seen so many people get scalded because of the pressure buildup.The motor seems to be quite powerful. I haven't used this for smoothies so I really can't say how it breaks the fruit down. It's compact so doesn't take up a lot of room on my counter. If I had to find a downside, it would be that the lid is REALLY hard to get off.

Body: Terrible and crushing ice. Only wanted this to make smoothies and it takes me 15 minutes to make one because I repeatedly have to take the lid off and stir it around or shake it really hard while it’s blending to get the ice chopped. Spend money on a good one or be disappointed like me lol

Author: Jamie
Title: Doesn’t crush ice or frozen fruit!
Body: This is the second time we have bought the blender. We thought the first one was a fluke. I did research and the description states that it crushes ice and frozen fruit.It does crush ice and frozen fruit. However, after about a month the motor burned out. We tried a second as the manufacturer said that was a malfunctioning blender and the same thing happened. No amount of extra liquid helps. It doesn’t even crush it well. Unless, if you count it leaving big chunks of uneven pieces.If you’re really looking for something where you need frozen fruit or ice crushed I would spend the extra money to get something that actually works. I will be speaking to the manufacturer on this one as well because it is doing the same thing as the last.I would not mind at all if they did not say it was specifically for crushing ice and fruit etc. ( in the description of the item )So beware, I would hate for you to have to go through what I have went through with burning out motors after just a few uses.

So all is well.

Author: Mark Massingill
Title: Does what I bought it for well.
Body: I bought this blender specifically for making breakfast smoothies. So far it has done it's job quite well and I am happy with my purchase. I normally use 2 bananas, a cup or so of blueberries and a scoop of protein powder along with a cup or so of water and this blender gives me a really well blended smoothie. Sometimes I use strawberries and pineapple instead of the blueberries or some papaya or cantaloupe, so far the machine has had no problem with anything I've thrown at it. Sometimes I use frozen fruit and it seems to make no difference to the blender but normally I use fresh fruit, I don't like frozen smoothies so I don't add ice or use much frozen fruit if I have a choice. That's all I can rate it on since I only use it for smoothies. I would recommend it for non frozen smoothies.

Author: Harbinger
Title: You get what you pay for?
Body: This blender is cheap, so if you're broke and need a blender today and won't be able to save up and spend another $20 on a better blender next month, then get this. It's as loud as any other blender (not as loud as the Ninja Professional bullet [900W] which is like an F-16 jet engine). With this blender I have to blend twice as long as my previous cheapo Black & Decker blender (broke the glass unfortunately and the $29 part replacement led me to just get another blender) just to get the same results, and with more blending comes more bubbles/over-aerated protein shakes. Next time I will spend another $20 and get a better blender. At least the pour top on this is an advancement over other blender tops with their annoying removable center clear piece of plastic.

Author: Zigurd Mednieks
Title: All the right features, no frippery, but not a premium feel
Body: and it held up to quarantine use!
Image links: My original review:This is a very good blender at a rock-bottom price. This is what you want: A 700W motor. A glass bowl. The bowl has the same wave shape as the slightly more expensive model. The gasket is integrated with the blade assembly, so taking the bowl apart for cleaning is one part simpler than on most blenders. No gimmicky accessories.It loses one star because the lid is weirdly and not too usefully complicated, and lightweight. The economies have to come from somewhere: Where higher-priced blenders have a chunky solid base that holds the blade assembly onto the bottom of the bowl, this blender has a lightweight base. It seems solid enough. The fake brushed stainless steel front panel fools nobody. This isn't a $200 blender for $30. But after the second daiquiri you'll be thinking The price difference buys a lot of daiquiris.Addendum:Upgraded to five stars. All the suspect cheap parts, like the base and lid, have held up very well. During quarantine I have been drinking a lot of smoothies as meal replacements. The blender gets use almost every day, often twice a day. No worries. The complex lid with the pouring spout works really well.Altogether much mech better than the price would lead one to expect.

Author: Gina
Title: I normally write very good reviews even if a certain product isn't 100% amazing
Body: I normally write very good reviews even if a certain product isn't 100% amazing, but I am sadly very disappointed in this Hamilton Beach blender. I am very big on making smoothies and once I moved into my new apartment I had to buy a blender for myself. I choose this one and I've used it twice now and it was a hassle to BOTH times to make one simply smoothie! This blender states it can chop ice but I can assure you it can't. I've been making the same type of smoothie my whole life at my parents house with no issue. Once I tried making the same exact smoothie is this blender, nothing would blend together. I had to constantly shut it off, un plug it for safety reasons and put my spoon in the blender to mix and move it around. It honestly took me 20 minutes both times to make a simply smoothie that should normally blend up in seconds. It's too late to return this so I wasted my money, but I am now looking for a new and better blender. I know this one wasn't that expensive but honestly, don't waste your money here. I chose this one because I thought Hamilton Beach was a great brand, but not for their blenders.

Author: Hanna
Title: after a couple of terrible Osters
Body: this one seems pretty good. It's quieter, the bottom of the jar (that fits into the base) is plastic so it won't rust like the Oster, and for my smoothie, it blended up the frozen fruit, which the Oster could do, as well as the peanut butter (which the Oster could never blend enough to incorporate it into the mix). I also added kale, which was great. I'm happy so far!

Author: LeViis Haney
Title: This blender broke within two months!
Body: The collar of this blender (the piece that holds the blade and screws the pitcher to the base) broke within two months. I probably used the blender 10 times. I called the customer service department which took a while to get a hold of, and they were not very helpful. The representative asked me what did I put in the blender. I told her ice, almond milk, flax seed oil, and 6 frozen strawberries. She asked did I thaw out the strawberries first, and I said no. She then informed me that I should let the strawberries thaw first. Hmmmm. It did a fairly good job of blending my morning smoothie before the collar broke, now I do not have a working blender.

Author: bri
Title: Dissatisfied

Author: Scitch
Title: Don't waste your money on this blender
Body: Absolute piece of junk. I ordered this blender on Amazon in May, 2016. It's now Sept., 2017 and the blender leaks so badly that it's unusable. And I'm not talking about it leaking a tablespoon or two while you're blending a smoothie. I measured how fast it leaked for this review. It leaked out 2.5 cups of water in under 45 seconds. I can't tell where the leak is coming from but no amount of re-seating the washer/blade assembly or reattaching the plastic base even slows down the leak. Even before it leaked it didn't blend very well. About the only thing you could blend was liquids - no chopped vegetables, etc. I didn't abuse it or try to pretend that it was an ice crusher. I just did basic blending with it. Don't waste your money on this blender. I'm never buying another Hamilton Beach appliance.

This one had a lot of reviews and some of them weren't that great, but I didn't think much of it. I mean how bad could it be? Guys, it's the worst thing ever, and it's not like I have high standards or anything. I tried put kale, spinach, yogurt, and a banana in there and I had to leave it on the highest power for like 3-5 minutes. Guess what? Even after that long, there were still some large chunks of food unblended. Really, Hamilton? I literally can't make any smoothies with this, it's more like chunkies.Just -- don't get it, please.

Author: Nathan R. Benjamin Jr.
Title: Not recommended
Body: Really disappointed by this product. The blades are really dull and small; so different from other blenders I've used in the past. It certainly sounds like the blender packs enough power to make a smoothie, but ice cubes and large pieces don't get sucked down to the blades. Those pieces just keep getting shot to the top of the liquid and it takes ages to get a chunky 'smoothie'. I don't understand why there are so many good reviews, because my experience was exactly as described by others who gave poor reviews. I'm giving it two stars because I haven't yet tried the food processor it comes with; maybe that item would redeem this product.

Author: Lynn S
Title: Super nice blender
Body: Super nice blender. Lots of different settings. Only thing is the top doesn't stay shut all the way so I need to hold it down, but it blends everything well!

Author: Phillip Nevling
Title: Its OK
Body: Nothing fancy - gets the job done. Hate the stupid lid.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Disappointed in every aspect
Body: This blender looks good in pictures and that's why I decided to buy it. However, after I received the items, which was full of dirt, I realized why this blender is so cheap. The glass jar looks fine but the plastic lip looks cheap too. Most importantly, I found out the watermelon juice it made was so much worse than the one made by my previous nutribullet. Returned it.

Author: anonymous
Title: Five Stars
Body: Works well for the money. The kids make smoothies with frozen fruit with no problems.

Author: Clarrissa Carline
Title: Five Stars
Body: Awesome and easy to operate. My 89 year old Papa uses it just fine.

Author: MR
Title: Four Stars
Body: works great

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I make my Starbucks frappe everyday from this wonderful machine. It works greats
Body: I make my Starbucks frappe everyday from this wonderful machine. It works greats. Runs smoothly. Looks amazing. The pouring spout is my favorite. Look this blender

Author: Jess
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great blender

Author: Hazelnut
Title: Worth lots more than it's price suggests!
Body: So far, so good. I've had Hamilton Beach appliances before, and they've always proved outstanding. I'm confident that this will follow that rule. I've used this one so far to make cracker crumbs, chop old-fashioned oats with chocolate chips (for cookies; I do these together, so they're mixed and chopped simultaneously; saves one step in baking, and makes a finer cookie!). You can convert canned whole tomatoes into crushed (very fast. If you let it go too long, they'll become pureed. (Ask me how I know this!) Pureed is fine, too, if you're making a pasta sauce or a drink. Of course, it's also perfect for smoothies with my own choice of ingredients, herbs and spices. There are too many other uses to describe here, but the pamphlet that comes with it will explain them.

Author: Taylor Tocash
Title: Works great and the pour spout lid is a LOT easier ...
Body: Works great and the pour spout lid is a LOT easier to clean than our previous blender that had the spout attached to the bottom of the actual blender

Author: Scott Bitner
Title: Great for Smoothies
Body: Powerful blender for the money. Great for making smoothies and frozen adult drinks. Blades are holding up well.

Author: A. Mahesh
Title: Worst Blender Money Can Buy
Body: Don't buy this blender. Does not blend. Painfully weak vortex. The blade squeals and screams a lot but does not perform.You will have to spend 10 minutes just to open and close and re-position the contents to make the blade move properly.

Author: Se7en
Title: Four Stars
Body: Works Good. Fast shipping

Author: NSLL
Title: Hamilton Beach Power Elite Multi function blender
Body: I bought this blender because I thought it was newer and an improvement over my older Hamilton Beach blender. I wanted to use it for smoothies and for crushing ice in it. No different than my older mixer. Does the same job. The amount of time to crush ice is a little faster, not much. I probably won't return it because it is so inexpensive, I'll just use it for now. The really good blenders are over $150.

Author: David Schroeder
Title: Good Blender
Body: Works great! The letters on the silver part smudged off but not crucial to its function

Author: Suzanne N.
Title: Good buy!!
Body: Works well with easy cleanup...

Author: Jennifer Q.
Title: Good, basic blender
Body: I like that this has a glass pitcher. The pour spout is a great addition to the lid. Our teenagers use it daily for smoothies with ice and it is holding up great.

Author: Juan Pablo
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great blender!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: You can't beat the prize and it works great!

Author: Sabrina
Title: Four Stars
Body: It's a good product. A little bit too noisy but it works decently.

Author: mrsdeharo1027
Title: Disappointed
Body: Does not blend anything chunky or large amounts. You have to chop fine and blend little by little. Very inconvenient.

Author: Veronika
Title: Certainly not the best but not the worst
Body: Certainly not the best but not the worst. Doesn't like ice cubes at all. I only bought it for drinks.

Author: Cheryl
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great

Author: Sibley M.
Title: Five Stars
Body: This is a great product! Large capacity, glass and chops ice like a pro!

Author: Neal Petersen
Title: While the motor is strong and we can make most ...
Body: While the motor is strong and we can make most things with it, the flaw is in pouring. First water sits in the base after it is washed and if you don't turn it upside down before, you will get dishwater coming out. Then the real problem is in pouring the content out. It is obvious that the people who deigned this never use it because it does not pour without making a mess. If you remember to clean out the first water, leave the cap on to pour through the top spout. If not you will need to remove the cap lid and pour directly from the glass and that is a bigger mess.

Author: Shane M. Bernard
Title: ... every morning for 5 months to make smoothies and LOVED it. Always made sure to follow the directions ...
Body: Used this every morning for 5 months to make smoothies and LOVED it. Always made sure to follow the directions to go gentle on the motor, but after 5 months it started to make a horrible burning smell when in use. Will have to buy a different product next time...

Author: satya
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great product! Works well for all the basic grinding stuff.

Author: Lejana Gil
Title: One Star
Body: a waste of money, didn't work even when a simple pesto

Author: Koala65
Title: Just got it will let you know as soon as ...
Body: Just got it will let you know as soon as I use it how it goes. Went by quite a few of the other reviews.

Author: Michael R.
Title: It has done a very good job in early used of it
Body: It has done a very good job in early used of it. I think it will be of great use to me in the future.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Great smoothie blender for the price. Very happy
Body: OK I got this specifically for smoothies and after several months still glad I made the purchase. It works great with smoothies, other stuff as well.

Author: American Customer 22
Title: Five Stars
Body: Just got it made my first smoothie no problems! Only took a week for shipping in normal delivery.

Author: Daniela Demarini
Title: Horrible
Body: Horrible blender...broke after a few uses. Definitely don't buy

Author: Elaine
Title: This blender takes a very long time to chop up ...
Body: This blender takes a very long time to chop up ice cubes, fruit, etc. It is very frustrating to use, so while mine is fairly new, I'm going to replace it. I'm surprised to see so many positive reviews.

Author: Tina K
Title: Can't blend unless there's liquid inside
Body: After reading the reviews, I decided to take a chance on this blender. It doesn't blend well for me at all. I tried to blend some chunks of watermelon and without any liquid in the blender, it would just blend the bottom and not pull down any watermelon pieces from the middle part of the jug. It also did this for me with a milkshake I was making. When there is liquid in the jug, it seems to have no problem. But without it, it doesn't seem to have enough power to blend anything inside. I would not recommend buying this one.

Author: Charlotte_Viv
Title: Good buy
Body: Works well. I didn't know if I would like the spout, but it does make pouring a lot easier. Getting the cap on and off requires some elbow grease but once I wear it in that shouldn't be a problem.

Author: Bill Thomson
Title: Great blender for the price.
Body: Great blender for the price. Works better than the Cuisinart it replaces.

Author: Naomi Henderson
Title: We had an old blender that we were using that worked fine until the rubber seal broke
Body: I bought this for my 90 year old mother. She has had a stroke and has difficulty swallowing and chewing so her caregivers are blending all of her food. We had an old blender that we were using that worked fine until the rubber seal broke, so I bought this blender based on the reviews I read. I noticed that the caregivers have drug out the old blender and are using it again. Someone found a replacement rubber seal. I asked our main caregiver today why she wasn't using the new blender and she said that the food gets stuck in a weird place and then it won't continue to grind up. She said the old blender works a lot better. So...I should have asked sooner because the window to return this item has now closed. Disappointed.

Author: Aaron
Title: The plastic bottom cracked and is now going in the garbage; spend a little extra for a decent blender
Body: This blender broke after a month of use. The plastic bottom cracked and is now going in the garbage; spend a little extra for a decent blender.

Author: C. White
Title: Not great at all.
Body: I have a nutribullet, but ordered this unit because I needed a larger capacity so I could make a bigger smoothie. This couldn't even do half the job that my nutribullet does, save your money if you want a blender that actually... blends. I was very disappointed. I returned this item with no issue which is why it received two stars instead of one.

Author: Burgess
Title: Buy a different one unless you like really chunky smoothies or stirring them 12 times while ...
Body: Quite disappointing. This thing doesn't blend hardly at all. Buy a different one unless you like really chunky smoothies or stirring them 12 times while trying to blend.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: spend more and get a better blender.
Body: barely crushes ice, spend more and get a better blender.

Author: Devyantsoul
Title: Three Stars
Body: Takes a longer time to make smoothies than the Oster blender I had so three stars.

Author: Michele N.
Title: Blender started smoking! YIKES!!!
Body: Really, really wanted to like this blender. I have several other Hamilton Beach small appliances which are holding up very well. This one, not so much. After a few years of VERY light use, maybe once a month, this blender started smoking today while preparing pesto sauce. The ingredients are very soft, so it's not too much of a challenge. I smelled smoke and looked closer to see smoke emanating from the base. I quickly turned it off, threw a wet towel around it and ran for the fire extinguisher, just in case the worst happened. Thank goodness it did not ignite. We now have a kind of burnt plastic smell remaining, a little reminder to get busy shopping for my next blender!

Author: Nikki Lu
Title: Use Often!!
Body: A good blender, but when making smoothies with frozen fruit I have to let it unthaw before blending. Sometimes it doesn't blend well. Not the worst blender and not the best its great for the price. If I had to I would buy again.

Author: Lydia R.
Title: Buy this right now!
Body: If you are in the market for a new blender, stop your search and buy this one. (I am not kidding, do it now). I was in the market for one, and was between a super fancy Ninja and a super cheap (more budget friendly) one. I cut my losses and decided to give this one a try. I have used this blender every day. Every. Day. It is the best budget blender I have ever seen AND it's glass. I haven't bought the food chopper attachment yet, but it is on my to get list. I can't express how much I love this! I have completely forgotten that I even wanted a Ninja to begin with ;)Reasons to love include:1. Glass Pitcher2. Auto Blending3. Tight Seal (huge deal!) Mine never ever leaks4. Easy to clean

Author: Jennifer Leclair
Title: Works great
Body: Great blender

Author: Joel Nathaniel Davis
Title: Great blender
Body: Amazing... especially for the price... I make coffee smoothies every morning... perfect

Author: Tara
Title: Margaritaville :)
Body: I bought this for margaritas and in the past have been disappointed by blenders that can not crush ice or burn up within one use or a month. I've been using this over a year and it still works as great as the day I bought it. It's easy to clean, easy to use and powerful. GET ONE!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Worth the price
Body: Seems to do the job and the product feels pretty nice, anyways if you don't chop up or use hard frozen fruits, this thing cannot work, you have to keep stirring it. However, for the price, yes I think it does the job and I have no complains.

Author: Jose Vera
Title: Five Stars
Body: Excellent

Author: Sudeep Reddy
Title: Glass jar broke and not able to order jar
Body: Glass jar broke and there is no way to order just the jar. I checked everywhere online and could not find anything.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Terrible buy
Body: This blender won't chop up anything, not ice, frozen fruit, etc. I would like to return it but I thru the box away before I tried to use it.

Author: juspat
Title: Five Stars
Body: Love it.

Author: M. Hagan
Title: Works eceptionally well.
Body: My wife makes vegetable smoothies in this almost every day. She loves it. Great product for the price.

Author: Barbara
Title: Five Stars
Body: An excellent blender for the money

Author: Orlando McGuire
Title: Don't you love the lovely sound of construction workers drilling holes in ...
Body: Don't you love the lovely sound of construction workers drilling holes in the ground at 6 am in the morning? NO? Well me neither. And this blender sounds a lot like that. Everybody in my Building knows when I make a smoothie because this blender sounds like something out of a horror movie!And on top of that it takes forever to blend or doesn't blend at all unless i stir it with a fork or spoon. AWFUL!!!!!!!!!I didn't like that all the ninja blenders where plastic so I decided to get something different this time .. something made out of good old fashion glass. And that is the only part I liked about this blender. So I guess its just me because everyone loves this blender.

Author: Kt
Title: Get a different one
Body: Not great.

Author: Karyn Jeanne Alley
Title: Won't crush all of the ice
Body: This blender had really good reviews online, but it will not crush the ice. Every smoothie I've made has ice chunks which is really disappointing. You also have to make sure you hold the lid down when blending or it slowly works it's way up.

Author: TheUnknown
Title: Poor quality glass jar
Body: Just purchased the blender and and after just three blends the glass jug cracked. Did not drop it nor did it have any strong impact against it.An additional negative is that it has difficulty grating ice cubes. Sometimes I had to sit there and wait for them to melt.

Author: Cool NY Gal
Title: Quite Pleased.
Body: It arrived today. Well made, but not too large, which is what I prefer for counter space. The first thing I attempted to make was frozen margaritas to see how well it chops ice. Worked perfectly. Very happy and the price was right. Highly recommend if you want an inexpensive blender that does the job.

Author: Juan
Title: Great Buy
Body: I got more for my $$$ than I expected.

Author: Kian Kludsikofsky
Title: Buy Better A Quality Blender
Body: Pitcher shattered and threw glass everywhere within first 5 seconds of use.

Author: DK
Title: Not well made
Body: It stopped working on the second use, but they accepted the return without question. It seemed like the blade just didn't sit well on the rotor so that the motor would spin, but the blades would not.

Author: Summer
Title: Powerful!
Body: Excellent blender for smoothies and iced drinks! Powerful and nice looking on the counter. Chops ice with no problem. Blends frozen fruits perfectly. When adding protein powders or additives, it just mixes them right in-no stirring or clearing the sides needed.

Author: AM
Title: Weak
Body: Couldn't blend tomatoes, large chunks still left.

Author: Ry Ry
Title: ... this one and so far it has held up pretty good. It's easy to put together and use
Body: Needed to replace my broken blender and bought this one and so far it has held up pretty good. It's easy to put together and use. Cleaning is a piece of cake as well.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: DON'T BUY IT
Body: If I could give this no stars I would ! This is the worst blender I have ever used, It did not grind anything up! SAVE YOUR MONEY !

Author: mrc
Title: Sadly we had to return this in December 2016
Body: We had to return this item during a very busy time for our family, because it arrived with a misshapen (melted?) plastic black part (I believe it was the cap on top). Otherwise, we love a heavy duty blender with multiple functions. I would like to believe that customer service on this item has improved since December of 2016, because we still need a blender and may purchase another similar from Amazon dot com.

Author: Asif khan
Title: HAMILTON BEACH IS THE BEST You can make everything fresh and delicious with the ...
Body: HAMILTON BEACH IS THE BESTYou can make everything fresh and delicious with the Hamilton beaxh Plus' versatility and performance. The powerful motor will impress any chef as it blends through ice, greens, frozen ingredients and more.it works with blending force to smoothly and continuously create the consistency you need. Smart settings are conveniently programmed to blend the perfect smoothies, salsas and milkshakes in just one touch so you never have to guess how long or what speed to blend your ingredients.

Author: Elaina A.
Title: Doesn't Crush Ice Well
Body: I wanted to wait a full month to review this before I did. I use it primarily for smoothies and this thing does not crush ice well at all. I need to repeatedly keep pressing the crush option over and over for entirely too long. Unfortunately I passed the return window time frame, so I'm stuck.

Author: S ames
Title: it was a good
Body: I bought this to replace my old blender that broke after using it for a few months. this one is a third of the price and a lot quieter than the old one. it was a good buy

Author: sylvia aguilar
Title: One Star
Body: This is a horrible blender! Extremely loud and does not handle frozen fruit.

Author: luna
Title: ... first time I used to make smoothi it was amazing I tried to use it today it didn't work
Body: the first time I used to make smoothi it was amazing I tried to use it today it didn't work.wsts wrong ? I just wasted my money

Author: Lisa
Title: Amazing
Body: Our blender broke, and I was looking for a new quality one at a great price, and this was just that! I use it everyday. No complaints!

Author: Max Anderson
Title: Does a bad job of blending, go with a different blender.
Body: Very low quality blender. I thought it would be better given it has decent reviews, but it's really bad. Doesn't chop stuff up very well. Even after minutes of blending, smoothies come out with big chunks of unblended fruit.

Author: Debra
Title: Hamilton Beach - Not worth it!
Body: This blender stopped working after two months. I already had threw away the box and was past the return cutoff. I also bought a Hamilton Beach food processor that did not last after three months. I will never buy this brand again.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It does the job!
Body: Does the job well. This blender comes with a 3 year warranty, so it's a plus.

Author: topReview4you
Title: Bad product and replacement policy
Body: I bought this blender in April. After 2 months of using, it went dead. Some smoke came from the device. Contacted the customer service and was told to take the picture of the device, cut off the plug and pay $11 for the shipping charge for the replacement. Too tedious for me. I didn't do that. Went to nearby Walmart, bought the Oster blender and forgot what happened with Hamilton blender. Think twice before you decide to purchase Hamilton blender.

Author: Haley Gilbert
Title: One Star
Body: I tried to use it the same day I got it and it didn't even turn on

Author: Katelyn Bailey
Title: a little disappointed considering this is a decent brand
Body: I don't know if I just expected too much but doing a simple dressing I have to stop it several times to stir and push the ingredients back down again to actually be blended... a little disappointed considering this is a decent brand.

Author: Vijay Sha
Title: Two Stars
Body: It really is just a blender/mixer, does not puree or grind anything

Author: Buyerofstuff
Title: Worth the price and does the job.
Body: I am very happy with this basic but sturdy blender. I only use it to make morning breakfast smoothies and it does the job well.

Author: ar9803
Title: Five Stars
Body: Works great

Author: Monina S. Naylor
Title: Works
Body: Use to bring foam to make tree foliage.

Author: Bevie W.
Title: Loud and ok performance
Body: I own a bullet and thought that a blender would be a better performer. This one is not. It actually takes longer to make a smoothie than the bullet. It is also very loud - much louder than blenders that I have used in the past. The noise might be OK if the performance we're better.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Awesome!
Body: Made my first smoothie with this blender a couple of days ago and was impressed with the way it crushed the ice and blended everything so smoothly. Worked well and can't wait to make other drinks, etc. Recommended.

Author: michael sonlin
Title: Lid doesn't fit
Body: Lid didn't die snug. Kept popping off. Returned immediately.

Author: Slf99
Title: Just one complaint....
Body: Why must the lid be so hard to take off!! I've chipped a few nails. Otherwise, good blender for the price and the spout eliminates the dripping and messiness that's been the hallmark of past blenders.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: All I expected it to be

Author: Alyson K.
Title: Earplugs required
Body: Good. But noisy

Author: Brittany
Title: Fine if you are on a tight budget
Body: For the price, it's not bad. I like that the container is glass instead of plastic and that it is completely dishwasher safe. On some blenders, the blades need to be hand-washed. However, it is really loud. My ears are always ringing once I'm done using it. It also takes a really long time to blend my smoothies. Now, I do freeze my fruit before making smoothies, so if you are using fresh fruit it is probably fine, but anything frozen it takes a long time before getting any traction. If you can afford it, I would splurge for something a bit more expensive, but if you're one a tight budget, this one will do.

Author: Likely
Title: Works fine, but loud.
Body: Works fine, but loud.

Author: Rick L
Title: Blender That Blends (Really Well)
Body: Works well. Great reviews and lived up to them.

Author: Charles
Title: Alas, poor blender- we knew you well...
Body: Bought in March. Died by May. Worked fine while we had it. Just not designed for continued/everyday use.

Author: krishnakanth palley
Title: I was amazed to see that when I throw a strawberries
Body: I was amazed to see that when I throw a strawberries... they just won't blend unless I chop them out them in the jar to blend it .... this particular item is very disappointing and I wish I purchased something from Walmart.. Do Not Buy...

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: WORST amazon purchase EVER
Body: Leaks, leaks leaks. DO NOT BUY. WORST amazon purchase EVER!!¡!!

Author: Nikki D
Title: Happy
Body: Love the gloss. Make milkshake in less than a min.

Author: Michigan1234
Title: Super disappointed
Body: Based on the positive customer reviews, I purchased this blender in February 2017 and by May 2017 I am already throwing it away.... I have only used it for pureeing soft foods (soft, roasted carrots, sweet potatoes, and squash, bananas, and steamed peas) for my baby and the machine still couldn't handle the job. I don't feel that it would even have been able to blend up a smoothie with frozen fruit for me. Super disappointed!

Author: John
Title: I purchased and the returned this blender. It was ...
Body: I purchased and the returned this blender. It was not very powerful; it had a hard time breaking up anything frozen (bananas, avocado, berries etc.)

Author: R. Yu
Title: Nice
Body: Nice and powerful, easy to clean.

Author: P.
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great quality! Works really well.

Author: Christopher C.
Title: Works pretty good, but is also loud.
Body: Got this for Mother's Day and we made milkshakes. However the milkshake setting didn't work too well and used a different one that worked much better. It's also quite loud. It almost sounds like gears are grinding instead of the usual higher pitched noise blenders make. I know reading this probably sounds like I received a damaged one but there seems to be absolutely nothing wrong with it, simply describing the noise (I don't think gears are actually grinding, just sounds similar). The glass pitcher feels very strong and gives the blender a quality feel. Also, the rubber(?) lid fits very snug. You don't need to hold the top with your hand or anything, it feels very reassuring. Looking forward to trying it out more! And for the price?? You really can't beat this blender. Just make sure you give it time and try various blending modes before thinking it's not good.Product shipped a day ahead of schedule! Box did have a slight hole in it but all was good inside.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Broken in 2nd use!!!
Body: Very unsatisfied with the product. I received it last week and today, at second use while I was making a smoothie, it broke! I put some strawberries, bananas, honey, yoghurt and protein powder on it, regular ingredients of smoothie for one person!!! The bottom part with blade got separated and all the smoothie poured into the motor part. I threw away the box and I do not know how I can return it. And I had used an one time special offer provided by my credit card company to be used in Amazon and I wasted that for this useless device. I thought it can be connected again to the container, but it did not work anymore!

Author: Steven A
Title: Happy
Body: Works as expected arrived quickly

Author: drew robichaux
Title: Works great
Body: Great product. Blends ice very good

Author: A-Person
Title: Absolutely not recommended.
Body: If I can give it zero, I would, but one is the least allowed star. This blender is not powerful at all. To blend tomatoes, which are very soft, you need to make it in very small cubes and add much water to blend it. Sometimes I feel I had to exert effort more than the blender to prepare items for it to blend. Also the jar starts to leak within a few months. Absolutely not recommended.

Author: Marae J. Morris
Title: Four Stars
Body: It works OK.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great product
Body: Needed one got one. Very pleased

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Four Stars
Body: Works pretty good for such a cheap price.

Author: Isaiah
Title: Five Stars
Body: Awesome blender

Author: beautyboss
Title: Not worth the money
Body: Runs very Loud!!...doesn't blend well still have chunks in my smoothies.....guess you get what you pay for....cheaper is not always better.

Author: Georgiagurl
Title: Hamilton Beach Power Multi-Function Blender
Body: This blender works very well. I use it mostly for making fruit smoothies. I have had this blender for over a year and it has help up well for me.

Author: Denice Rupp
Title: Pretty good
Body: We all really live the blender. It works pretty well.It came on tine. Was fast.Just wish it had more settings

Author: KB
Title: Not for small portion!!
Body: Don't buy!! Very bad for small portions!! I expect better mixer from Hamilton Beach!! I'm vey disappointed with this purchase!!

Author: Irma Ruilova
Title: Love it! I've had oster all my life
Body: Love it! I've had oster all my life, but decided to try this one. The squary shape is cool and I love the lid. It opens so you can pour the drink directly or store the left overs in the fridge without using an extra jar.

Author: Sulaz
Title: One Star
Body: It didn't work for me because its 110v. We use 220v here

Author: Mark McConnell
Title: Four Stars
Body: I use it to make shake's and smoothies it works great

Author: Jodi Kitson
Title: I did like that the container was glass and I had faith
Body: I had it for 7 months and the motor burned out and it broke. I used it maybe 3x a week. It didn't blend very well anyways (smoothies were very chunky) and it was crazy loud. I did like that the container was glass and I had faith, but overall it was a big disappointment. I wish I could return it and get my money back.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Solide Blender
Body: Bought this blender to replace by broken one and was glad I was forced to get a new one. This blender has a strong blade and is perfect for smoothies.

Author: Crafty Slacker
Title: Works well for me! Love the wide-mouthed bottom!
Body: I needed to purchase a new smoothie maker after my Bullet I've had for many years started leaking down through the motorized assembly and adjusting the gaskets didn't stop the leak. I came across this HB multi-function blender and purchased it specifically because it had a wide-mouthed bottom and lots of power. I always had problems with my fruit and protein powder getting stuck in the bottom of regular-sized blender jars and not mixing thoroughly. This one doesn't have that issue and works well for me, even with the largest chunks of fruit. Crushes ice cubes just fine, although I do as one reviewer suggests and I put a little liquid in first. The motor is not too loud and it has all the functions I need. I have several Hamilton Beach appliances and would recommend them any day!

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Four Stars
Body: too laud

Author: J
Title: Stopped working and smelled like burnt plastic
Body: Broke after 3 uses. Stopped working and smelled like burnt plastic, kind of scary.

Author: monique m kirkpatrick
Title: One Star
Body: The $15 one that I got from Walmart works better than this one, and I'm not even exaggerating.

Author: Kevin D. Miller
Title: Buy IT! AAA+++
Body: Awesome! Easy compared to old one, much faster, and easy pour from top!!

Author: 4ever2
Title: small blade; doesn't blend harder foods
Body: unfortunately had to return it, due to it did not blend slices of apples or ice cubes. apparently the blades are small; the blades would just spin in the middle, but not blend the whole mixture. also tried by adding water but still did not blend. I really wanted to like it, but did not work for my purpose. buy if you're only blending softer foods/mixtures.

Author: loverofshooz
Title: Sadly, NO
Body: Sadly, very sadly....first time used, and started leaking copiously from bottom - with smoothie ingredients inside! Took it apart, and the screw-on bottom, fitting over the blade attachment, had two cracks, one on either side. So I would certainly recommend checking the parts carefully upon arrival. From the looks, either a manufacturing errors or, maybe, a previous return? In any event, a disappointment....

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Works great for my purposes
Body: Purchased this blender to crush ice for mixed drinks. Works great for my purposes.

The power is very weak and if you blend for more than a couple minutes you can smell the motor. If I still had the packaging I would return it:(

Author: OregonBorne
Title: You Get What You Pay For
Body: The old adage, that you get what you pay for is pretty well confirmed with this blender. It works, but that's about the best I can say for it. I also like the sturdy glass body.The low price was the primary reason I bought it. But I'm a hard-core green-smoothie guy, and I use my blender several times per week. So after trying this one out for a few months, I think I'm ready to buy something a little better.To begin with, it doesn't blend very well. I'm not sure if there is a design problem, or if the blades are just sort of dull. But I have to let it run for a couple minutes to get my spinach and kale blended to a smooth consistency. It's also loud. Like, louder than an ordinary blender. And when you have to let it run extra long to get things blended, that's doubly unpleasant.The lid is awful. It is extremely difficult to put on and take off. I'm a 45 yr old man with hard-working strong hands, and I have trouble every time I try to remove the lid. I have to press so hard with my thumbs that it hurts a little bit. And they added a couple of openings in the lid that are probably intended for some useful purpose, but they just allow slight leakage.The motor is strong, and works well. Only 2 speeds, but really, that's all I would ever need.I'd say if you're looking for an inexpensive blender for occasional use (margaritas and milkshakes), and you don't mind wrestling with a stubborn lid, then this blender is probably just fine for you. And the price is right. But if you plan on using your blender regularly, and ease of use is important to you, I'd suggest looking for a nicer one.

Author: DavidH
Title: Does what I need it to do at the right price
Body: I have the red version of this model 58147 and it was purchased approximately 4 years ago. It hasn't been used for that entire time as I startedusing a NutriBullet. But my second Nutribullet recently bit the dust and being money challenged I decided to dig this one out and try it. I've been starting to make some simple drinks such as baby greens, frozen fruit along with almond and coconut milk. I watched some YouTube videos by people who do high powered blending but testing out inexpensive blenders to see if they could make their normal drinks. What I learned is that it takes several steps (blend greens, harder fruits) along with your liquid first and then add other ingredients (perhaps in batches depending on how much fruit you are using) to acheive results similar to a higher powered blender. When I follow those guidelines I'm actually pretty shocked at how smooth the drinks turn out. I believe they come out better than in the NutriBullet (600W).. I was hesitant to start using this again due to the larger size and having to go through more to clean it but it hasn't been that bad using the EasyClean setting. I know people like to complain about blender noise and I usually can't relate much to that (what do you expect, really.....) but I have noticed that running this blender for several minutes starts to bother my ears and make me feel like I am about to get a headache. I have a Montel Healthmaster blender (don't want to use that to make little smoothies) so I know what loud is. There seems to be something about the pitch of the sound that gets to me. I made homemade almond milk in it today and it comes out better than in the Ninja blender pitcher that I got for Christmas (that I just haven't been able to use to get the drinks smooth enough-maybe with more experimenting who knows but I am not into gravel-ly drinks). Consumer Reports rated this blender pretty low but it seems to work well for me. For the price it's hard to beat. The only thing that could be better is the Oster blender in this price range if you can get one with a glass pitcher.

Author: REPO
Title: WORTH THE MONEY! DOES THE JOB!
Body: This product works and I love that it comes with glass instead of plastic. The buttons all seem to do the same thing, blend! So, expect to get what you're paying for. It's basic and somewhat easy to clean. The bottom has a gap, so it's easy around the base, for your food to get stuck. Each time I use it, I have to take it apart and clean it all out, then let it all dry and put it back together. Our more expensive blender was a sold connection, so once you cleaned, you dried and put back, without having to take everything apart each time, so they obviously didn't cleverly design this model! Another thing is the top cover is plastic and it fights extremely tightly. It might not be too easy for some people to secure it in place (something to consider). Also, suggestion: Hold it well, when you open the top, as previously mentioned, lid fits on so tight, it causes suction when you're blending. I thought I would like the top lip for liquids but I find it easier to pour through the glass jar spout instead. I think that for the price we paid, it was worth it because if it was $25 or more, I would recommend something else.

Title: Poor design
Body: I bought this item in the hopes that some of the bad reviews were misleading. They were not. I blend fruits and vegetables for smoothies and my old blender gave up the ghost. I tried using this blender, but the fruit just sat there for the most part. Literally, the blades turned and nothing happened no matter how large or small the item was (banana pieces to apple slices to berries). The problem is that the jar base is too wide for the blades and leaves spaces for the food to get stuck/lodged. Very poor design. I gave it two stars just because Amazon return shipping is a blessing for items like this, otherwise it would have gotten 1.

Body: I bought this because I wanted to make a cake and needed a blender. I prefer the glass jar and this one had an awesome price. Well, after mixing everything in this blender, when I grabbed the jar to pour the mix into the baking sheet, the bottom part disconnected from the jar and everything and I mean EVERYTHING came out of the jar. It went into the drawers, on the floor, in between the oven and cabinet, inside the blender itself, in between every button. I spent an insanely amount of time trying to clean everything. I wasted time, energy, lots of paper towel, made me very angry and the worst part was that I didn't eat the cake I was craving. So it would be a -star if it had that option. So for now, it's a 1 star and it's too much!

Body: This blender holds up really well, even with viscous material like super frozen ice cream. The only issue I have with it, the lid doesn't pour so well. It has to be put on a specific way- the lid is shaped exactly like the blender so you have to line everything up- still drips. :P I make sure what I'm making is well mixed and just take the lid off and pour like that.It's not overly loud, makes short work of blending drinks, is compact and easy to store. I like that the blender is glass, it's easy to clean. Doesn't hold odor or wear out over time like plastic blenders. It's a good deal for the price/value.

Author: G. Kilbride
Title: Difference a day makes
Body: I've been using a highly rated Oster blender but shaped like a tornado. Ridiculous design. I kept changing to specialized blades before realizing it didn't matter at all. The power and quality and 14 speeds are wasted when there's simply not enough room at the base. I had to stop repeatedly and stir things around.My priority in a new purchase was a value blender with a wide base and designed to keep things moving. There's nothing more annoying in blender use than a loud motor trying to spin but nothing going on other than burning smell while wearing out the motor. That describes Oster. But I had a recent timeshare week in Virginia. The unit had a Hamilton Beach blender very similar to this one. It worked great with my typical breakfast shake. Unfortunately I forgot to write down the model number. But the look and features were the same. I took a shot on this Power Elite model, after careful study of reviews here and elsewhere. Hamilton Beach touts the so-called wave action, or whatever, in many of its designs. Mostly I think that's a crock, that the wide base enables traffic to keep moving. It's like more lanes on a freeway.Regardless, after one usage I'm incredibly pleased. I didn't baby this at all. Instead of incremental input like with Oster I decided to dump everything in at once. It is a protein shake with roughly 9 ounces of liquid plus plenty of ice and also a bag of frozen fruit and green veggies. The blob of frozen spinach is what troubled Oster most.Not this guy. I pushed the first button, one that said Milk Shake among other things, and the Hamilton Beach plowed smack through it. There were a few brief hesitations but I was never concerned I'd have to stop and stir. The variance between Friday with Oster and Saturday with Hamilton Beach was incredible. With Oster I was forever changing modes, along with Low or High, desperate to find anything that threatened to work.Pouring was surprisingly simple and effective. From the looks of things I thought gobs would remain in the jar. Nope.There are a few issues: This is a low priced model so many of the parts other than the jar are plastic, in contrast to my Oster and other blenders I've used. Instead of a manual there's more like a brief pamphlet. The lid is relatively difficult to snap on and also to remove. You have to identify the proper place to put your thumb to use. Also, the ability to store the cord in the bottom of the base is wildly overstated. In multiple tries couldn't get it to travel more than a half foot before stop and refusal.

The actual functions of the blender work decently--it's no magic bullet, but for the price point, it does its job.My only complaint is that the bottom piece is detachable and if you don't make sure to have it on tightly at all times, it will leak. It's just something you have to get used to if this wasn't an issue with your past blenders.

Author: Justen Ladda
Title: Blender with a dead zone
Body: I bought this to make milk shakes and to mix cake batter. What I found was that the shape of the container is too wide at the bottom. There is a space of about 3/4 between the container wall and the blades. Ice cubes will get cut down to just under 3/4 and then rattle around on the bottom.It's like there's a dead zone below and next to the blades and the twirl created by the blades isn't strong or directed enough to lift stuff out of that zone. I think a V-shaped container would work better. I looked and saw many other blenders have that shape - and for a reason!I do like the spout on this model, it allows or the liquid to be portioned out very precisely and without mess. The little door on top of the lid that you can open to add things while the blender is working, is too small and looks like it will be the first thing to break, it's just attached by a thin piece of plastic. This blender is OK, I would not recommend it. Whoever designed it wasn't very inspired or ever tested it.

Title: but Im making an exception because of how disappointed with this blender I am"
Body: I can't even remember the last time I reviewed a product on Amazon, and I buy a lot of stuff, but Im making an exception because of how disappointed with this blender I am.I like to make thick smoothies, usually involving ice, bananas (possibly frozen bananas), nutbutter and milk/almond milk. With this blender it takes me almost 10 minutes for this very simple thing, because ice and or banana chunks just never get sucked into the blades. I'll have to stop and push stuff down half a dozen times until I accept defeat and drink it with the ice and banana chunks. (And yes, there is plenty of liquid).Also it's so loud and I live in an apartment so I feel like I can't use it late at night or in the morning without irritating my neighbors.My old $20 grocery store personal water bottle blender (Oster brand if you're looking) lasted 4 years before the plastic cracked, was much quieter, and did a great job blending the same ingredients. With the hamilton beach, it leaves the rind in chunks and can't pulverize it. i thought i was getting a step up, since this cost more than the oster, but i was wrong. this blender would only be good for blending protein powders, not for making fruit or green smoothies, or anything that would require grinding fruit or veggies smoothely.

Author: reesah mouse
Title: Great Blender for the Price
Body: I have used four of these blenders. A couple of years ago, my blender broke so my daughter bought one of these for us to use. It worked so well that I purchased a second one for myself. My son wanted a blender for Christmas, so I purchased one of these for him also (the one with the chopper). Recently, I bought another one because, sadly, I broke the glass jar. I was washing it in the sink and it slipped out of my hands.I also have a Blend-Tec Designer 725. While I can't say that this blender has the same power, it will actually blend my smoothies. more easily than the Blend-Tec. The Blend-Tec will blend and pulverize something like kale, whereas this won't (there will be tiny bits of green), but this will blend with less liquid and less trouble (less having to stop and add more liquid, less having to stop and help it along with a spatula).I think this is a great blender for the price, especially since it has a glass jar, so if you need to blend soups or something else warm, this works well for that. It also works great for smoothies.This said, the first one we bought was loud, but not that loud. The others I've purchased since are definitely louder. I've never had a problem with the motor, though.

Body: I've had this blender for a few years now, but I have used it very infrequently so I've in no way worn it down. That being established, I am baffled as to how this blender has so many overwhelmingly positive reviews. It is not a very good blender. I made a smoothie this morning that includes rolled oats and ice in addition to protein powder and milk, and the ice remains in large chunks and the rolled oats are completely untouched despite my tedious efforts. This has ALWAYS been the case for this blender. It just doesn't seem to have the power to adequately blend things that aren't already in liquid form. It's inexpensive so that earns at least a couple stars, but unfortunately you get what you pay for with this.

Body: Very good blender for a v reasonable price....Hamilton Beach is a good brand but I guess their quality varies with the price range...because the last blender I got was from macys and was the same brand but very low quality. Buttons were popping out ..so I returned it...then I found this on amazon..looked good so I bought it.....i was avoiding this brand but then it was my price range and had good reviews so i thought if i ll not like it then i will return it but surprisingly it was really good....thick blades,good quality and a space underneath to store the wire....i do not why the other one was like that....i mostly make shakes and smoothies in it...crushes ice v nicely...i makes pesto and other sauces too....never had a single complaint with it.....Pros:good quality,strong blades,glass blender,good price,easy to cleanCons: I wish wire was retractable but again...it has a space underneath but I personally like the retractable wire thingy the one vacuum have...i wish people should start making appliances that are rechargeable or the wire that is retractable ....ohhh...i ll be so happy....Overall I highly recommend this product.

Author: GeeMan
Title: Loved It So Much I Bought a Second One!
Body: I'm so impressed with this blender (including its price) that I just purchased a second one so I'll always have a clean pitcher and related hardware (I live alone and it can take a few days to fill the dishwasher up enough to justify running it). First of all, at 700 Watts, this thing packs a lot more horsepower than most low-priced blenders (many of which seem to fall in the 400-500 Watt range). I use it for fruit/milk/protein powder smoothies and this thing has no problem fully blending things thoroughly (including pulverizing ice cubes pretty much completely). I also love the fact that the pitcher is made entirely of glass and the handle is an integral part of the glass (not a strapped-on attachment which can/did break on my previous blender). And the screw-on base/blade assembly is very easy to detach by hand for cleaning (unlike with my previous blender, which was unbelievably difficult to disassemble).

Author: Chris
Title: Barely works
Body: I'm very disappointed with this product. Used only twice, with second attempt even worse than first, barely chops walnut halves which is why I bought it. I'm past the return date so may have to donate it, although that seems cruel.

Author: A. Horton
Title: Decent blender
Body: I bought this as a replacement for my sister after I accidentally blew hers up. It is a decent blender for the price, but I'm spoiled by my high powered (read expensive) blender. She hasn't complained, but now I travel with my blender when we visit as this one isn't up to heavy smoothies I make.

Author: Tony M. Calkins
Title: You get what you pay for when it comes to ...
Body: You get what you pay for when it comes to blenders. I would suggest you spend a little more money for a higher quality product. This blender struggles to chop ice. After just 2 uses it began to smell of burning plastic.

Author: Babycakes
Title: Good, but loud
Body: So far, this works great! I love the glass carafe, but I don't use the pour top at all. I just take it off and pour from the carafe itself.It would be 5 stars, but it leaves ice chunks (not sure if that's the temperature of my freezer, or lack of ability from the blender) and it is very loud.

Author: Urvashi
Title: Total waste of money
Body: Used it only for the second time!!! And after 5 minutes of making hummus the machine stopped working!!! Totally disappointing and would urge everyone to never buy this product!!! Total waste of money !! and chickpeas!!! I HATE IT

Author: I L
Title: lid was bent when I received it
Body: the lid was bent. I'm not sure if a bent lid will still work so I am returning it for a new one.UPDATE: I did not end up returning, but tried using with the bent lid and it still works! Wasn't able to completely chop up carrot bits, but might be because I did not blend long enough.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very excellent recommend seller

Author: saphyeve
Title: Five Stars
Body: i love this item, very well made. very sturdy. i am satisfied with my purchcase

Author: Bonnie J. Howell
Title: excellent product
Body: Arrvd on time & well pkd. Haven't owned a blender since 1983. With the popularity of Smoothies made will fresh gruit, I decided to g

Author: Rebecca3t
Title: Lasts more than a magic bullet
Body: Great buy!You can't go wrong with this piece of bargain. Even bought for family and friends too as presents.They all love it and this has lasted more than my magic bullet, which costs 4 times as more.

Author: S2
Title: Horrible... 10 minutes to make a smoothie!
Body: I bought this initially because I thought I might need a blender at some point for my apartment so I just bought the cheapest one with the best rating on amazon. After 6 months of non use I decided to use it to make smoothies since it's summer. All I put in the smoothies are frozen fruit, yogurt, and milk. This blender takes 10 minutes to make a smoothie. 10 MINUTES. I timed it. By the time my smoothie is ready I can hardly hear. The blades seem to be super dull and the blender doesn't pull anything down as it blends, just reblends the stuff stuck on the bottom. This is the worst blender I've ever used. I'm only giving it 2 stars because it eventually makes my smoothie and its relatively easy to clean. I'm now looking for another blender on amazon and decided to give this one a review while I'm at it.

Author: yusif Yunusah
Title: Try buying this
Body: I simply love it

Author: Margherite De Ponty
Title: the bottom of blender rusted and started chipping off while turning of the blade. Poor product!
Body: the bottom of the rotating knife started rusting (and I never even put this and other rubber part in the dish washer) and started chipping off at the base of the blender. It's going to erode and fall apart soon and I will have to buy another one soon. This product is made poorly. Whatever happened to the days when a blender can last 10-20 years? I would not buy this product again.

Author: Hepzibah
Title: Five Stars
Body: This blender works very well and is easy to clean.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Awesome blender, can actually finely grind things like nuts and seeds quickly. makes GREAT smoothies.

Author: Mina
Title: Four Stars
Body: Perfect until the glass pitcher broke! :/

Author: Christine Scott
Title: Five Stars
Body: Works like a charm.

Author: gs
Title: The plastic ring that goes around the blades and screws ...
Body: The plastic ring that goes around the blades and screws onto the bottom of the pitcher broke, after 1 year of rare use. Otherwise OK blender.

Author: Izaberu
Title: I was given a fancy Ninja blender that I thought was great ($400 of great
Body: After moving in to my new apartment, I was given a fancy Ninja blender that I thought was great ($400 of great, I assumed). After using that Ninja for months and getting smoothies with too many seeds/pieces remaining, and not being able to get a good puree on chilies for salsa, I had enough. This blender is SO MUCH BETTER and only $30. All the same smoothies I've been making are now fluffier and the strawberry seeds get ground up so well I hardly notice any. I wish I knew about this blender before getting fooled by a fancier Ninja.

Author: Deborah
Title: Five Stars
Body: Inexpensive and effective

Author: Kerilina
Title: Great blender for the price
Body: Great blender for the price. I use it mostly for smooties and making soups. Perfect fit for any kitchen. I previously had a magic bullet and this is far superior. I would recommend this product.

Author: Andrew
Title: Works pretty good for the price just have to be careful not to break the plastic parts.
Body: The glass container alone is worth buying this unit but the downside is that everything else is plastic. For $25 you don't expect much but the basic performace. There are alot of modes that work quite well and was surprised it had that many for the price I paid for it. The only down side is that over time the base of the glass jar chipped so I had to glue it back together. The unit still works just have to be careful not to be rough when handling and washing the unit. Its still a good blender for the money and I still use it til this day.

Author: Chet McGovern
Title: This thing is fantastic! There is nothing I haven't been able to ...
Body: This thing is fantastic! There is nothing I haven't been able to blend in this. I think the only thing it won't obliterate is an old Nokia phone. I use it for milkshakes though.

Author: edgar renteria
Title: Too much noise
Body: Works good but very noisy

Author: Ramsey Campbell
Title: Unacceptable and Dangerous
Body: Unbelievable, after only two uses the bottom simply fell apart. The mess was spectacular as I was making a blueberry smoothie at the time. According to the appliance's manual, the cutting blades are permanently affixed to the bottom of the glass pitcher. Not in my case. The bottom simply fell out as I lifted the pitcher to pour. And there is no way to reattach it even if you wanted to. Apparently the cutting blades are supposed to be glued on to a gasket at the bottom of the pitcher. And somebody forgot to or didn't use enough glue. This is not only unacceptable, it is dangerous. It may be that that mine was that rare one in a million failure and other Hamilton Beach blenders are perfectly fine. But the question before you buy this is; Do you feel lucky?

Author: cynthia bendler
Title: Good basic blender.
Body: It's a good basic blender for the price and for what I need it for.

Author: CYNTHIA CREECH
Title: Five Stars
Body: wonderful blender

Author: Gordon Toal
Title: Great
Body: Great

Author: Kimberley Alexander
Title: Much better
Body: It works much better than described. Gonna sound exaggerated but this is the Ferrari of blenders!

Author: Lola B.
Title: Not worth it
Body: This blender is horrible at doing its job. If you're planning to blend vegetables & fruits, expect to be there for AWHIIIIILE. And don't expect it to be done well after that while has passed. I'm regretting this purchase. Don't waste your money.

Author: Vanilo L.
Title: Five Stars
Body: AMAZING

Body: Completely crushes any type of fruit! Great buy. Perfect for our small kitchen

Author: Kristen

Body: Little small but my smoothies are big I guess. Problem is since I have big smoothies they'd over flow at the top since the easy poor spot has space for liquid to get threw. Other wise its pretty good

Author: Julia C
Title: Make smoothies with frozen fruit and milk and protein powder ...
Body: Make smoothies with frozen fruit and milk and protein powder all the time with this. It's lasted about 2 years so far.

Title: Meh. It's just an average blender.
Body: With so many positive reviews, I thought this one would be good. Just using it for smoothies. It struggles a bit more than it should with frozen blueberries, takes multiple stop / starts to finally get things blended, even in small quantities.I did just notice that the price has decreased since I purchased two weeks ago ...

Author: Priyanka
Title: Two Stars
Body: Cutter is not sharp at all. Taking long time to make puree :(

Author: AC

Body: Leaves carrot chunks in my smoothie. Other comparable blenders did not. Blades don't seem as sharp as other ones.

Author: Amazon Customer
