Body: Doesn't work well if the mixture doesn't contain enough liquid. I make a lot of smoothies and add water to keep it blending

Author: Amazon Customer

Author: Trudy-ann H.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Four Stars

Author: M. Riddle
Title: Smeared Printing on Faceplate.
Body: I replaced a less expensive model with the Hamilton Beach. We purchased it based on the favorable reviews here on Amazon. This blender works well when it comes to heavy duty ice crushing, although, I have to use pulse mode for this or I start to smell the motor getting hot. The problem I have is that after 1 year of relatively light use, the printing on the stainless steel name plate, around the buttons, easily smears. The base unit has never been submersed in water and has been lightly wiped clean with a damp cloth. When I was using the unit yesterday I happen to touch the metal plate and the printing easily smeared and is now illegible. I'll keep the current rating as long as the motor holds up but the manufacturer needs to re-evaluate their production process when it comes to printing the face-plate.

Author: Cathy
Title: Five Stars
Body: It's great! Me and my roommates love it.

Author: Cinnabun
Title: With all the reviews I was really expecting a super blender. But this is just your average blender
Body: With all the reviews I was really expecting a super blender. But this is just your average blender. In fact I seem to have some problems with smoothie making where it just seems to rotate around the bottom and all the other stuff sits stationary higher up in the pitcher part.

Author: Tracy B
Title: Five Stars
Body: great product

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: Powerful Stable Blender. I like it!!

Body: Not great at rapidly liquifying strawberries, bananas and ice for smoothies. Disappointed in whatever makes to slow to grab the food and liquify it. Would buy a different brand next time.

Title: love the lid
Body: glass pitcher. love the lid. its grippy

Tried all modes didn't blend left small chunks of garlic and ginger. got $12 black and decker from walmart worked sweet. This is a complete bogus blade design. I strongly won't recommend

Body: Haven't used it yet but it's a really good, heavy blender. Hard to clean though. Blade doesn't come off.

Body: Didn't blend my salsa well enough and I feel like it doesn't have enough power for the size of it. My single cup Hamilton blender can make the salsa but for some reason this one has a difficult time doing it.

Author: Rebekah B
Title: Good deal on a nice blender.
Body: This is an excellent blender for the price. When I moved out from my parents house I was used to using their VitaMix, which is of course not comparable to this product. I basically just looked up the cheapest blender with good reviews and ended up with this one. I use it mainly for smoothies. While it doesn't have the total pulverization that the VitaMix has, it does well with most frozen fruits, and doesn't leave chunks in your drink. I've had it for around 6 months and it still works just as well as when I first got it.

Author: Alexandra R Marsden
Title: Great blender
Body: I have used this blender a few times now and I really love it. Totally worth every penny.

Author: Joe Metro
Title: Value

Author: Lady J Faulkner
Title: Not so cool since I bought it as a gift
Body: I don't know how it works, but it came in an ugly cardboard box that was crushed down the side. Not so cool since I bought it as a gift! I opened it to see if it was broken or crushed, didn't seem so, but when he opens it. we'll see.

Title: Five Stars

Author: Bobbi

Title: I like it enough to order twice!
Body: Works well, I use it almost every day for smoothies. I had another one which unfortunately fell/was knocked off the counter and smashed. I had been happy enough with this one, so I reordered!

Body: Good for smoothies and other recipes. A little loud at its high speed and doesn't puree as well as the ninja but good blender for its price point.

Body: Motor smells of burnt something after brief use. Not for ice despite picture. Fails to work on fruit or dry goods. Best suited for sparse use, and mushy stuff in some kind of liquid (think cooked squash or cooked lentils). Ninja is the best, but you've gotta settle for their meager 12mo warranty.

Title: Two Stars

Author: Paul D Farber

Body: Works great... use it mainly for smoothies and it blends the ice quickly. A little loud, but its a blender.

Author: MJML

Body: It doesn't blend well with any leafy veggie. My baby kale still tastes like flaky leaves in my power smoothie.

Author: Deirdre
Title: Great blender
Body: I use this blender all the time to make smoothies and milkshakes. It works great

Author: Magical Dragon
Title: Nice Blender
Body: I like how it has only 5 buttons, instead of some others which have over a dozen, which is just a gimmick anyways. I actually liked my old Oster blender better, because it seemed to blend up vegetables like carrots better in my smoothies. I also liked the plastic lid on my Oster better, because it was lighter. This has a glass lid, which is heavier, but looks a lot nicer. I think they are both nice, and you will probably be happy with either one.

Author: Emily
Title: I've had this blender less than two months and after ...
Body: I've had this blender less than two months and after using it only 6 times (and not to blend thick items) - the motor burnt out. Not worth the money.

Author: AR3S
Title: Don't! Just don't!
Body: Didn't work well. Didn't move food around. Fried the motor after 6 uses. If you're thinking it was hard use, it wasn't. We were blending cubed soft baked squash, and steamed spinach.Don't waste your money!

Author: A Disney Family
Title: Wonderful
Body: This absolutely out ranks any other name brand that I considered buying! Extremely durable, doesn't leak, easy clean up. Very thick glass, I've used it with tons of ice and frozen fruits. Very happy customer!

Author: miguel tactuk
Title: Three Stars
Body: The quality is not so great but it has been working fine.

Author: mateo52
Title: I do ice
Body: I bought this blender for a specific use, crushing ice for beverages and thereby sparing the motor in our overpriced you can't use that, it's for special occasions blender. Exactly what those occasions would be I have yet to determine. Anyway, for my purposes, it is powerful if a tad noisy and even stuffed to capacity with ice cubes, it hasn't failed to get the job done and the lid seals on the glass jar securely as well. It's stable in operation and easy to clean.Now, it's been reported to me it functions efficiently for preparation of smoothies which I suppose is some sort of non-alcoholic coco loco?

Body: It suits my needs, it meets or exceeds expectations, and it was cheap. So cheap that if it dies after warranty, I won't blink and won't miss it.

Instead my wife and 3 year old picked this one out and ordered it based on how it looked and the buttons.A few years later, it is still making a full jar of smoothie every morning. All the parts go in the dishwasher every night. It's loud as a lawnmower but wrapping a towel around the base blocks a lot of the sound. I gotta admit it gets the job done. The little guy made me a fan.

Author: V. Hariharan
Title: Fantastic low cost blender.
Body: For decades we have been a Oster household because of the glass bowl. After the last Oster failed to effectively do what it's supposed to, decided to take the Hamilton Beach plunge. WOW! incredible difference. This thing rocks. It is half as noisy as the old Oster, has the glass jar, and pulverizes anything you put into it. What's more, it costs half the Oster does! Looks like HB will take over the low cost blender market with this one.The lid is a bit cumbersome to remove and put back, but it's hardly worth complaining about.

Author: Jenn and Ellie
Title: This is a great blender and works so well to blend up smoothies ...
Body: This is a great blender and works so well to blend up smoothies and protein powder type items. I highly recommend it.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Meets my every need.

Author: Hope
Title: I discovered that chopping ice is not its best function, as the ice tends to just stick ...
Body: I don't have a lot of experience with blenders, to be honest. But this is a powerful little blender with a glass dispenser, rather than plastic. I discovered that chopping ice is not its best function, as the ice tends to just stick to the sides and I have to use a wooden spoon to keep pushing it back down to the blade. Maybe I need to smash the ice first? Otherwise, it makes great smoothies.Haven't tried it on other foods yet, but see no reason why it wouldn't do a great job.

Author: Evelyn Solis
Title: Didn't work well... at all
Body: Didn't chop the food.. left huge chunks. Would give it zero stars, if possible.

Author: hbgirl

Body: Great blender for the price. It is a bit noisy, but other than that, it works great for my smoothies.

Author: Donna Lawson
Title: Hard to crush up ice so not to happy about this product
Body: Hard to crush up ice so not to happy about this product.

Author: Jennifer B.
Title: Not pleased
Body: It came as a rush as I ordered it. That's why I put the extra star. In the guide (of several languages), there was a section on how to wash it, a break down of things u make. I was under the impression that when you put the actual blender on, it clicked or latched.. no, it just sits in the base. (And if I'm wrong, please correct me). I just had stomach surgery so I rushed this, as I had no blender of any kind. I'm tried blending chicken, with and without gravy.. doesn't touch a thing,,, its better I just mash the food with a fork.I have bought fruit in jars to blend, now I'm wondering if I should even bother.)

Author: nicole white
Title: Don't buy---cheap quality
Body: Do not buy this blender. The bottom black part (which is necessary to screw the blender in place and hold the liquid in) cracks in half so easily because it's a thing piece of plastic. I've had this happen to 2 of these blenders, and my boyfriend had it happen to his. Not worth the effort of buying and returning a faulty blender.

Author: Amanda V
Title: It doesnt really mix well, i have to constantly ...
Body: It doesnt really mix well, i have to constantly keep putting a knife or something in there to push the food in. I ordered this model because of the famous brand but i might as well just got any other brand. Its ok though

Author: Hector Carmona
Title: The worst ever blender in the world!
Body: Just doesn't work! It's useless!

Author: Mia Putrino
Title: Just OK
Body: I've had this for about a half a year and it's essential ok as far as blenders are concerned. It has a seriously difficult time blending ice for smoothies and I often have to stir the mixture manually to try and get the ice to incorporate. My boyfriend has a kitchenaid and I was shocked at how efficient it was by comparison. I would probably not purchase this one again.

Author: jett
Title: Excellent. Very happy with this product.
Body: This has been the best blender I have owned to date. I have tried many other brands and styles. This particular model (albeit not a fancy brand) has done a great job. We use it everyday for making smoothies and then again a couple of times a week for other meal related purposes (sauces, purees, etc.) It has held up great. Has pulse features as well as continuous blending. Straight forward and efficient. Unique lid offers air vent to let heat/steam vent while preventing splatters. Lid also features a pour spout which allows for easy pouring of liquids without drips/spills down the jar. Lastly, the glass jar is my personal preference as it does not etch/fade or get cloudy as some/most plastic jars do.

Author: Julie
Title: Great blender!
Body: It's a great blender! Very easy to use. It crushes all types of fruit with ease.

Author: AJWebster
Title: Blends smoothly and quickly
Body: I have tested this blender almost daily and it has made smoothies, pancake mix and drinks with ice with ease. It was smaller than I expected but that was me not doing a good job measuring when I ordered it. For the price it is fantastic and does a great job!

Author: Jason E Vanhee
Title: Great for the price
Body: We had an old, lame blender, and this was just what we needed at a very good price. Recommended.

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: This blender doesn't handle frozen fruit as well as I ...
Body: This blender doesn't handle frozen fruit as well as I expected. I have to add more liquid than I want to get it to grind the frozen chunks. And it absolutely liquefies ice cream before you can stop it. Kind of a contradiction, but those are my biggest complaints. I can't rationalize why it won't puree the frozen fruit when it does ice for pina coladas perfectly.

Author: Patricia Horton

Title: Spend a little more on something else, its worth it
Body: You get what you pay for, and the case is true here. While I by no means expected high quality from this blender, I did expect it to be a littler stronger than it is. I find that it gets stuck on frozen bananas or strawberries very often and I am constantly having to stop blending to stir up the contents and move the blockage. Not a huge complaint, but something that is annoying and is a general pain in my butt when im trying to rush out the door in the mornings. It also will emit a burning plastic smell, and some times the blades stop spinning (i can hear the motor spin, but nothings moving...) all in all, its not terrible. it DOES work, it DOES make me a tasty smoothie almost every morning, and it is AMAZINGLY easy to clean. But if i could go back, id spend a little more on something some more OOMPH and higher quality.

Author: D. LaRu
Title: Efficient 700 watt Blender
Body: This is a good blender that is 700 watts of powerl. I really want a 1000mg one but don't want to pay hundreds for it so I looked at the wattage for several on Amazon and found this at 700 watts. My smoothies are not creamy but they are perfect for me. This make frozen banana ice cream and with some mylk as a smoother, I get great vegan ice cream everytime. I hope that it lasts a long time as I hate to buy buy buy, that's why I so for name-brand kitchen appliances bc I feel that they will last longer. I've had this one 2.5 moths and I use it every single day to make my smoothies I'm using greens and frozen fruit with each smoothis. I blend the greens first then add the frozen fruit in cupfuls. So I use: 16oz H2o, 2-3 good hanfuls of greens, spinach or kale, mustard, dandilion or whatever else my CSA gives my each week, then I add 2-3 cups of frozen fruit plus a banana if desired, 2 Tbs prouted Flax and then stevia for sweetness if desired. The pour spout is nice and easy to use, the entire blender is super easy to clean. I am using recipes from JJ Smith's 30 day Green Smoothie lifestyle books and that's why I bought this blender. If you are new to eating real foods and changing habits, you'll probably want a blender that makes your food like baby food so you'll want a stronger wattage, but I'm very happy with theis blender.

Author: jonas190
Title: I like this. Seems to pull things down into the ...
Body: I like this. Seems to pull things down into the blades a lot better than the one it replaced. HOWEVER, it does not handle frozen fruit well for smoothies. I recommend loading it up with the frozen stuff before taking off for the gym or a run. Then when you get back, zap the stuff and it goes down no problem. Still cold, but a little softer and easier for it to handle. It doesn't do a great job with greens. They will blend but they won't get totally decimated like they would in a more expensive model. For me, it gets it done on a budget. I recommend it without reservation if this is what you have to spend right now. If you use a blender every day for thicker drinks, consider something stronger.

Author: Enlightened Chicken
Title: DO NOT Waste Your Money
Body: I opened a box marked Made in China with trepidation. My worry was confirmed as soon as I unwrapped the top. It is made of plastic so thin that it would be pierced by the first hard piece of food to hit it. That is, IF the motor would run hard enough to do anything at all. Remember those cheap toys, made in China of paper thin plastic that you used to buy as party favors? That's the same thickness of this top. Since we know that all gears made in China are now plastic, I have no doubt this blender will last just long enough for the warranty to expire (if you're lucky). Mine went back into the box immediately.

Being that the bowl is glass, I am not worried that the fruits, juices, and vegetables I'm blending will leave an after smell in the bowl (also like my previous one eventually did). The noise levels are about the same as my previous blender. The different blend options are the same as my previous blender except my previous had a turn dial whereas this one is push button. Overall, I am happy with my purchase.

Title: Doesn't seem to like Dishwasher...didn't even make it to a year.
Body: I use my blender a lot, however recently I noticed it started leaking. I finally seen that the bottom has a chip in it. I gave it three stars because this is supposed to be a dishwasher safe glass jar that is thermal-shock tested to withstand extreme temperature changes. Being I put mine in the dishwasher and I am the only one who handles, it shouldn't have a crack at the bottom. I went to replace the jar, as I like the blender but Hamilton Beach website states they are out of stock on the glass part. How does a website who makes the product go out of stock? On top of that, that tells me more people have to replace the glass part often for them to be out of stock. :-( Not happy...waiting on customer service to get back to me to see if I wasted $ when I purchased in January 2015.

Author: Adrien C
Title: Finally found an affordable multifunction blender ! Love it !
Body: I was looking for a blender to make some simple cocktail and milkshake, but i actually did not have much money to spend on it. After a few research i ended up on this item and i am so happy not to have spent more than 30 dollar on a blende, since this one did perfect cocktails (i used it a few times a week maximum)To my point of view, this blender is a great option for people looking for a smoothie maker that will not cost hundreds of dollars. When used properly, that means adding liquid to every recipe you put inside, it will be able to blend ice, fruit and vegetables though it will struggle a little bit if you put lots of leafy greens.This item should be able to make you frozen blended shakes or puree vegetables without any problem.However, don’t be dumb, this is what i would call « an amateur blender » ; it won’t be able to make nut butter, mix dough or grate coffee beans even though it has those options because the motor doesn’t have enough torque and will burn out if you try.The key thing to appreciate this product is not expecting a professional level quality from it or performance. If you’re not particular with the consistency of your smoothies but just want something affordable capable of basic blending functions then this machine is a very good choice.It was a good choice for me as it matches perfectly with what i expected from it.

Author: ClarissaRosen
Title: Five Stars

Title: Can't use with less than 12oz

Author: CBEL
Title: I like the glass jar of the blender
Body: I like the glass jar of the blender. Easy to use and clean. The blender works ok for the price. Works well if the jar is more than half full. Not recommended for smaller batches or grounding dry particles like spices/coffee beans. There is space at the bottom (below the blades). When I am trying to make smoothies, tiny particles, like chia seeds and even sugar, gets to the bottom of the blender, which really wasteful.The blades can be detached and cleaned thoroughly.

Once you push it on, good luck prying that thing off, especially when handling hot liquids. It actually doesn't bother me too much, because I just hold the lid on without actually pushing it on all the way. That does render the easy-pour spout useless for me, but it pours just fine out of the blender glass.

Author: BrooklynDave
Title: The B&D one made a wonderful smooth shake with frozen kale
Body: 700 Watts? I dunno. This is the same wattage as my previous Black & Decker Blender (http://www.amazon.com/Black-Decker-BL2500S-12-Speed-Blender/dp/B00AJX07EW). My roommate broke the glass jar for the B&D one. Thought this cheaper blender would be equivalent since the power is the same. Maybe the motor is strong but it doesn't grind up raw cashews for my morning shake. The B&D one made a wonderful smooth shake with frozen kale, raw cashews, protein power, etc. The photo is after 5 minutes of blending -- way more blending than I had to do with my B&D model. There were cashew junks the size of peas still in the bottom (you can't see them in this pic, but they were there). And the frozen kale was like flaked parsely. Maybe it's a defective blender or the blade is bad. I'm returning this.

Eventually I gave up and used my stick blender. I don't use this blender often. Mostly because I haven't found a good use for it. I would like to use it to blend herbs, puree baby food, make salad dressings, etc., but I have such a difficulty with it (and the sound is so loud) that I rarely pull it out of the cupboard.

Author: jim
Title: Lacks safety feature, blends OK-subpar, loud
Body: Edit: 12/8/150 stars!! Worst blender I've ever owned/seen! Didn't know I was a blender critic until I had such a bad one. At it's best it is mediocre and at it's worst it is awful. Spend an extra $10 or do some better research than I did before purchase.My biggest qualm with this blender is a safety issue, other than that it functions as an average blender, that operates loudly.The base spins whether or not you have the blender or the chopper attached to it. The buttons do not require you to press them completely down and into place before the unit turns on, and due to this, I have accidentally turned on the blender multiple times. Thankfully none have resulted in injury, but you can see how this is problematic.Aside from directly injuring yourself from the base, for me personally, the times I've accidentally turned it on it has startled me and the person next to me enough to drop a plate... if you have limited counter space, I can almost guarantee you that some point you will do the same thing... because inevitably something gets pushed into the sensitive buttons of the unit and turns it on. One workaround is to leave the unit unplugged obviously, but when you're multitasking, it tends not the be your first thought...In terms of how it operates as a blender, it's just OK, bordering on subpar. But for less than $30 what do you expect? I suppose...It does a poor job of chopping ice in a smoothie type drink, and requires you to leave it on for upwards of a minute if you're making something icy... and in the case of slushy mojitos, you're gonna want it on for a over a minute to get the right consistency.. it's very loud. It's significantly louder than any of the three vacuums I own (FYI one is a shop vac). Hence why the pairing of sensitive buttons with it's loud operation is especially troublesome... that and the fact that it takes much longer to blend than other traditional blenders or bullet type blenders...In terms of the chopping function, its OK... my stand-alone chopper works better, and has additional blades.... I find that this one gets whatever you're chopping clumped in areas and then just spins its wheels, not doing much... there's a fair amount of opening, mixing, and re-chopping to get anything done...My grade: C-

Title: I do ice
Body: I bought this blender for a specific use, crushing ice for beverages and thereby sparing the motor in our overpriced you can't use that, it's for special occasions blender. Exactly what those occasions would be I have yet to determine. Anyway, for my purposes, it is powerful if a tad noisy and even stuffed to capacity with ice cubes, it hasn't failed to get the job done and the lid seals on the glass jar securely as well. It's stable in operation and easy to clean.Now, it's been reported to me it functions efficiently for preparation of smoothies which I suppose is some sort of non-alcoholic coco loco?

Author: Veggielove
Title: I love the crystal clear thick glass pitcher; it made with quality!
Body: This is a powerful (motor) blender for the price! I love the crystal clear thick glass pitcher; it made with quality! It has convenient measurements embossed on the glass. Parts, blade, etc. removes for sterilization. I wash it immediately after use, so I haven't had to put it in the dishwasher, but I believe the glass and blade will do fine in the dishwasher. I recommend to wash the cover and plastic base part by hand. The plastic lid/cover is made not as strong as the motor base or the glass pitcher, this is why I would recommend washing this part in sudsy hot water. If you need a blender that blends to a super fine- smooth baby food puree texture- this blender will not blend to that fine of a consistency. The cover could be improved, but for the price it's really a quality product! It's a wonderful blender and it also blends ice into smoothies! It doesn't take up a lot of room. It's attractive and I can easily leave it on my kitchen counter. FYI...I didn't order the chopper, I have others.

The pitcher is a nice heavy glass which was a pleasant surprise and the buttons are very easy to press. My favorite setting is the milkshake, it blends it nice and smooth and you get a really nice texture to the shake. The only complaint I have is the cord is very short so it makes it difficult to have it set up in certain places. Other then that I am very happy with the quality and speed of the blend.
